loans.name: Janet

texts.en: A dedicated client of LAPO who is happy with her business, Janet E. is a 40-year-old married woman with three children. She hails from Benin City in Edo State. She has been in this business since 1987 and hopes to buy more provisions and drinks with the loan.

loans.use: To buy more provisions & drinks for sale

loans.name: Docas

texts.en: Docas is a poultry farmer and she is happy with her kind of business. She raises birds & buys bird feed. She is 64 years of age and a married mother of 6 children. She hopes to expand her business with the above amount of $800 by buying more birds and feed. She has been in this business since 1999 and been a LAPO leader for 6 years.

loans.use: To buy more birds & bird feed

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: A dedicated LAPO client who is a secretary in her group, Beatrice is 35 years old with 3 children and lives in Benin City, Edo State. She was trained in pharmacy at a hospital. She is anxious to get the requested amount of $325 to enable her to buy more drugs for sale in her shop. She has been in this business since 2005.

loans.use: To buy more drugs for sale

loans.name: Lukia

texts.en:
Lukia is 28 years old and operates a restaurant in Buguruni, a Dar es Salaam city suburb. She has been in business for the past three years. In her restaurant, she prepares common dishes like rice, Ugali, banana and other various meals. She opens up her restaurant at six in the morning for breakfast, prepares lunch, and closes late in the evening.

She wants to expand her restaurant, and thus is in need of more resources to buy more plates, containers, tables and chairs. She would like to borrow USD 550 to purchase these supplies.

loans.use: Improve business by purchasing plates, containers, tables, and chairs.

loans.name: Ulviya

texts.en:
Ms. Ulviya is a low income, vulnerable person. She is 25, married, with two children, and lives in the village of Saatli in south-central Azerbaijan.
Ulviya and her husband (shown in the picture) run family business together. Ulviya grazes cows while her husband sells beef in the Saatli town. The beef is in great demand, but the business still needs more capital. To increase the monthly turnover, Ulviya and her husband decided to apply for a loan of US$500 to the Saatli branch of Normicro. They need to buy additional cattle to expand their herd, and hope that in 6 months the income from their business will be increased by up to 20%, allowing them to make a US$500 profit from each cow.

loans.use: Purchase of a cow

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Mrs. Patricia I. is 51 years old, married, and has 8 children. Patricia is a dynamic client of LAPO who sells provisions and drinks to the community. She has been in this business since 2001. She said that with this business she is able to send her children to school. She is eager to buy more provisions and drinks and expand her business if the US$550 amount is approved for her.

loans.use: To buy more provisions & drinks

loans.name: Allahverdi

texts.en:
Mr. Allahverdi is a low income, vulnerable person. He is 40, married, with four children, and lives in the village of Saatli in south-central Azerbaijan.
Allahverdi and his son (shown in the picture) run family business together. Allahverdi sells beef in the local market while his son grazes cattle. The business is promising, and Allahverdi has applied for a loan of US$1000 to the Saatli branch of Normicro. Once he receives the loan, he plans to buy four calfs, breed them and sell in a half a year. The income from each cow will be two times more then Allahverdi will have spent for their purchase (the price of each calf is US$250 while that of a cow - US$500).

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Jabir

texts.en: Mr. Jabir is a low-income vulnerable person. He is 29, married with two children, and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Jabir buys calves in one season of the year and sells bred animals in another. The more calves in his herd, the higher income he makes. That's why Jabir applied for $1000 loan to Normicro Saatli branch. After receiving the loan, he will buy four calves more, and next year in autumn his income will be much higher.

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en: Jovita is 26 years old and owns a salon in the Ilala area, in central Dar Es Salaam city. She has been running the salon for the past five years. Recently her salon has gained in popularity and the number of customers has increased. She now wants to buy a dryer, cosmetics, modern salon chairs, and get a small generator, so as to overcome the power problem which affects her business heavily. She is therefore in need of USD 350 to cater for all this.

loans.use: Improve business

loans.name: Khudaverdi

texts.en: Mr. Khudaverdi is a low-income vulnerable person. He is 46, married with three children, and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Khudaverdi sells milk in the local market but the market's demand is much higher than Khudaverdi can offer. That's why he applied for $1000 loan from the Normicro Saatli branch. Khudaverdi plans to buy one pedigreed cow. It will increase his monthly income and let him to send his daughter to school this autumn.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Tazagyul

texts.en: Ms. Tazagyul is a low-income vulnerable person. She is 48, married with one child, and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Tazagyul and her son (he is shown in the picture) run the family business together. She sells milk in Saatli town, while her son takes care of their cows. The income is too low to support the family.  That’s why Tazagyul applied to Norwegian Microcredit Saatli branch for a $1000 loan to buy one more pure-bred cow to make her monthly income higher. In the Caucasus region, the price of a good cow is about 800-1000 USD. Tazagyul has some savings of her own to add to the loan.

loans.use: To buy pedigreed cow

loans.name: Alimammad

texts.en:
Mr. Alimammad is a low income vulnerable person. He is 52, married with four children and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.
Alimammad sells various sorts of fuel. His younger son helps him and sells the fuel for vehicles, tractors and other farm machinery. In farming seasons there is great demand in fuels and Alimammad plans to buy additional tank to store another sort of kerosene. For this purpose he applied for $1000 loan to Normicro Saatli branch and he hope he would be lucky.

loans.use: To buy a petrol tank

loans.name: Aladdin

texts.en:
Mr. Aladdin is a low income vulnerable person. He is 48, married with three children and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.
Aladdin has a small shop and sells mixed goods. He cannot develop his business, because he has no collateral to get loan from commercial banks. And he can hardly provide his shop-assistant with salary.That is why he applied for $1000 loan free of collateral to Normicro Saatli branch and now he is waiting for some investments from KIVA lenders to increase variety of goods he sells. The higher income could help him to develop business and support his family independently without credit.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Laurida

texts.es:
Business Description

Laurida began her business 1 year ago. The products she sells are: chuzos, (an Ecuadorian skewered-meat snack), chicken wings and roasted corn on the cob. She provides her customers with personal service every day from 4 to 10 pm.

Purpose of Loan

Laurida needs the loan to invest in the purchase a small display cabinet, more products and to fix up her business. This way she will be able to improve her business’ image and offer a wider variety of good to her customers.

Personal Information

Laurida is 58 years old. She has 1 son who is an adult and lives independently. Laurida began her business with a small amount of borrowed capital. As time has passed she has gained a great deal of experienced yet has found it difficult to grow the business due to lack of financing. She runs the business from her home.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Laurida inicio su negocio hace 1 año. Los productos que vende son: chuzos, alas de pollo y choclos asados. La atención de su clientela la realiza de manera personal todos los días desde las 4-a -10pm.

Uso del Préstamo

Laurida necesita del préstamo para invertir en la compra de una vitrina pequeña, más productos y arreglar el sitio de su negocio. De esta manera podra tener una mejor imagen para su negocio y podra ofrecer una variedad mas amplia de productos a sus clientes.

Información Personal

Laurida tiene 58 años. Tiene 1 hijo que es mayor e independiente. Laurida inicio con un pequeño capital solicitado a un prestamista. Ha pesar del tiempo y la experiencia en el negocio se le ha hecho difícil crecer por problemas de financiamiento. El negocio lo atiende en las afueras de su casa.

loans.use:
Purchase a display cabinet

Comprar una vitrina

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen M. is a hard working mother of seven who has suffered from a broken home due to a divorce with her husband. With seven children to take care of, she became a member of GHAPE.  Before receiving her first loan she was trained in business management, marketing techniques, and credit discipline. Since then, she has been able to invest and repay all her loans with which she raised money to buy good food for her household, pay school fees, buy medications, and increase her business.

Given a loan of $800, she plans to do gardening and rear pigs so she can sell them. Given the fact that pigs take long to fatten, she plans to cultivate and sell vegetables so she can have short term turn over and start repaying her loan. The money raised will be used to build a house for her family and to pay the children’s school fees. 
She plans to pay her loan in 24 months. Her first loan repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Purchase of pigs, pig feed, seeds, capital for her son

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Born in 1942, Monica A. is married and is a mother of seven children and several grandchildren. Her source of happiness has always been to see all her children educated or learn a trade, but this was shattered because her husband’s low wage labour could not meet her desires. This motivated her to sought help and become a member of GHAPE where she was trained in business management, marketing techniques, and credit discipline. Since then, she has invested and repaid all her loans with which she raised money to assist her husband to pay school fees for her children.

Given a loan of $1000, she plans to fatten and sell pigs and cultivate vegetables and raise money to continue paying her children’s school fees and to increase her business. Given the fact that pig fattening take some time, the sale of her vegetables will enable her start repaying her loan when time comes. She plans to pay her loan in 24 months. Her first loan repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers, pig feed, and transport

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase piglets, pig feed, and vaccine

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en: Jeannette is married and a mother of seven. Having lost her mother at an early age, she did not have the  opportunity to go to school because of lack of finances. Her husband’s meager job is not sufficient to cater for the needs of their seven children, so she had to start doing some business to support him. In 2005, she obtained her first loan of $40 with which she started the business of selling roasted fish and raised enough profits to pay school fees for her children. Given a loan of $600, she plans to open a grocery store, continue in the former business line, save some money, and continue educating her children. She plans to pay her loan in 18 months. The first installment repayment shall be on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase of grocery, fish, and oil

loans.name: Silvia Nelly

texts.es:
Silvia is a very active and enterprising woman. She is married and has six children, two who are still in school. Her husband has a small mechanic shop, but he doesn't make enough to cover all the basic family needs. In order to earn extra income, Silvia started her own business selling jewelry and cosmetics 17 years ago. A little while later she also started a business selling Mexican food with help from her children, and thanks to the good service they offered they were quite successful and demand for their dishes increased.

To keep growing her business and get more ingredients to make her foods, Silvia is requesting a loan of $650, which she plans to repay within six months. With your help, contributing to this business' development, this family's life can improve. Thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Silvia es una mujer emprendedora y muy activa, está casada y tiene seis hijos, dos de ellos aun estudian. Su esposo tiene un pequeño taller mecánico pero el ingreso que obtiene no es suficiente para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia, para poder obtener un ingreso extra Silvia inició su propio negocio con la venta de joyería y cosméticos hace 17 años. Hace poco también emprendió un negocio donde vende comida mexicana, donde recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, y gracias al buen servicio que ofrecen han tenido mucho éxito, la demanda por sus platillos es muy buena.

Para poder continuar creciendo con su negocio y adquirir más insumos que necesita para la elaboración de sus comidas Silvia está solicitando un préstamo de $ 650 dólares que se compromete a devolver en 6 meses. Con tu ayuda puedes mejorar la vida de esta familia, contribuyendo al desarrollo de su negocio, muchas gracias.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Karen Ivonne

texts.es:
Karen is a young mother of 3-year-old son and 2-month-old baby. She's married, and her husband works for a local business In Monterrey, Nuevo León, where they both are from. Four years ago, to cover the costs of her studies, Karen started her own business selling food at a post her father gave to her. Fortunately, high demand for her products has allowed her to grow her small business.

Currently, Karen wants to add some new life to her business. With the birth of her baby, more expenses have arisen and she needs a loan of $475 to purchase ingredients and supplies so she can increase her production and improve her quality of service. She plans to repay the loan within three months. You can be a part of Karen's success. She is very grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Karen es una joven madre de un pequeñito de tres años y un bebé de sólo dos meses de edad. Ella está casada y su esposo trabaja como empleado en una empresa de Monterrey, Nuevo León de donde son originarios. Hace cuatro años, para poder cubrir los costos de sus estudios, Karen emprendió su propio negocio con la venta de comidas en un puesto que le regaló su papá, afortunadamente la buena demanda que tiene le ha permitido crecer como microempresaria.

En estos momentos Karen desea darle un nuevo impulso a su negocio, con el nacimiento de su bebé se le presentaron algunos gastos y necesita de un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos, con lo que podrá incrementar su producción y mejorar la calidad de su servicio, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Forma parte de los logros de Karen y apóyala, ella agradece mucho esta oportunidad que le brindas.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es:
Maria is originally from Monterrey, Nuevo León, and has two kids, ages 5 and 13. She lives with her common-law husband, and the salary that he receives is insufficient to cover all the household expenses. Being a very enterprising woman, Maria started her own business selling cookware three years ago. She works at open markets, and with the help of her oldest son she has been able to increase the variety of products they offer.

To keep the business growing as it has to this point, Maria is requesting a loan of $475, which she will use to purchase supplies to meet her customers' demands and stay in their favor. She plans to repay the loan within three months. You can help this family by contributing to the growth of their business. They are very thankful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Maria del Socorro es originaria de Monterrey, Nuevo León, tiene dos hijos de 5 y 13 años de edad, aún vive en unión libre con su pareja y el salario que él obtiene como empleado es muy bajo para solventar todos los gastos de su hogar, por lo que Maria siendo una mujer emprendedora, inició su propio negocio con la venta de artículos para cocina hace tres años, ella se instala en los mercados rodantes y con la ayuda de su hijo mayor han hecho crecer su negocio incrementando la variedad de productos que ofrecen.

Para continuar creciendo como hasta ahora Maria necesita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes y continuar con su preferencia, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Tú puedes ayudar a esta familia contribuyendo al crecimiento de su negocio, muchas gracias por tu apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.es:
Ludivina is a married mother of a 14-year-old son. They are originally from Cadereyta, Nuevo León. Her husband works at a local factory, but his salary is very low. To improve her family's quality of life, a year ago Ludivina decided to start her own business selling shoes. She started selling to her neighbors and loved ones but thanks to her quality of service she soon found success and increased her number of clients.

Now, thanks to the high quality of products she offers, she has many orders to supply and needs a $475 loan, which she plans to repay within four months. Ludivina is grateful for the opportunity to improve and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Ludivina es casada y tiene un hijo de 14 años de edad, ellos son originarios de Cadereyta en Nuevo León, su esposo trabaja como obrero en una fábrica de la localidad pero recibe un salario muy bajo y para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia hace un año Ludivina decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de zapatos, comenzó a vender entre sus vecinos y amistades pero gracias al buen servicio que ofrece pronto logró incrementar su número de clientes.

Ahora, gracias a la buena calidad de los productos que comercializa, tiene muchos pedidos por surtir y necesita de un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que se compromete a devolver en 4 meses. Ludivina agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas de mejorar y hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco is a hard-working man. He's married and has two young daughters, ages 6 and 12. Household expenses increased by a lot when his daughters started school, and to offer his family a higher quality of life, Francisco decided, along with his regular job, to start a business selling footwear and jewelry two years ago. His wife helps him with the sales, and together they have been able to grow the business. They started out with few supplies but thanks to good response from their clients they have decided to increase the variety and quality of their products.

To increase their merchandise, Francisco is requesting a loan of $475, which he plans to repay within five months, with the hope of meeting his customers' demands and continue growing. With your support, you can help this family and their business. They are very grateful for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Francisco es un hombre muy trabajador, está casado y tiene dos pequeñas hijas, de 6 y 12 años de edad, los gastos de su hogar se incrementaron mucho con las colegiaturas de sus hijas y para poder ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, además del empleo que tiene Francisco decidió emprender su negocio con la venta de calzado y joyería hace dos años, su esposa le ayuda en las ventas y juntos han logrado hacer crecer su negocio, iniciaron vendiendo poca mercancía pero al ver que era bien aceptada por sus clientes han decidido incrementar la variedad y cantidad de los productos que comercializan.

Para poder surtir mejor su negocio Francisco solicita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que se compromete a regresar en 5 meses, con lo que espera cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y continuar creciendo. Con tu ayuda podrás ayudar a esta familia, ellos necesitan y agradecen mucho tu apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo lives in Cadereya, Nuevo León. He's married and has five children, all of whom are also married. Due to the difficulty in finding employment, a year ago Eduardo started his own business selling clothes and shoes. He works at open markets and is helped by his wife, and together they have been able to move the business forward. It is their only source of income. The quality of their products and the good service they offer has allowed them to quickly increase their clientele.

To keep the business growing, Eduardo is requesting a loan of $275, which he will use to purchase merchandise to offer a wider variety to his clients. He plans to repay the loan within three months. Eduardo and his wife are very grateful for your confidence and support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

En la localidad de Cadereya, Nuevo León vive Eduardo, está casado y tiene cinco hijos, todos ellos ya casados. Ante la dificultad para obtener un empleo Eduardo emprendió su propio negocio hace un año, vendiendo ropa y zapatos, se instala en los mercados rodantes y recibe la ayuda de su esposa, juntos han logrado salir adelante con su negocio ya que este es su única fuente de ingresos, la calidad y el buen servicio que ofrecen de los productos que comercializan les han permitido incrementar su número de clientes rápidamente.

Para continuar creciendo Eduardo está solicitando un préstamo de $ 275 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes, él se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 3 meses. Hoy puedes ayudar a quien más lo necesita, Eduardo y su esposa agradecen mucho la confianza y apoyo que les brindas.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.es:
Rosenda is 33 years old, lives in the town of Cadereyta in the state of Nuevo León and is married with two kids in school. Fortunately her husband was able to buy a house for the family, but with the mortgage payments his take-home salary is reduced significantly. So Rosenda searched for a job in which she could work from her house and take care of the children, and that was how she started her grocery store one year ago. At first she had little stocked but thanks to strong demand she soon increased the variety of products offered.

Rosenda is currently applying for a six month $475 loan which she will use to better stock her store and continue its growth. The family is sincerely grateful for your contribution to the growth of the business and your helping hand.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosenda tiene 33 años de edad, vive en la localidad de Cadereyta en Nuevo León, está casada y tiene dos hijos que se encuentran estudiando, afortunadamente su esposo pudo adquirir su propia vivienda pero le descuentan las hipotecas de su salario, lo que reduce mucho su ingreso, ante esta necesidad Rosenda, para no descuidar a sus hijos, buscó una actividad que le permitiera trabajar en su casa y así fue como inició su tienda de abarrotes hace un año, tenía poco surtido pero gracias a la buena demanda que tenía pronto fue incrementando la variedad de productos que comercializa.

Hoy Rosenda está solicitando un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para tener mejor surtida su tienda y continuar creciendo, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Contribuye al desarrollo de este negocio y ayuda a esta familia, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Increase the variety and stock of her grocery store

loans.name: Ana Delia

texts.es:
Ana Delia is an enterprising young woman. 25 years old and married with a one year old and a six year old, these children are the reason she started selling shoes through catalog three years ago. It's difficult to cover household expenses on her husband's salary alone now with the mortgage payments after the purchase of their house. By selling shoes through a catalog, she is able to help the family economically and take care of the children at the same time.

Her business first started among friends and family and fortunately now has a large number of clients. Ana has been growing professionally through her business. To stock up for all her orders Ana is requesting a $475 loan, to be paid back in six months. Ana is grateful to you for providing the opportunity to continue expanding her business and improving the quality of its service.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

Ana Delia es una joven emprendedora, tiene 25 años de edad, está casada y es madre de dos pequeños de 6 y 1 año de edad, ellos han sido el motivo por el cual inició su propio negocio con la venta de calzado por catálogo hace tres años, ya que el salario que recibe su esposo se ve reducido por el pago de las hipotecas de su casa, era difícil cubrir todos los gastos y es de esta manera como Ana puede ayudarle y al mismo tiempo cuidar de sus hijos, afortunadamente el negocio que inició entre sus familiares y amigos ahora tiene una amplia cartera de clientes y ha estado creciendo con su negocio.

Para poder surtir todos los pedidos que tiene Ana está solicitando un préstamo de $ 475 dólares, mismos que promete regresar en 6 meses y empleará en la compra de mercancía. ella agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas de continuar creciendo con su negocio y mejorar la calidad del servicio que ofrece.

loans.use: Stock up on shoes for her current orders

loans.name: Silvia Ivonne

texts.es:
Silvia is an enterprising woman with big dreams of moving ahead in the world. She is separated from her husband, and due to the difficulty of finding gainful employment she decided to start her own business selling shoes and undergarments two years ago, joining forces with one of her friends. Fortunately, the two of them have been able to make the business grow, and thanks to Silvia's personable character, their clientele grows daily.

To supply their customers orders and to offer them a quality service, Silvia is requesting a loan of $750, which she plans to repay within six months. You can have a part in Silvia's success. She is very thankful for the opportunity to improve and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Silvia es una mujer emprendedora con grandes deseos de salir adelante, ella está separada de su esposo y ante la dificultad para encontrar un empleo decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de zapatos y ropa interior hace dos años, asociándose con una de sus amigas, afortunadamente entre las dos han hecho crecer el negocio y gracias al carácter de Silvia, que se le facilita relacionarse con las personas, su número de clientes se incrementa día con día.

Para poder surtir los pedidos que tiene y ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes, Silvia está solicitando un crédito de $ 750 dólares que se compromete a regresar en 6 meses. Forma parte de los logros de Silvia, ella agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas de mejorar y hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Lita

texts.es:
Lita belongs to the communal bank "El Alto Mayo" and is dedicated to selling groceries and grains. Her shop is located at the Grau Market in Rioja, San Martin. Lita is 32 years old, married and has a 10-year-old son, her daily inspiration at home and at work. She attracts clients thanks to her charisma, and also because she treats them cordially and has a well-stocked store. Lita is requesting an $800 loan, which she plans to invest in the purchase of four sacks of rice, four sacks of sugar, 24 liters of oils, grains, peas, beans, corn, drinks, soap and other products that her clients demand.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Lita pertenece al Banco Comunal "El Alto Mayo", se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y granos, su local está ubicado en el Mercado Grau de la Localidad de Rioja en el Departamento de San Martín. Tiene 32 años de edad, es casada y tiene un niño de 10 años, motivo de su lucha y dedicación constante en sus actividades diarias de casa y de su negocio. Se considera independiente para decidir y manejar su negocio. Por su carisma atrae a sus clientes además de atenderlas con cordialidad y tener un negocio surtido. El préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/ 2,500.00 soles (US$ 790.00) lo invertirá en la compra de 4 sacos de arroz, 4 socos de azúcar, 24 litros de aceite de diferentes marcas, granos como menestras (sacos de 50Kg.), alberja partida, frejol blanco, frejol amarillo, maíz cuzco, maíz para cancha, canario ( 01 saco de cada uno), jaboncillos y jabones (01 caja), refrescos en cajitas pequeñas (04 docenas), conservas de pescado (04 cajas de diferentes marcas), y otros productos más que los clientes lo requieran.

loans.use: Purchase high-demand products

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela belongs to the communal bank "Las Abejitas" in Moyabamba, San Martín, and is dedicated to selling groceries, clothing, ceramics and gifts for all occasions. She also sells food on evenings and Sundays. She decided to start her business because it's something she likes doing. Her store is located in her home, which allows her to easily spend time working and performing her household duties. Manuela is 40 and has four children. She's a very optimistic and hard-working woman who loves her business. Her goal is to have a mini-market and satisfy all her customers' various needs.

Manuela is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase rice, sugar, milk, noodles, etc. as well as personal-hygiene and domestic products like detergent, soaps and brooms to stock her business and meet her clients' demands. She also brings in items from the coast when the opportunity arises.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Manuela I. pertenece al Banco Comunal "Las Abejitas", radica en la ciudad de Moyabamba, en el Departamento de San Martín. y se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, ropas, adornos de cerámica, y regalos para todo tipo de ocasión, también vende anticuchos por las noches y comida los domingos. Decidió iniciar su negocio por que es una actividad que a ella le gusta, el negocio es en su casa, lo que le permite compartir su tiempo entre el negocio y las tareas domesticas sin mayores dificultades. Tiene 40 años y 4 hijos, es una persona muy optimista y trabajadora que le encanta el negocio, su meta es tener su minimarket y poder satisfacer las múltiples necesidades de sus clientes. Con el Crédito otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,500.00 ( $ 790.00 ), implementará su negocio comprando sacos de arroz y azúcar, cajas de leche, aceite, y conservas de pescado, paquetes de fideos, también implementará con productos de bazar como productos de aseo personal y de limpieza para el hogar como detergente, jabones, escobas y otros productos por docenas para surtir su negocio y así satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Cuando se presenta la ocasión también trae artefactos de la costa para venderlos en Moyabamba.

loans.use: Purchase needed food and domestic products

loans.name: Selfa

texts.es:
Selfa belongs to the communal bank "La Amistad del Dorado" and lives in Moyabama, San Martín. She's dedicated to selling regional dishes. In the mornings it's dishes like tamales, and in the afternoons, when she also tends to her home, it's different regional meals. On the weekends, she sells cebiche, a local favorite made with fish and lime. She decided to start her business because she realized it's something she likes to do and there was no competition in her neighborhood. She runs the business out of her home, and thus generates her own income. Selfa is 39 and has three children, who help with the business and household chores. Her goal is to have a deep-rooted eatery with a pleasant ambiance where she can give her customers a high-quality service and at the same time provide work to people in the community.

She's requesting a loan of $250 to improve the ambiance in her home, which she works on afternoons and nights, paint it appropriate colors for an eatery, purchase tablecloths and glass for her tables, and also purchase plates, cutlery and products that she uses daily to make her various dishes like rice, corn, oil, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Selfa C. pertenece al Banco Comunal "La Amistad del Dorado", vive en la ciudad de Moyabamba, en el Departamento de San Martín, se dedica la venta de refrigerios por las mañanas como tamales, humitas y juanes, y por las tardes también atiende en su propia casa con comidas de la región como juanes, cecina con tacacho y otros, los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de cebiche. Decidió iniciar su negocio porque se dio cuenta de que le gusta esta actividad y no tiene competencia en el medio donde vive, el negocio está en su casa, así genera sus propios ingresos. El negocio ha crecido, por ello decidió ampliar su casa. Tiene 39 años y 3 hijos, quienes ahora le apoyan en el negocio y las actividades de la casa, su meta es tener una cebicheria bien implementada con un grato ambiente y poder dar un servicio de calidad a sus clientes y a la vez dar trabajo a personas de la comunidad. Con el préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/ 800.00 ( $ 250.00 ), mejorará el ambiente que tiene en su propia casa, donde por las tarde y noches desarrolla su negocio, pintará el local con colores apropiados para este tipo de negocio, comprará manteles y vidrios para sus mesas, también se implementará con platos, cubiertos, y productos que diariamente necesita para preparar los diversos platos que vende, como arroz en sacos, maíz para los tamales, aceite y otros.

loans.use: Improve ambiance and purchase supplies for eatery

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora belongs to the communal bank "Santa Ana" in Moyabamba, San Martín. She is dedicated to selling beauty products out of her salon where she tends to her friends and other clients who come in daily. She studied cosmetology at a higher-learning institute and decided to start her own business, generate her own income and grow personally and professionally. She's 45 years old and has four children. She's content with what she's accomplished and satisfied by her results up to now as her clientele has risen. Her goal is to complete construction of shops to rent out.

She is requesting a loan of $800, which she will use to improve her salon by purchasing specialized furniture like hair-washing stations and necessary equipment like mirrors, scissors and hair dryers. She also plans to pain her salon and purchase wholesale products from Placenta Life, who provide her most popular and most used products.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Teodora G. pertenece al Banco Comunal "Santa Ana", radica en Moyabamba, en el Departamento de San Martín, y se dedica la venta de productos de belleza en su salón de estética en donde a tiende a sus amigas (os) y demás clientes que acuden a diario. Estudió Cosmetología en un Instituto Superior por lo decidió iniciar su propio negocio y de esa manera generar sus propios ingresos y crecer como persona y profesional. Tiene 45 años y 4 hijos, esta contenta con lo que hace y satisfecha por los resultados obtenidos hasta la fecha, su clientela aumentó. Su meta es completar su proyecto que es la construcción de departamentos para alquilar . El préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,500.00 ( $ 790.00 ), lo invertirá para mejorar su local, comprando muebles especiales para salón de belleza como una lavadora de cabellos, un porta materiales e instrumentos de trabajo y equipos necesarios como espejos, cortadora y secadora de cabello profesional, pintado del local, también comprará productos de belleza al por mayor ( producto Placenta Life) que es la línea que mas vende y usa para atender a sus clientas.

loans.use: Purchase furniture and equipment for beauty salon

loans.name: Sago

texts.en: Sago P. is a new member to the program. She used to be a teacher. She spent eleven years teaching and resigned two years ago, because she felt that she needed to raise her children herself. With the taxi they have, it was given to her by her brother in New Zealand to help her with looking after her sick mother that can’t walk. The car use to be a private car, but when Sago resigned, she register the car to be a taxi so that they can have earn money to survive.  Sago has three children, 1 girl and two boys, and all of them are attending school in the town area. Which Sago believes it’s best for her kids. Her husband is now driving the taxi, which she also believes its best instead of hiring someone else that will cost money. Apart from their taxi business, they also work in their taro plantation that’s giving them extra earning for the family. With her first loan, she used it to buy white vehicle paint to paint their taxi. And she’s now requesting for her next loan to buy spare tires for their taxi, because she feels that their taxi tires should be replaced soon.

loans.use: Buy spare tires and pay for service fees for overhauling of the car engine.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Nguyễn Thị Phượng, 41 years old, lives with her husband and their 2 children in Sóc Sơn, a district just outside of Hà Nội. She opened her restaurant in 1994 with the fund that she received that year. Now her restaurant is a familiar address to the locals. At first, only breakfast was served. As the popularity of the restaurant grows so do the operating hours. Now it is open from morning till night. The restaurant's menu offers more choices than ever: poultry, pork, pork's tripes ...etc. It also offers a catering service. In 2005, Ms Phượng expanded her restaurant from 50 square meters to over 200 square meters (1800 square feet). Her husband, Nguyễn Văn Đồng, and their 2 daughters give her a hand in running the restaurant. The monthly revenue from the restaurant is 200-300 USD. Ms Phượng requests a loan of 1200 USD to buy a fridge and more produce for her restaurant.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Chị Nguyễn Thị Phượng, 41 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và hai con tại Sóc Sơn, một huyện ngoại thành Hà Nội. Bắt đầu kinh doanh dịch vụ ăn uống từ khi vào Quỹ năm 1994 đến nay, cửa hàng chị đã trở thành một địa chỉ quen thuộc đối với người dân địa phương. Khởi đầu bằng việc bán hàng ăn sáng, dần dần việc bán hàng chiếm thời gian của chị Phượng từ sáng đến tối. Số loại thực phẩm cửa hàng cung cấp cũng tăng lên: thịt gà, lòng lợn, ... nhận đặt cơm. Năm 2005 chị quyết định mở rộng cửa hàng ăn từ 50 lên 200 mét vuông. Anh Nguyễn Văn Đồng, chồng chị, và hai cô con gái ngoài thời gian đi học đều rất tích cực hỗ trợ mẹ trong việc bán hàng. Với mức thu nhập hàng tháng từ 200-300 USD, chị làm đơn xin vay 1200 USD để mua tủ lạnh bảo quản thức ăn cùng thực phẩm phục vụ cho việc bán hàng.

loans.use: buy fridge and food for her restaurant

loans.name: Hoa Thi

texts.vi:
With a loan of 50 USD, Ms Hoa Thi M. opened her first stand, selling goods, 13 years ago. She could never imagine that one day she would be an owner of a big store like the one today. "I was only 23, newly wed. I had no experience". She did not have a house nor any land, her only hope was that the revenue from her little stand would be enough to cover her daily expenses. Hard working, determination and discipline had enabled her to always repay her loan on time every week. Because of this, her fund limit raised higher and higher each round. Her revenue grew and grew. Ms M. had purchased a 150 square meters space in a prime location in Sóc Sơn. She had built a 3 storey house with a store selling goods on the first floor. Her 2 children don't have to worry about the expenses for their schooling anymore. Ms M. is requesting a loan of 1200 USD to buy more products for her store.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Bắt đầu với mức vốn vay 50 USD để mở một hiệu tạp hóa nhỏ cách đây 13 năm, có lẽ không khi nào chị Hoa Thi M. lại hình dung ra mình sẽ là chủ một cửa hàng lớn như bây giờ: "Khi ấy tôi mới lập gia đình, mới 23 tuổi, chưa có kinh nghiệm kinh doanh". Không có nhà, không có đất, chị Hoa chỉ mong nguồn thu nhập từ hiệu tạp hóa nhỏ bé này đủ để trang trải cho những khoản chi phí hàng ngày. Với tính cần cù, chịu khó, năng nhặt chặt bị giúp chị quen dần với cách hoàn trả tuần của Quỹ Tình thương. Mức vốn vay qua các vòng được tăng dần, hiệu quả kinh tế ngày càng cao, chị Hoa đã mua được 150 mét đất mặt đường huyện Sóc Sơn. Chị đã xây được nhà 3 tầng và dành một diện tích 50 mét cho việc bán hàng. Hai con của chị giờ đây cũng không phải lo lắng khi xin mẹ tiền học phí. Chị đang xin vay mức vốn 1200 USD để tăng lượng hàng xuất nhập hàng ngày.

loans.use: buy confectionary, wine, milk for her grocery store

loans.name: Munira

texts.en: Munira is an experienced businesswoman. She worked in the market for over 10 years. Her business is trade of towels and bedclothes. She has two places of trade, and her son helps her in one of her trade places. She buys her goods from Istaravshan wholesale market in the district of Khujand. She began her business by trading perfumes; gradually, she changed her goods to towels and bedclothes. She says that from these goods she receives more profit then from perfumes. Today she has many constant clients. Her turnover of her goods is high. Now she wants to expand her assortment by including big towels from China. She is going to order from her friend. For this purpose, she is requesting $1200.

loans.use: Expand business by ordering big towels from China.

loans.name: Bahtiior

texts.en: Bahtiior has been engaged in business for over 5 years. His business is trade of vegetables such as potatoes, carrots, and onions. His business place is located in the Gafurov wholesale market in the district of Khujand, Tajikistan. The process of his business consists of buying the big batch of vegetables (400-600 kg), then he sorts them into sacks and sells them in his trade place. He says that he sells two or three sacks of vegetables every day. He has good turnover of his working capital, but one of his problems is transportation of the sacks of vegetables. He is requesting $800 to purchase one cart for his business.

loans.use: Purchase cart for transportation of vegetables.

loans.name: Grandesio

texts.en:
N. Grandensio is a very hard working lady aged 55. She is a mother of two working boys, and also supports four other young dependants. All four attend, school- one is in Grade 5 while the other three are in secondary school.

N. sells matoke (a plantain banana dish popular in Uganda) and charcoal at Seguku, a small township along the Kampala – Entebbe road. She has been in this business for over 20 years and this has enabled her to educate her two boys and build a commercial building which houses her business.

Her first loan was for $110 and her second, third and fourth loans were for $280. N. uses part of her loans to support her business and part to finishing up the house.

In a good day she earns about $110 selling charcoal and matoke. She provides the kids with scholastic materials, food as well as clothes. She is happy to be helping these children and says it creates a smile on her face because the future is bright for them.

loans.use: She would like to buy 20 bags of cement, three lorry-loads of sand and one metal door to finish construction of her commercial house which will later give her rental income.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
T. Maria is 67 years old and a mother of five. T. is an enterprising lady who supports herself through various sources of income despite all her children being financially dependant.

She has a small hall which she rents out and in which she screens English Premiership matches and Nigerian video shows. This earns her $85 per month. She has also installed a water tank in her home and sells water at $0.056 per 20 litres. In addition to this, she has a grocery stall in front of her house from which she earns about $2 a day.

T.'s video hall needs renovating to attract more customers and earn more rent. The hall needs plastering and some parts of the floor need to be cemented. Thus, T. is asking for a loan of $800.

loans.use: To buy cement and sand for renovating her video hall.

loans.name: Rosi

texts.en:
Rosi F. has been in business for more than 5 years now. When she first started her business, she did not have much equipment, but still managed to start with a little production. From the small amount of income she earned, she bought ingredients for her business, leaving her with only about $20 profit a week. With her years in business, she felt that she needed to increase her production in order for her to earn a good profit, but her problem was that she did not have enough equipment.

She joined SPBD and borrowed US$300 which she used to buy the biggest pot she could find for cooking her pork buns, and also a gas stove to replace the old kerosene stove that she didn’t like because it gave her buns a kerosene smell. She is now very happy with the improvements to her business and is now looking at expanding it by making banana chips to go together with her pork buns.

Rosi sells her products at their village primary school five days a week, and she is very favored by the students because she’s a very funny lady. She explained it’s her personality that’s marketing her business. She’s a sixty-year-old mother of three grown-up children, and her husband is an engineer. She is a very active lady who is willing to stay longer in the program.

loans.use: To purchase additional cooking equipment and raw materials for the business

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
N. Margaret is a mother of two, a boy and a girl. Her son is in secondary school and her daugher is already employed. N. operates a retail shop located in Namutanda trading centre. She has been running this business for the last 15 years and has been a loan client for 10 years. Her first to sixth loans were for $30, $100, $150, $300, $335 and $400 respectively. She is currently servicing a $560 loan and is paying it back very well.

N. stocks sugar, rice, maize flour, millet flour, soap, salt, and other household items in common use by the neighboring homesteads. She plans to expand her store near the trading centre, for which she is requesting a $900 loan.

loans.use: Margaret wants to buy 5 bags of sugar, 10 bags of maize flour, 2 bags of millet flour and 5 bags and one bag of Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah N. is 38 years old and married with six children; four boys and two girls. They all attend school, with three in secondary school and the others in primary school. Sarah sells handicraft in Abaita Babiri near Entebbe town.

She has been a member of Abagalana Womens' group, one of Pearl Microfinance's best performing loan groups, for 8 years. For instance, she is currently servicing a loan of USD 200 and pays promptly.

She says she has been able to educate her children with financial support from her husband. However, Sarah also earns money now -- she sells handmade tablemats, tablecloths, bags, scarves and sweaters. She is happy that she does not need to continue waiting for her husband to bring home money because she can also earn and help pay for the household expenses. Sarah is requesting a $400 loan to buy yarn for sweaters, which are in high demand in the current rainy season.

loans.use: Sarah would like to buy yarn for sweaters which are currently in high demand due to the rainy season.

loans.name: Tufue

texts.en:
Tufue started with a taro business, and then switched to raising pigs because she believed that raising pigs is much cheaper than looking after a taro plantation. Tufue is a very religious lady who is very committed to her church activities and looking after her children. She’s a fifty-three-year-old mother of four children. Her husband is also unemployed but is looking after their family cocoa plantation and helping Tufue with her business.

With her years in business, she feels that it needs improvement. She is now requesting a loan to build a proper shelter for her pigs. She’s now got 6 female pigs who will be giving birth soon, and she is very concerned about protecting her piglets. Tufue’s regular customers are people at church, her friends, and relatives. To keep her business growing, she believes that giving a good price to her customers will make them come and buy from her again.

loans.use: To purchase materials to build a proper shelter for her pigs

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet N. is a young lady aged 25 and a mother of three. Her children are very young: one is in primary 1 while others are in nursery school. She is very hard working and focused. She has managed to service three loans of $85 each and is working towards getting a bigger loan of at least $200.

Janet sells doughnuts and cakes to nearby shops and schools in the neighbourhood. The demand for her doughnuts has increased. She recently received an order to supply 200 doughnuts to two schools, which will earn her $22 per day. With these earnings, she will be in a good position to pay back the loan she is requesting.

loans.use: Janet wants to buy five cartons of wheat flour, one bag of sugar, cooking oil and new baking tins.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria N. is a member of Abagalana Women’s group located in Kawuku, a few kilometers from Entebbe Airport. She is married and a mother of three: two girls and one boy. She also takes care of her sister's two daughters. She has serviced two loans very well and her business is progressing.

Maria makes and sells dresses, skirts, blouses and lady’s pants. She is well-known in the village for making quality and fashionable dresses and particularly for being honest.

Having attended training from Abagalana Women's group on how to start a business, Maria went ahead and started making bricks for sale. She earns about $200 profit over three months. Her parents have given her a large plot of land, on which she hopes to expand her business and increase production of bricks.

loans.use: Maria wants to hire 2 more brick makers as well as buy logs for burning the bricks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more furniture for her private school.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix K. operates a hardware shop in Kawuku near Entebbe town. He is hardworking and his business grows day by day. He is currently constructing a commercial building to house his hardware shop. He is 51 years old and married with six children. His first three children are financially independent:one is a nurse, another is a teacher and the third is a mechanic. Of the rest, one is training as a teacher and the other two are in secondary school.

He is a good client who pays promptly and saves regularly to accumulate capital. He has serviced loans of $1,000, $1,500 and $2,000 with ease and is currently servicing a loan of $2,200. Felix is requesting a loan of $2,800 to buy more material for his hardware store and to finish constructing a building for his store.

loans.use: He wants to buy cement, metal doors and to restock his hardware by buying different types of locks, paints, Iron bars, wire mesh, nails and lime for the business and to complete his commercial building.

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
“Good hair is a must for women,” says Cissy N., a business lady who deals in hair oils, shampoo, braids and other beauty products. This was her response when I asked her what inspired her to start up a cosmetics shop. She received training in hair dressing before starting her own business.

She started with a loan of $200 from her brother in 2001 and since then, she has never looked back. Her business has grown to the tune of $850 and continues to grow. Her daily sales amount to $30; she anticipates that it will grow to $50 after introducing other new hair products such as "Dark and Lovely" and hair treatment chemicals which are widely used around the area. Cissy is asking for a $450 loan to purchase five cartons of hair shampoo, three cartons of hair treatment chemicals and a box of braids.

loans.use: Cissy wants to add to her stock by purchasing five cartons of hair shampoo, three cartons of hair treatment chemicals and a box of braids.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
S. Florence is married and has four children: three boys and a girl. She is a vegetarian and thus has a passion for vegetables. She sells vegetables and Matoke (green bananas) at Seguku on the Kampala – Entebbe road. She has been in this business for the last 18 years. The business has helped her to look after her family very well and recently she bought a plot in Seguku which she plans to develop.

Her husband also works and his income helps to pay their children's school fees and cover the family's household expenses.

So far, S. has serviced five loans of $100, 150, 180, 200 and 220 very well. It is her wish to improve her stock by including other vegetables such as cabbages, spinach, carrots as well as fruits to attract a good number of customers.

loans.use: Florence wants to improve her stock of vegetables such as cabbages, spinach, carrots as well as fruits to attract a good number of customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more food items for her cafe.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Mrs. Julie O. is 60 years, she is from Benin City, married and has eight (8) children,. She sells provisions and drinks in her store, she hope to get the loan of US$ 475 to improve her business by buying more drinks and provisions for resale. She has been working with LAPO since 2003 and has been in business for the past 12 years.

loans.use: To buy provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Rafohon

texts.ru:
Rafohon is a trained seamstress. She is 50 years old, married, and has 6 children. Rafohon makes traditional Tajik robes for men and women. Her business is the main source of Rafohon’s family income. Rafohon has a lot of clients, who purchase her products and resell them on local markets. Rafahon purchases the fabrics and other materials on wholesale markets. Rafohon’s workshop also employs a few apprentice seamstresses, who learn the craft, while making robes. Her previous MicroInvest loan Rafohon used to purchase fabrics. She plans to use this loan for the same purpose.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Рафохон имеет образование швеи. Рафохон 50 лет, она замужем и у нее 6 детей. Она шьет мужские и женские таджикские национальные халаты. Прибыль от шитья составляет ее семейный доход. У нее много клиентов которые покупают готовые халаты и продают их по окрестным рынкам. Сырье для халатов она приобретает на оптовых рынках. Также она обеспечивает работой несколько учениц, которые приходят к ней учиться шить и одновременно шьют халаты. Займ полученный в Микроинвест дал ей возможность закупить сырье. Новый займ она собирается потратить на ту же цель.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 32 years old. He has three children. One of them was born disabled. The entrepreneur has a welding shop in Kirkuk. He applied to borrow $1200 to purchase a new welding machine. He wants to increase his income and renovate his shop. At the same time, he wants to hire one unemployed person to help him at work.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new welding machine

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 26 years old. He has two children. He has a tailoring shop in Kirkuk. He wants to borrow $1000 to purchase a new sewing machine and buy some raw material to help him to develop his business and increase his income. He is looking for a better life and an improved standard of living.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Rahim

texts.en:
Rahim M. is 42 years old and a father of 3 children. He was born in the Masalli region of Azerbaijan. Masalli is situated in the southern part of Azerbaijan. Right now he lives in Sumgayit city, with his family. He is the only breadwinner of his family. He is a cab driver. He began his business 5 years ago. 
Rahim is an experienced driver, and this job is very difficult. Rahim rented a car to earn enough money for his family. He had already saved some money to buy a car for his own, but it is not enough. So, he needs to borrow money.
Rahim wants borrow $1,000 in order to have enough money to buy a car, to build a garage for his car, and to buy the necessary tools and equipments.  He will repay the loan within 12 months. He hopes eventually to expand his business and improve the living conditions of his family. Rahim will repay his loan on a monthly basis.

loans.use: To buy a car, to build a garage for his car, and to buy the necessary tools and equipments

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Mrs. Doris O. lives in Benin, Edo State and has been a member of LAPO for the past 2 years. She is 42 years old, married with four (4) children, and sells cooked food and drinks in her area. She is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 475 for the enhancement of her micro-business.

loans.use: To buy more food ingredients

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
"I hope to expand my business with a loan of US$ 625," says Mrs. Faith O. who lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Faith is married with two children. She sells provisions, drinks and has phone cards available for people in her community.

Faith has been in this business since 1982 and has been a LAPO client for 4 years. She is 40 years old and she learnt the business from her mother.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, drinks, and recharge phone cards

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Mrs. Rose O. is 52 years old, married with 8 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells provisions, pepper soup, and tomatoes to people living in her community.

Rose has been in this business for the past 4 years and has been a LAPO member for 5 years. She wishes to expand her business with the loan amount of US$ 400 (to buy additional grinding machine).

loans.use: To buy more provisions and an additional grinding machine

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: "I have no cause to regret anything. Though I am 40 years old, married mother of four (4) children, my numerous customers gives me satisfaction," says Roseline. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells clothes, shoes, bags and costume jewelries in her business venture and has been in this business since 1995. She needs a loan of US$ 400 to buy more goods for the inventory of her micro-business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, shoes, bags and  costume jeweleries for sale

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
"My business is progressing with LAPO loans," say Mrs. Joy E.. She is 42, married with three children. She sells clothes, shoes, bags and costume jewelery in her boutique and lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.

Joy needs a loan in the amount of US$ 1,175 to improve her business by purchasing more items for her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, shoes, bags and costume jewelery for her micro-business' inventory

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria O. is a young woman of 42. She is married and mother of 5 children, and she has been a LAPO client for over 7 years. Gloria sells kerosene by the gallon to market men and women in her community. She has been in this business since 1995. The above loan amount (US$ 1,175) is to help Gloria improve her turnover by purchasing more kerosene for resale.

loans.use: To buy a tank of kerosene for resale by the gallon

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
Mabel I. has been a dynamic client of LAPO for 8 years. She has proved her wealth of experience in her line of business. She fries and sells "akara" (a kind of beignet; "fast food" equivalent) to a neighboring village.

Mabel is 46 years old, married, and has five children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She needs the requested loan (US$ 400) to buy more bags of beans and groundnut oil so as to expand her business which she started 20 years ago.

loans.use: To buy more bags of beans and groundnut oil

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
"LAPO has given me voice," says Mrs. Rose O. whose business is stable and profitable. She sells gallons of oil and foodstuffs to people in the open-air market. Rose is 49, married, and has six children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.

If she is accorded the loan of US$ 625, Rose intends to buy more gallons of oil and foodstuffs for sale. She has been a client of LAPO for 8 years and started her micro-business in 1987.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil and food stuffs for resale

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Mrs. Helen I. has been a distinguished LAPO client since 1999. She cherishes talking about LAPO loans and how they are helping the poor in Nigeria.

Helen sells gallons of oil, bags of rice, and bags of salt. She is 54 years old, married, and has nine children; she lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Helen, who has been in business since 1980, needs a loan of US$ 400 to buy more oil, bags of rice and salt for resale.

loans.use: To buy more oil, bags of rice, and salt

loans.name: Imuetiyan

texts.en:
A woman full of life who works hard all day long, Mrs. Imuetiyan O. is 48 years old, married, and mother of four children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria where she mills palm nuts and sells edible cooking oil to people by the gallon.

Imuetiyan has been in this business since 2001 and has been a client of LAPO for the past 8 years. She hopes to get a loan in the amount of US$ 800 to boost her business and buy more palm nuts for milling.

loans.use: To buy more palm nuts for milling

loans.name: Bose

texts.en:
Mrs. Bose U. learnt the trade of selling provisions and drinks for 6 months before she started her own business in the year 1977. She also has been with LAPO as secretary of her union for 7 years.

Bose is 49 years old, married, and mother of five children; she lives in Benin City. She hopes to buy more provision and drinks for her inventory so as to increase her turnover if this loan of US$ 550 is granted.

loans.use: To buy more provisions & drinks for resale

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Mrs. Faith O. is a married woman with a child and she is 28 years old. She sells fresh meat in the open-air market in her community. Faith has been with LAPO for the past 4 years as a member of a union. She hails from a semi-urban sector of Edo State, Nigeria.

Faith has been in this business since 1999. She needs a loan in the amount of US$ 400 for business growth and to buy more meat for resale.

loans.use: To buy more meat for sale

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
“I am happy to be a LAPO member," says Mrs. Patience O.. She is 45 years old, married, and mother of 6 children. She has been a LAPO client since 1997 and lives in Benin City.

Patience sells provisions and fairly used clothes and has been in this business for 10 years. She hopes to be granted a loan of US$ 400 so that she can expand her business by buying more provisions and fairly used clothes for resale.

loans.use: To buy more provisions & fairly used clothes for sale

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a reliable client of LAPO who started her business in the year 2003. She hopes to be granted a loan of US$ 400 to enable her to expand her business and buy more provisions & food items for resale to her community.

Faith O. is 28 years old, married, and mother of 5 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been a LAPO client for 2 years.

loans.use: To buy more provisions & food items for resale

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
Mrs. Albertina C., divorced, mother of two daughters ages 5 and 7, lives in her house located in the Pasankeri area, on the west hillside of the city of La Paz. Mrs. Albertina works as an assistant for a micro-construction company in this city. She has been a customer of our institution since 2003, and with three previous loans she built a room, a bedroom and a bathroom, as well as the first part of a retaining wall, that will prevent any sliding problems with her house. The loan requested will be used for finishing the second stage of the cement and iron retaining walls. This is the fourth time that they are applying for a loan, and their socioeconomic analysis qualifies them favorably for new credit. For general information, building houses on the hillsides of the city presents sliding problems that require retaining walls. This is the result of the topography of the terrain in the city.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Albertina C. es madre divorciada, vive en casa propia en la zona de Pasankeri ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz con sus dos hijas de 7 y 5 años de edad; la señora Albertina trabaja como ayudante en una microempresa de construcción de nuestra ciudad. Es cliente antigua de nuestra institución desde el año 2003 y con los tres créditos anteriores realizó la construcción de una habitación, dormitorio, y un baño, así como la primera etapa de muro de contención que evitara problemas de deslizamiento en su vivienda. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la conclusión en segunda etapa de los muros de contención de fierro y cemento. Esta es la cuarta vez que solicitan un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito. Para vuestro conocimiento, en la ciudad de La Paz, la construcción de casas en las laderas de la ciudad presenta el problema de la necesidad de muros de contención para evitar posibles deslizamientos. Esto es así debido a la topografía de los terrenos en nuestra ciudad.

loans.use: Building a retaining wall

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary O. is 49 years old, married, and has 8 children. She lives in a semi-urban area of Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Mary started her business in the year 1980. She specializes in the sale of provisions & foodstuffs. According to Mary, the loan of US$ 400 will be of good help to allow her to expand her business and buy more provisions & foodstuffs for resale. Mary has been with LAPO for 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more provisions & foodstuffs for her little grocery store

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Mrs. Francisca M. lives with her husband and two children ages 13 and 15 in her own house, located in the Tupac Amaru area, on the east hillside of the city of La Paz. Mrs. Francisca sells vegetables on the street and her husband works for a construction company. Using previous credits (four loans that have been paid in full), they built two rooms and steps for accessing their home. However, the housing project hasn’t been concluded. The requested loan will be used for building the cement foundation and a slab on the second floor, for the construction of two rooms in the future. This is the fifth time that they have applied for a loan, and their socioeconomic analysis qualifies them favorably for new credit.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Francisca M. vive en casa propia en la zona de Tupac Amaru ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 15 y 13 años de edad; la señora Francisca se dedica a la venta de verduras en vía publica y el esposo es empleado en una empresa constructora. Actualmente con créditos anteriores (cuatro creditos que a la fecha han sido completamente cancelados) realizaron la construcción de dos habitaciones y gradas de acceso en su vivienda, pero el proyecto de vivienda se encuentra inconcluso. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de una losa de cemento y enferradura en segunda planta, para la posterior construcción de dos habitaciones. Esta es la quinta vez que solicitan un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Building a cement foundation and a slab

loans.name: Fuh Victor

texts.en: Born in 1950, Fuh Victor A. is married and has five children. He is unemployed. Although he attributes his unemployment to his low education, he is appreciative of the fact that he is alive. His parents died before he was a teenager. Victor says life has never been the same again. His desire to give his children (love and education)  what  death deprived him of, is his sources of motivation. He states that he feels better each time he provides something small to his kids. His inability to get investment capital which could constantly generate income for him to meet his children’s needs is the reason he joined GHAPE. With previous loans he succeeded in providing his community with food and manure. Given a loan of $400, he plans to buy four piglets, animal feed, and pay rent for the premises. This investment will increase the food supply in the community. He is planning on using the profits generated in sponsoring his minor children in school. He plans to pay the loan in 18 months. The first installment repayment shall be on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase piglets and animal feed

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
Mrs. Juliana Q. lives in her own home in the ‘Llojeta Ladera Oeste’ district of the city of La Paz with her husband and three children. Mrs. Juliana dedicates herself to the collection of plastic containers that she later sells to recycling centers and her husband is a chauffer with the city’s public transport. Mrs. Juliana’s family has already received loans for the establishment of her property and the construction of two rooms and a bathroom. The requested loan is intended for the construction of an additional room that will serve as a bedroom for her children. Mrs. Juliana has already received two loans from our institution, both of which were paid off according to the established terms and conditions. The socioeconomic analysis favorably qualifies her to accept a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Juliana Q. vive en casa propia en la zona de llojeta ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposo y sus tres hijos; la señora Juliana se dedica a la recolección de envases plásticos que luego vende a empresas recicladoras y el esposo es chofer en una línea de transporte publico de la ciudad. La familia de la señora Juliana ya realizo créditos para la estabilización de su terreno y construcción de dos habitaciones y un baño. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de una habitación que forma parte del proyecto de su vivienda, la cual será destinada a dormitorio de sus hijos. La señora Juliana ya realizo otros créditos con nuestra institución, los cuales fueron pagados de acuerdo a los plazos establecidos, y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder un nuevo crédito.

loans.use:
Construction of a room

Construccion de una habitacion

loans.name: Wilder

texts.es:
Mr. Wilder M. lives in his parent’s home in the ‘Alto Chijini Ladera Noroeste’ district in the city of La Paz with his father and 3 year old son. Wilder is a craftsman, creating decorations for the traditional festivals of our city. He currently occupies one room after renting a room in a different home. Due to the aged structure, the walls of his father’s home are at risk of crumbling which increases the urgency of the needed repairs. The requested loan is intended for demolishing the current adobe walls and replacing them with walls made of brick. This is his first request for a loan. The socioeconomic analysis favorably qualifies him and he is able to accept a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Wilder M. vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de alto Chijini ladera noroeste de la Ciudad de La Paz con su padre y su hijo de 3 año de edad; Wilder trabaja en la artesanía, elaborando adornos para las fiestas criollas de nuestra ciudad. Actualmente ocupan una habitación ya que anteriormente vivía en alquiler en otra vivienda. Por la antigüedad de la construcción, los muros perimetrales de la vivienda de su padre se encuentran en riesgo de desmoronamiento, por lo que se hace urgente un trabajo de refacción. El crédito solicitado será destinado a derrumbe del muro perimetral de adobe y a la construcción de un muro de ladrillo. Esta es la primera vez que solicitan un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use:
Construction of a retaining wall

Construccion de muro perimetral

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: An industrious woman who know the usefulness of a loan to her business, Esther is a member of LAPO's union. She is 35 years old and a widow with five children. She sells iced fish in the open-air market and has been in the business for the past 10 years. Esther hopes to buy more iced fish for resale if the loan amount of US$ 250 is granted to her.

loans.use: To buy iced fish for resale

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Mrs. Manuela M. lives in two rooms she rents in the Llojeta area, west of La Paz city. She lives with her two daughters since her husband abandoned them two years ago. Mrs. Manola buys and sells clothes for a living, traveling to the provinces.

Mrs. Manuela, with her savings, was able to purchase a small piece of land in the hillsides of the city for which she paid 50% and the balance is left to be paid.

The credit requested will be used for the construction of a single room in this property, to which they'll move and hence save the rent they currently pay.

This is the first time they request a loan. The socioeconomic analysis of the family qualifies them favorably and allows them to access a new credit.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


La señora Manuela M. vive en dos habitaciones en alquiler en la zona de Llojeta ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz con sus dos hijas, ya que su esposo las abandono hace dos años; la señora Manuela se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa, viajando a las provincias. La señora Manuela, con sus ahorros pudo comprar un pequeño terreno en las laderas de la ciudad para la que pago el 50% y el saldo se encuentra pendiente de pago. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de una habitación en su terreno, al que se trasladaran, para poder así ahorrar los alquileres que ahora pagan. Esta es la primera vez que solicitan un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Building a single room house

loans.name: Kungaba

texts.en: Kungaba C. is a 50 years old wife and mother of eight children. She faces difficulties in raising money because of her age and her low income makes it difficult for her to educate and provide basic needs for the ever-growing needs of her eight children. These difficulties led her to become a GHAPE member where she received a first loan of $40. She was able to repay this loan and use the profits to provide some basic needs for the family. With the current loan of $200, she plans to sell foodstuffs in the local food market where buyers come from all over the province and use the income to pay her children's school fees. She plans to pay this loan in 15 months.

loans.use: Purchase of foodstuffs

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia O. is 55 years old, married, and has nine children. She hails from Benin City and operates a business center where she types and photocopies documents. She has had her micro-business since 2003.

Patricia needs a loan of US$ 800 to enable her to buy an additional photocopying machine and a computer in order to serve her customers better.

loans.use: To buy an additional photocopying machine and a computer

loans.name: Uwa

texts.en: “Multi-Choice Shop is the name of my business and I sell provisions and crates of drinks in this shop,” says Mrs. E. Uwa. She is 35 years old; she is a married mother of four children. Uwa is eager to expand her business and buy more provisions and soft drinks if she is granted a loan in the amount of US$ 1,175. She has 4 years' experience in this business and has been a LAPO member for 6 years.

loans.use: To buy provisions and soft drinks

loans.name: Korkmaz

texts.ru:
Korkmaz A. was born and lives in the town of Aksu. He is married and has 4 children. In 2005, he took his first loan of $300 from Aksu branch of Normicro to open a business. He used the money to rent a small store where he now sells a variety of goods. Korkmaz paid off his first loan promptly and took another one in 2006 to purchase additional inventory. Korkmaz A. has been in business for three years. Now he wants to take a $1000 loan to repair his store and purchase additional inventory.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Ахмедов Коркмаз родилься и проживает в городе Аксу. Семейный, имеет четверо детей. Первый раз взял в кредит из Аксунского филиала ООО Нормикро 2005 году 300$, чтобы открыт свой бизнес. Взял в аренду небольшой магазин и продает различные товары. Он вовремя вернул кредит и 2006 году второй раз взял кредит 600$. На эти деньги купил необходимый инвентарь для магазина. Коркмаз уже третий год занимаеться этим бизнесом. До этого занималься скотоводством и занимаеться. Теперь он еще раз хочеть взять кредит 1000 $. На этот кредит будет отремонтировать магазин и купить больше товаров.

loans.use: Store repair and purchase of additional inventory

loans.name: Mary
