texts.en: Mary O. is 35 years old, married with four children. She hails from Benin City. Mary sells plantains, yams and vegetables; she has been a LAPO member since 2005. She has 6 years' experience in her business. Mary hopes to buy more plantains and vegetables for resale if she is granted the requested loan of US$ 475.

loans.use: To buy yams, plantains, and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Osas

texts.en:
Mrs. Osas A. is 34 years old; she is a married mother of four children. She sells drinks, foodstuffs, and provisions in her shop. She is a leader in one of LAPO's union.

Osas is satisfied to be in this business but hopes to get a loan in the amount of US$ 625 to buy more drinks, foodstuffs and provisions so as to expand her micro-business. She has been in this business since 2001.

loans.use: To buy more crates of drinks, foodstuffs and provisions for resale in her little grocery store

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
Rene is a driver in the public transportation industry and works from Trufi, an inter-city area of El Alto in La Paz. This is the source of his income to support his three sons; Rene lives in the city of El Alto.

The loan he currently seeks will be used to convert his vehicle to one that uses methane natural gas, which will allow him to increase his income 30 to 40% because the cost of [methane] natural gas is much less than petroleum or diesel.

It is Rene's fifth loan with IMPRO and his previous payment history is excellent. Moreover, he is more than qualified and approved for this loan, which will help him to continue working under more favorable conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva volunteer.

Rene es transportista de servicio publico y trabaja de Trufi inter – ciudad La Paz el Alto; esta es su fuente de ingreso para la manutención de sus tres hijos; Rene vive la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito que ahora solicita será utilizado para la conversión de su Vehiculo de gasolina a Gas Natural Vehicular; esta conversión le permitirá incrementar sus ingresos en un 30 a 40% en vista de que el costo de gas es mucho menor que el costo de Gasolina. Este es el 5to. Crédito de Rene con IMPRO y su historial de pagos es excelente, además de que la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo, de esa forma podrá seguir trabando con mayores beneficios.

loans.use: to convert his vehicle to one that uses natural gas

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
Adelaida is a merchant of woolen baby clothes. Her merchandise is sold in the popular zones of the city of El Alto. Her husband works casually as a porter and thus wins his principle income with which they cover the basic expenses of their three children, who are of school age. Adelaida lives in Tahuantinsuyo zone in the city of El Alto. This loan is marked for the purchase of merchandise, so as to be able to increase her family's income. This is her first loan with Impro. The evaluation process permitted Impro to approve the amount of the loan asked for by Adelaida.

Translated from Spanish by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer

Adelaida es comerciante de ropas de lana de bebes; su mercadería la comercializa en las zonas populares de la Ciudad de El Alto; el esposo trabaja eventualmente como portero y así logran sus ingresos principales con los que cubren la manutención de sus tres hijos que están en edad escolar. Adelaida vive en la zona Tahuantinsuyo de la Ciudad de El Alto. El crédito lo destinara para comprar mercadería, para de esta forma incrementar sus ingresos familiares. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le permite acceder al préstamo solicitado por la prestataria.

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Vero

texts.en: Mrs. Vero U. is 57 years old and is happily married with 8 children. She hails from an urban sector of Benin City, Nigeria. Vero has been with LAPO for 7 years as a union leader. She has been running her business for 10 years and she needs a loan of US$ 800 to buy more drinks and food ingredients to enable her to prepare more food for sale in her little restaurant.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to cook for her little restaurant

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia, a single mother of two kids, works selling vegetables in the popular markets of the city of El Alto. She lives in her parents' house in the Villa Ingenio area of this same city. Selling vegetables is her only form of income and she barely makes enough to survive.

The credit that Julia is asking for will be used to buy more merchandise in order to increase her sales and her income.

It is her third time borrowing with IMPRO; her good track record means she is able to apply for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Julia, madre soltera de dos hijos, trabaja como comerciante de hortalizas en las ferias populares de la ciudad de El Alto, vive en la casa de sus padres en la Zona Villa Ingenio de esta misma ciudad. La venta de hortalizas es su única fuente de ingresos que apenas le alcanzan para subsistir. El crédito que Julia solicita será utilizado para comprar más mercadería y de esa forma incrementar sus ventas y poder obtener más ingresos. Es el tercer crédito con Impro; los buenos antecedentes de pago en los dos préstamos anteriores le facultan a acceder a otro préstamo.

loans.use: To increase her income/Capital de trabajo

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio has his own small printing shop in his home in the Villa Juliana area of the city of El Alto. He also is employed as a printer and soon plans to go independent. Antonio lives with his wife and son, who helps with the printing.

He will use the credit to buy a printer and in this way he will be able to stregthen his business while saving money as he would no longer need to rent printers.

This would be his 7th loan with IMPRO (he has been our client since 2002 and has a great record with us); and the evaluation carried out means that he qualifies for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Antonio tiene su pequeño taller de imprenta ubicado en su domicilio en la zona Villa Juliana de la Ciudad de El Alto; también trabaja como empleado en una imprenta y en corto tiempo tiene planificado independizarse. Antonio vive con su esposa y un hijo quien le ayuda con la pequeña imprenta. El crédito lo destinara para comprar un prensa, de esa forma fortalecerá su pequeña imprenta y al mismo tiempo podrá ahorrar el costo de alquilar los servicios de prensa en los que ahora incurre. Este será el 7mo. Crédito con Impro; (es cliente nuestro desde el año 2002 con excelente historial de pagos) la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo.

loans.use: To buy a printing machine/Compra de maquina prensadora

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: "My business has experienced tremendous expansion during the past 9 years , that is, since the moment I started borrowing from LAPO," says Mrs. Eunice I., 50, a widow and mother of 6 children. Eunice sells foodstuffs and has been in this business for the past 14 years. She is requesting a loan of US$ 400 to buy more foodstuffs for sale in her little shop.

loans.use: To buy more items for her inventory

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco is a dairy farmer and is a salesman for Pil Andina (Milk Processing Plant). He also works as a construction worker. His wife helps him to sell potatoes, a product that they grow. This is how they earn money in order to support their 4 kids who depend on him.

They live in The Villandrani Community, one hour outside of La Paz.

He will use the credit to buy a medium sized cow to increase milk production.

This is his first credit with IMPRO, and the socio-economic evaluation that has been carried out shows his capability to repay the debt, and he is therefore authorized to ask for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Francisco es productor de leche de vaca la misma que es comercializada a Pil Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche), también trabaja como albañil y su esposa le ayuda como comerciante de papa y chuño, productos que ellos mismos producen. Es así como logran obtener ingresos con los que cubren la manutención de sus 4 hijos que depende de él. Vive en la Comunidad de Villandrani (A una hora de la ciudad de La Paz). El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca de raza mediana para incrementar la producción de leche. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación socio-económica realizada muestra la capacidad de pago de la deuda y le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: To buy a milking machine/Compra de una vaca lechera

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
Filomena, like many Bolivian women, was left by her husband to be both father and mother to her four small children that depend on her. She works making cow's milk and sells potatoes and potato starch. She uses her income to support her children.

She lives in the Villandrani community (one hour the city of La Paz).

She will invest her loan in the purchase of a cow of average breed to increase her milk production.

This is her first loan with Impro; her socio-economic evaluation shows her ability to repay the loan and also cover her family's monthly expenses and qualifies her to be granted the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Filomena, como mucha mujeres de bolivianas fue abandonada por su esposo, quedando ella como padre y madre de sus cuatro pequeños hijos que dependen de ella. Filomena se dedica a la producción de leche de vaca y comercializa papa y chuño, ingresos con lo que cubre la manutención de sus hijos.

Vive en la Comunidad de Villandrani (A una hora de la ciudad de La Paz).

El crédito le invertirá en la compra de una vaca de raza mediana para incrementar la producción de leche.

Es el primer crédito con Impro; la evaluación socio-económica realizada muestra la capacidad de repago del crédito como también ingresos suficientes para cubrir los gastos mensuales de su familia y la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
Wilson is 22 years old, works as an auto mechanic's assistant and lives with his mother and sister in the Fatravi district of the city of El Alto.

Wilson's mother is ill (doctors detected a malignant cancer in her Uterus). Wilson is asking for a loan to pay for his mother's medical treatment and medications.

This is Wilson's first loan with Impro and will be placed in our development department in the Health Sector. His evaluation shows enough income to repay the loan. This loan will help Wilson and will especially help his mother.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Wilson, joven de 22 años, trabaja como ayudante de mecánico automotriz y vive con su madre y hermana en la zona Fatravi de la Ciudad de El Alto.

La madre de Wilson se encuentra enferma (detectaron Cáncer Maligno en el Útero). El crédito que Wilson solicita será destinado para en tratamiento medico y medicamentos que los médicos han recetado a su madre.

Es el primer crédito con Impro y será canalizado dentro de nuestra línea de Fomento en el Sector de Salud. La evaluación realizada muestra los ingresos suficientes para la aprobación del préstamo. Lo importante de este préstamo es la ayuda social que se prestara a Wilson y en especial a su madre.

loans.use: Medical treatment for his mother.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia and her husband José have a small carpentry shop. They employ a 14 year old and a 16 year old as assistants. They make all kinds of average quality furniture.

They have two children, 4 and 2 years old, and live with Celia's parents in the Pedro Domingo Murillo district of the city of El Alto.

The loan will be used to buy a TUPY Circular carpentry machine that will help them increase their production and satisfy customer demand.

This is Celia's third loan with Impro. Her first two loans were granted in March and November 2006 and have been repaid in full. It is exactly this responsible repayment of previous loans that makes her eligible for another.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Celia y su esposo José, tienen un pequeño taller de carpintería, empleando a dos jóvenes de 14 y 16 años como ayudantes. Ellos fabrican todo tipo de muebles de mediana calidad.

Tienen dos hijos de 4 y 2 años de edad y viven en la casa de los padres de Celia en zona Pedro Domingo Murillo de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito solicitado será destinado a la compra de una maquina TUPY Circular de carpintería que le ayudara a incrementar su producción y poder satisfacer la demanda que tiene en su mercado.

Es el tercer crédito con Impro, los dos primeros créditos fueron concedidos en Marzo y Noviembre de 2006 y a la fecha están completamente pagados. Precisamente este buen comportamiento de pago le faculta para poder acceder a otro préstamo.

loans.use: To purchase work tools

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel has a little garage for vehicle paint jobs. He works with his oldest son who is fourteen years old. His wife is a travelling saleswoman of cosmetics. These are their main incomes, which they use to raise their four children. They live in the town Villa Tunari in the city of El Alto.

The loan will be used to purchase raw materials (paint and putty) to stock his small garage. This is his first loan with IMPRO, but the evaluation that he completed qualifies him to receive a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Daniel tiene su pequeño taller de Chapería y pintado de Vehículos, trabaja con su hijo mayor de 14 años, la esposa es comerciante ambulante de cosméticos; estos son sus ingresos principales con los que cubren la manutención de sus 4 hijos, viven en la zona Villa Tunari de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinara para comprar materia prima (Pintura, masilla), de esa forma fortalecerá tu pequeño taller.

Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobarle el prestamos.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

payments.comment: Early apy off. Daniel will apply for a new loan.

loans.name: Nahmen Gladys

texts.en: Nahmen Gladys F. is a 31 year old widow who has found it absolutely difficult to single-handedly educate and provide basic needs for her 4 children, coupled with the fact that she was a victim of robbery that made away with almost all she had. Motivated by these setbacks, she became a member GHAPE and received a loan of $40 in 2005 and $80 in 2006.With these loans, she was able to sell roasted corn, fresh groundnuts, and fruits and used the profits to educate some of her children. With a current loan of $500 and the training received from GHAPE, she plans to buy foodstuff in bulk from villages where prices are lower and retail them in the town so as to obtain maximum profit. The income will help her pay her children’s school fees and pay her bills. She plans to pay her loans in 18 months. The first installment repayment will be done from the fourth month from the date the loan is disbursed.

loans.use: Purchase of foodstuff, transportation

loans.name: Gonkieh

texts.en: Born in 1964, Gonkieh A. is married to a polygamist and a mother of two children. Her source of motivation is from difficulties she has with ill health as a result of a surgical operation and the little commitment of her polygamous husband to educate and provide basic needs for her family. Moved by these difficulties, she became a member of GHAPE and received a first loan of $40 in 2005 and a second loan of $120 in 2006 with which she started a business making scotch eggs. The income helped pay school fees for her two children. If given a loan of $800, she plans to buy foodstuff cheaper from local markets  and will sell at a higher price in the town markets, particularly that of Nkwen where buyers come from all over the province. With the profits, she will be able to pay her children’s school fees, buy her kitchen utensils and increase her business. She plans to pay back her loan in 18 months.The first installment repayment will be done on the fourth month from date of disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase of foodstuff, transportation

loans.name: Micaela

texts.es:
Señora Micaela belongs to the Ricardo Palma Community Bank in the District of Calleria, Department of Ucayali. She is 69 years old, and is the mother of 6 children. She was widowed 22 years ago, and since then she had be a breadwinner for her children. Señora Micaela and her children had to work together and with an initial loan of 300 Sol (US$94 approx) she decided to dedicate herself to sewing bedcovers and selling them in the settlements where she is placed well and is paid daily (5 Sol on average). With the recent loan granted to her by Manuala Ramos in the sum of 800 Sol. (US$254 approx.) she will buy 20 kilos of plain fabric, 10 kilos of decorative fabric, 3 boxes of thread and oil to maintain her sewing machine. Micaela feels very happy that, in addition to having a means to help her family, she can deliver her product to women who do not have enough money to pay cash, in this way she leaves her product to be paid "a pacos" (by credit). Now, with the help of her children, she takes care of this business.

Translated from Spanish by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Micaela pertenece al Banco Comunal Ricardo Palma, del Distrito D. Calleria, Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 69 años, y es madre D. 6 hijos. Hace 22 años enviudó, desD. entonces tuvo que sacar adelante a sus hijos. La señora Micaela y sus hijos tuvieron que trabajar juntos y con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 (US$ 94.00 aprox.) deciD. dedicarse a coser cubrecamas y venderlas en los asentamientos humanos donD. coloca el bien y le pagan en forma diaria (S/.5.00 nuevos soles promedio). Con el reciente préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos D. S/. 800.00 (US$ 254.00 aprox.) comprará 20 kilos D. tela, 10 kilos D. tela para adorno, 3 cajas D. hilos y aceite para dar mantenimiento a su maquina D. cocer. Micaela se siente muy contenta, además D. tener un ingreso para alimentar a su familia, pueD. entregar su producto a mujeres que no disponen del dinero suficiente para pagar al contado, es así que deja su producto para ser pagado D. a pocos (crédito). Ahora conjuntamente con sus hijos atienden este negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of fabrics and oils. Maintenance of machinery.

loans.name: Milena

texts.es:
Señora Milena belongs to the Ricardo Palma Community Bank in the District of Calleria, Department of Ucayali. She is 51 years old, and is widowed with four children. Her husband was the one who contributed to the household until be passed, and she didn't know what to do. A neighbor soon encouraged her the become part of her Community Bank, and with her first loan of 300 Sol. (US$94 approx.), she decided to sell artisan brooms of piasaba and taminchi (material that they harvest from the mountain), but with the passing of time she decided to improve her product, and it was thus that she started to purchase pieces worked like cues for the handle of the broom. With the recent loan granted by Manuela Ramos in the sum of 800 Sol. (US$254 approx), she will buy 300 cues, 10 kilos of staples, and 50 wooden handles. Now, jointly with her children she takes care of the business and assembles the brooms they take to sell. Señora Milena hopes to be able to take her products to the capital (Lima).

Translated from Spanish by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Milena pertenece al Banco Comunal Ricardo Palma, del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 51 años, y es viuda con 4 hijos. El esposo era quien aportaba en la casa hasta que falleció y no sabia que hacer. De pronto una vecina la anima a integrar a su Banco Comunal, y con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 (US$ 94.00 aprox.) decide vender escobas artesanales de piasaba y taminchi (material que extraen del monte), pero con el transcurrir del tiempo decide mejorar su producto, es así que comienza a comprar piezas trabajadas como los tacos, palo de la escoba. Con el reciente préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/. 800 (US$ 254.00 aprox.) comprará 3 cientos de tacos, 10 kilos de grapas, 10 kilos de piazaba y 1/2 ciento de palos de escoba. Ahora conjuntamente con sus hijos atienden este negocio y arman las escobas que llevan para la venta. La señora Milena aspira poder llevar sus productos a la capital (Lima).

loans.use: Purchase of primary materials

loans.name: Nisa

texts.es:
Señora Nisa belongs to the Ricardo Palma Communal Bank in the District of Calleria, Department of Ucayali. She is 61 years old, and is the mother of 6 children. Her husband works at a small farm on a mountain, where after 20 days he can be flown down to his family and give them what little money he has earned. But, given the daily needs of her family, Nisa worked herself up to open a small grocery since the block already had a school. For this she solicited her first loan of 300 Sol (US $94 approx.). The recent loan granted to Nisa by Manuela Ramos in the sum of 2,000 Sol. (US$630 approx.). will be used to purchase 6 boxes of soda water, 2 sacs of sugar, 3 boxes of milk, 1 box of treats, 1 pack of biscuits, and 5 bags of water in satchels. Nisa is very happy to be able to contribute economically to her household. In addition, given the fierce heat in her region, that she can attend to the children, who need a lot of liquids to sate their thirst. Now, the grocery provides for the family's daily expenses and they have no trouble waiting for the arrival of her husband. She counts on the help of her children, who without neglecting their studies help attend to the grocery.

Translated from Spanish by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Nisa pertenece al Banco Comunal Ricardo Palma, del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 61 años, y es madre de 6 hijos. Su esposo trabaja en la chacra en el monte, quien después de 20 días pueda estar alado de su familia y darles el poco dinero que consiguió, pero como las necesidades son diarias, es así que Nisa se anima a poner una pequeña bodega ya que a media cuadra está una escuela. Para ello solicitó un primer préstamo de S/. 300 (US$ 94.00 aprox.). El reciente préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,000 (US$ 630.00 aprox.) será utilizado para comprar 6 cajas de gaseosas, 2 sacos de azúcar, 3 cajas de leche, 1 caja de galletas, 1 paquete de golosinas, y 5 bolsas de agua en saches. Nisa está muy contenta por que también puede apoyar económicamente en su hogar, además, dado al fuerte calor en la zona pueda atender a los niños que requieran de bastante liquido para aplacar la sed. Ahora la bodega les da para los gastos del día y así no tienen ninguna dificultad de esperar hasta que llegue el esposo, cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos que sin descuidar sus estudios atienden la bodega.

loans.use: Purchase of essential products

loans.name: Sevda

texts.en:
Ms. Sevda is a low income, vulnerable person. She is 39, married with four children and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Sevda and her husband (he is shown on the picture) run a family business together. Her husband sells meat in the local big market, while Sevda grazes the flock. In this season (autumn), lambs are cheap and it is thus a good chance to increase the number of sheeps. Therefore, Sevda applied for a $500 loan to Normicro Saatli branch. This amount could buy 8 lambs, which would make it possible for Sevda to earn $900 in six months' time.

loans.use: To increase her number of sheep

loans.name: Josefa Patricia

texts.es:
Josefa is a 23-year-old married mother of two. She and her husband have had a carpentry business making doors and windows with designed iron and wood for the past seven years. Their customers live in San Cristóbal and the surrounding areas. On top of that, Josefa also makes crafts like tablecloths, napkins and embroidered blanks that she sells to downtown vendors who then resell the items to tourists. With the loan, she plans to purchase wood and iron for the carpentry business and thread and fabric for her handicrafts.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

JOSEFA, esta casada , tiene 23 años , 2 hijos ,junto con su esposo tienen un negocio de balconería y carpintería ( hacen puertas , ventanas de hierro con diseños y de madera ) desde hace 7 años , sus clientes vienen de la ciudad de San Cristóbal y alrededores además ella realiza trabajos de artesanía tales como manteles , servilletas , mantas bordadas y los vende en el pueblo mas cercano a los mayoristas quienes después se lo revenden a los turistas de la zona. Pertenece al grupo Fátima 5. Con el préstamo espera invertir en la compra de madera y hierro para la balconería y además hilo y géneros para sus artesanías.

loans.use: Purchase wood, iron, fabric and thread

loans.name: Candi

texts.es:
Mrs. Candi belongs to the Ricardo Palma Communal Bank, of the Calleria District, Ucayali Department. She is 25 years old and has one child. Together with her husband she has dedicated herself to the making of stocks for making brooms. With the first loan received from Manuela Ramos for S/. 300 (approximately US $94.00) they had the opportunity to acquire a machine to plane wood, later they decided to buy sawmill waste wood and thus create stocks, the same as those that are sold to the people who make brooms. Now they have requested a loan of S/. 900.00 (approximately US $285.00) for the purchase of a wood truck that the sawmill is not using, three bundles of piasaba (fibrous product of two Brazilian palm trees used in making brooms), also they require a telephone to make orders to the sawmills and thus diminish the current costs of making the orders. In addition to caring for their little son, she continues in this work, at her side with this small machine they can make stocks and sell to the women who make brooms by hand made artisanal methods.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Candi pertenece al Banco Comunal Ricardo Palma, del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 25 años, y 1 hijo. Junto a su esposo se dedican a la elaboración de tacos para armar escobas, con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 (US$ 94.00 aprox.) tuvieron la oportunidad de adquirir una maquina para cepillar madera, luego deciden comprar de los aserraderos desperdicios de madera y así elaborar tacos, los mismos que son vendidos a las personas que arman escobas. Ahora han solicitado un préstamo de S/. 900.00 (US$ 285.00 aprox.) para la compra de una camionada de madera que no utilizan los aserraderos, 3 fardos de piasaba, además requieren de un teléfono para hacer pedidos a los aserraderos y así disminuir los costos al momento de hacer los pedidos. Además de cuidar a su pequeño hijo, se siente realizada en dicho trabajo, a su vez con esta pequeña maquina pueden hacer tacos y vender a las señoras que hacen escobas de manera de forma artesanal.

loans.use: Purchase of material (wood and basic supplies) . Acquisition of telephone line. - Compra de materia prima (madera e insumos).  Adquisición de linea telefónica.

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
Pascuala makes designer tablecloths, napkins, cushions and clothing which she later embroiders and sells at an artisan market in the city of San Cristóbal. Furthermore, she also runs a small business with her children that makes doors and windows from iron and sells them to people from their community and the surrounding area. She is 47 years old, married and has five children. With the loan, she plans to purchase thread and fabric for her handicrafts and also purchase materials for her carpentry business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

PASCUALA , trabaja confeccionando manteles ,servilletas , cojines y ropa artesanal la cual posteriormente borda y vende en la ciudad de San Cristóbal en el mercado de las artesanías además tiene en sociedad con uno de sus hijos una mini empresa donde hacen puertas y ventanas de hierro y venden entre las personas de su comunidad y alrededores. Ella tiene 47 años, casada y tuvo 5 hijos. Pertenece al grupo Fátima 5. Su préstamo lo va a invertir en la compra de hilo y géneros y además apoyar a la balconería comprando materiales.

loans.use: Purchase construction and artisan supplies

loans.name: Maria Veronica

texts.es:
Maria Veronica is 22 years old and recently married. She is dedicated to embroidering bedspreads, sashes, handkerchiefs, tablecloths and cushions. She sells her handicrafts to people from her community who then resell the items at tourist destinations. With the loan, she plans to purchase threads and fabrics.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

MARIA VERONICA, tiene 22 años recién casada y se dedica a bordar cubrecamas, chales, fajas, servilletas, manteles, cojines. Sus clientes son personas de su misma localidad que comercializan después sus prendas a los lugares turísticos del Estado. Pertenece al grupo Fátima 5, con su préstamo invertirá comprando telares e hilos

loans.use: Purchase thread and fabrics

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa is a 29-year-old married mother of five. Together with her husband, she runs a fruit and vegetable business out of her home, selling to people in the community. In her free time, she embroiders handkerchiefs, tablecloths and sashes and sells them to wholesalers who then resell them at tourist destinations. With the loan, she plays to purchase more fruit and vegetables to have a larger stock and also buy embroidering thread.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

TERESA DE JESUS, tiene 29 años, casada, cinco hijos y junto con su esposo ella tiene un negocio de frutas y verduras en su casa las cuales salen a vender a las comunidades cercanas a su domicilio y además en sus ratos libres borda servilletas, manteles y fajas y las entrega a los mayoristas para que las vendan en zonas turísticas.Pertenece al grupo Fátima 5. Con su préstamo invertirá en la compra de frutas y verduras para tener un stock mayor y además comprará hilos de bordar.

loans.use: Purchase fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Taleh

texts.en:
Mr. Taleh is a low income, vulnerable person. He is 32, single, and lives with his parents in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Taleh sells beef in Saatli town during the morning and then in the afternoon goes to the meadow to  graze cattles. During the autumn months animals are cheap and this gives Taleh a chance to buy and increase his cattle stock. That's why he applied for a $500 loan to  the Normicro Saatli branch. This amount would allow  him buy two calfs and earn $1200 in half a year.

loans.use: To buy two cows

loans.name: Maria Petrona

texts.es:
Maria is an artisan who weaves wraps, bedspreads, comforters and handkerchiefs. She is 23 years old, married and has three children. She goes to the nearest city to sell her items to wholesalers. Maria is part of a collective with two other artisans, María Gómez Vásquez and María Hernández Jiménez. With the loan, they plan to purchase thread and fabrics at wholesale and in this way save on expenses and improve their earning margins.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

MARIA PETRONA , es artesana , teje chales , colchas, cubrecamas y servilletas , tiene 23 años , casada , tres hijos , para vender su mercadería viaja a la ciudad más cercana y las ofrece a los mayoristas . Forma parte del grupo Clavel 1 junto con doña María Gómez Vásquez (artesana) y doña María Hernández Jiménez (artesana). Con el préstamo invertirán en la compra de hilo y géneros al por mayor y de esta forma ahorrarán en los gastos y obtendrán mas ganancias.

loans.use: Purchase thread and fabrics

loans.name: Maria Josefa

texts.es:
Maria Josefa is a 24-year-old mother of three. She and her husband have a small shop where they sell threads, fabrics, needles and all kinds of embroidery materials. Their merchandise is in high demand in their area by artisans, and they also go to hard-to-reach communities and sell to artisans there. With the loan, they plan to purchase merchandise for their shop.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

MARIA JOSEFA , tiene 24 años , tres hijos , junto con su esposo tienen una tiendita donde venden hilos , telas , agujas y todo tipo de materiales necesarios para el bordado ya que en la zona es muy solicitada esta mercadería por las demás artesanas que las utilizan para sus bordados y también van a las comunidades done es mas difícil salir a la ciudad y se las venden a las mujeres artesanas . Forma parte del grupo Clavel 1 y con su préstamo invertirá en mercadería para su tienda.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Doña Gloria belongs to the Ricardo Palma Communal Bank of the Calleria district, Ucayali Department. She is 40 years old and has 3 children. Five years ago and with the idea to support her partner, she was looking for work without any success until Manuela Ramos give her an option to invest on a business. With the first loan of 300 soles (approx. $94 US), she opened a small pantry on her neighborhood because there was none at that time.

Since the loss of her partner's job, both of them take care of the business. Their objective is to have a minimarket, so people can find everything they need.

The Manuela Ramos' loan of 2, 300 soles(approx. $729 US) will be used to expand and be able to offer and sell a variety of products. She will buy at wholesale prices: 3 sacks of rice, 5 boxes of milk, 2 boxes of tuna, 2 sacks of potatoes, 1 containe of yogurt, 3 packs of noodles, and 10 containers of eggs.

Gloria is very happy to work with her husband and they not only share the business together but the house chores and their responsibilities with their children as well

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Gloria pertenece al Banco Comunal Ricardo Palma, del Distrito de Callería, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 40 años, y es madre de 3 niños. Hace 5 años, con la idea de apoyar a su pareja buscaba trabajo sin embargo no consiguió hasta que Manuela Ramos le dio la oportunidad de inversión y con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 (US$ 94.00 aprox.) aperturó una pequeña bodega dado que en ese lugar no existía ninguna. A raíz de la pérdida del trabajo de su pareja, ahora, ambos atienden el negocio y su objetivo es tener un pequeño minimarket, para que las personas puedan encontrar de todo. El préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,300 (US$ 729 aprox.) será utilizado para ampliar y vender varios productos. Comprará al por mayor 3 sacos de arroz, 3 sacos de azúcar, 5 cajas de leche, 2 cajas de atún, 2 sacos de papa, 1 paquete de yogurt, 3 paquetes de fideo, 10 casilleros de huevo. Gloria esta muy contenta de trabajar conjuntamente con su esposo y no solo comparten el negocio sino también las labores de la casa y obligaciones con los hijos.

loans.use: Buying food products to provide for the daily needs

loans.name: Tebriz

texts.en:
Mr. Tebris is a low income vulnerable person. He is 29, married with three children and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.
Tebris has own mini market and his business goes good enough. But this summer when electicity was broken for some while, the ice cream fridge stoped and all ice creams went bad. That day Tebris lost $200. And he decided to apply for $500 to Normicro Saatli branch to buy compact power generator, which costs $400. And $100 will be spend to repair ice cream refrigerator.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Juanita Maria

texts.es:
Juanita is 49 years old and has 3 kids. She lives in Banco Comunal Ricardo Palma in the Calleria district in the county of Ucayali. Her husbnd is a construction worker, but what he earns does not meet their household costs. It is for this reason that she decided to help out to improve their finances.

When she hard about the Manuela Ramos service in the Banco Comunal Ricardo Palma she decided to ask for a loan of S/.300 (approx. $94). She then used this to start selling drinks in the school which is about a kilometre and a half from her house. With time, she decided to start selling snacks too such as tamales, Juanes and humitas. For this she counts on being mobile (having a car in this case) so that she can transport the food to sell at the school. This car was fixed up by her son. She now does this business with him.

She will use this loan, authorized by Manuela, of S/.2,000 (approx. $630) to buy 5 kilos of rice (to make the juane), 2 chickens, 25 dozen choclos, 50 banana leaves, and to pay her son for the maintenance of the car.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Juanita tiene 49 años y 3 hijos, pertenece al Banco Comunal Ricardo Palma, del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali. Su esposo es albañil pero lo que gana no alcanza para los gastos de casa, es así que ella decide ayudarlo para mejorar su economía. Cuando conoce del servicio de Manuela Ramos se incorpora al Banco Comunal Ricardo Palma y solicita un primer préstamo de S/. 300 (US$ 94.00 aprox.), con ello empezó a vender bebidas en un colegio que esta a un kilómetro y medio de su casa, pero con el transcurrir del tiempo deciden incorporar la venta de comida como Juanes, humitas, tamales, para ello tenia que contar con movilidad (motocar) que le permitiera llevar la comida para la venta en el colegio, dicha movilidad fue proporcionada por su hijo. Ahora conjuntamente con su hijo atienden este negocio. El préstamo recientemente otorgado por Manuela de S/. 2,000 (US$ 630.00 aprox.) servirá para la compra de 5 kilos de arroz (para la elaboración del juane), 2 pollos, 35 docenas de choclo, 50 hojas de bijao, y para dar mantenimiento al motocar de su hijo.

loans.use: To buy ingrediemts and to pay for the maintenance of the car/Compra de insumos. Mantenimiento de motocar.

loans.name: Fikret

texts.en:
Mr.Fikret is a low income vulnerable person. He is 50, married with three children and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.
Fikret and his brother sell milk in the local market and cows they have are the  reliable source of income for their family. But to be sufficient for both families, this business needs a constant investment. And Fikret applied to Normicro Saatli branch for $500 loan, which is enough to buy one cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Simona

texts.es:
Simona is married and has three daughters, two of whom are are still single. Her husband is retired; the pension that he receives is very small and it was difficult to be able to cover the basic necessities of their family. For this reason Simona started her own business with the sale of natural products and food supplements four years ago. She is a very hard working woman and her liking for sales has permitted her to increase her number of customers quickly.

To be able to cover the demand and increase her sales Simona now is asking for a loan of $650 that she pledges to repay in six months. You can help this family, contributing to the growth of their business. They are very grateful for your confidence and support.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Simona es casada y tiene tres hijas, dos de ella aún solteras, su esposo está jubilado, la pensión que recibe es muy baja y difícilmente podía cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia, por esta razón Simona inició su propio negocio con la venta de productos naturales y suplementos alimenticios hace cuatro años, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y su gusto por las ventas le ha permitido incrementar su número de clientes rápidamente.

Para poder cubrir la demanda e incrementar sus ventas ahora Simona está solicitando un préstamo de $ 650 dólares que se compromete a regresar en 6 meses. Tú puedes ayudar a esta familia contribuyendo al crecimiento de su negocio, ellos agradecen mucho la confianza y apoyo que les brindas.

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise - Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Estela is married and has 3 kids of 16, 18 and 20 years of age. Due to a lack of work in Mexico, her husband decided to go to the USA to work. Their kids were young and in order to meet their everyday needs Estela decided to start her own business 15 years ago. She offered her services as a seamstress, and her love of doing this has helped her to go far. She started making clothes for relatives and she soon acquired an industrial sewing machine with which she was able to increase production. Fortunately she has a lot of clients and she makes some school uniforms.

Estela's effort has helped her to grow as a micro-businesswoman and she now has a lot of demand for school uniforms. It is because of this that she is asking for a loan of $475 which she will use to buy materials. She will repay the amount over a period of 6 months. Today you can help someone who really needs it. Estela and her family sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Estela es casada y tiene tres hijos de 16, 18 y 20 años de edad. Ante la falta de empleo en México, su esposo decidió irse a trabajar a Estados Unidos, sus hijos estaban pequeños y para poder cubrir sus necesidades básicas Estela decidió comenzar su propio negocio hace quince años, ofreciendo sus servicios de costurera, su gusto por este oficio le ha permitido sobresalir, empezó elaborando ropa para sus familiares y poco después adquirió una máquina industrial con la que ha podido incrementar su producción, afortunadamente hoy cuenta con muchos clientes y maquila uniformes para algunas escuelas.

El esfuerzo de Estela la ha llevado a crecer como microempresaria y ahora tiene mucha demanda de uniformes escolares por lo que está solicitando un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Hoy puedes ayudar a quien mas lo necesita, Estela y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: To buy materials/Compra de insumos

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana M. Suárez is married and a mother of three children and belongs to an association called "Armonía de Pro Mujer" (Accord of Pro-Women) in the area of Villa Adela in the city of El Alto. Since five years ago, Susana works hard as a medical supplier to pharmacies, where she has much related experience. Before this work, she was a nurse but had to leave the profession for health reasons.

Currently, Susana works hard only in this activity that even though she does not make money as she would like, it at least allows her to move ahead with all of her family. Thus, she needs more capital to be able to buy more merchandise and increase her inventory and sell them, for in this way, she can improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Susana M. Suárez, casada y madre de tres hijos pertenece a la asociación Armonía de Pro Mujer en la zona de Villa Adela de la ciudad de El Alto. Hace cinco años, Susana se dedica a ser proveedora de medicamentos a farmacias, rubro en el que tiene mucha experiencia, ya que antes de dedicarse a ésta actividad, cumplía funciones de enfermera, profesión que tuvo que dejar de lado por cuestiones de salud.

Actualmente, Susana solo se dedica a esta actividad que si bien no le genera los ingresos que ella desearía, por lo menos le permite salir adelante con toda su familia, por tanto ella precisa de capital para poder adquirir mayor mercadería y ampliar sus productos para de esta manera mediante la venta mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: she needs working capital to purchase a large amount of merchandise to increase her inventory, and thus sales to improve the quality of life

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia Q. Poma, a single mother, prepares and sells fast food, specifically fried empanadas and filled mashed potatoes. She sells them on the outskirts of the city of El Alto. She started out by selling from another person’s location, where they paid her a small commission for what she achieved in sales. She later learned how to prepare the products and started her own business by renting a place in the same neighborhood.

Julia is now the owner of her own place in the outskirts of El Alto and has plans to buy another. Julia needs capital to replace her current kitchen equipment, which is worn out from use. This will allow her to increase her production and volume of sales, and also to supply a second store. She will also buy more ingredients and raw materials.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Julia Q. Poma, madre soltera, se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida rápida, específicamente la elaboración de empanadas fritas y rellenos de papa, que vende en la ceja de la ciudad de El Alto. Se inicio en un puesto ajeno, donde le pagaban una pequeña comisión por lo que ella lograba en ventas, posteriormente aprendió la preparación del producto y emprendió su propio negocio, alquilando un puesto en el mismo sector. Actualmente Julia es dueña de su propio puesto en la ceja de El Alto y tiene planes para la adquisición de un puesto mas. Para esto, Julia precisa de capital para poder primero remplazar su actual cocina, que esta desgastada por el uso, esto le permitirá incrementar el volumen de producción y al mismo tiempo el volumen de venta, abasteciendo un segundo puesto, y para la compra de mas insumos y materia prima, que de seguro incrementará por la demanda.

loans.use: To buy new kitchen equipment, ingredients, and raw materials for making fried empanadas and filled mashed potatoes

loans.name: Feliza

texts.es:
Feliza L. is the treasurer for the Armonía de Pro Mujer association. She is married and the mother of four children. Feliza works in carpentry alongside her husband in their shop, which they have had for the past 10 years. They make a variety of products and fill orders for furniture, doors, and other such items.

Feliza is in need of capital to buy a large quantity of wood, due to the processing time that is necessary to be able to use the material. She also needs to invest in plywood, since this material is difficult to find at the end of the year. Only in this way will she be able to meet existing demand.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Feliza L. es secretaria de hacienda de la asociación de Armonía de Pro Mujer, casada y madre de cuatro hijos. Feliza se dedica al trabajo en carpintería junto con su esposo, en un taller propio el cual tienen hace 10 años, elaborando distintos productos y atendiendo pedidos como muebles puertas y otros. Actualmente Feliza precisa de capital para poder comprar mayor cantidad de madera tomando en cuenta el tiempo de procesado de la misma para poder ser utilizada como materia prima. Del mismo modo necesita invertir en la compra de venesta, ya que este material es escaso a fin de año, solo de esta manera podrá hacer frente a la demanda existente.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of wood, due to the processing time that is necessary to be able to use the material

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María Elena L. is married and the mother of three children. She tends to a events location owned by her family. She has a store there, where she sells a variety of gifts and presents appropriate to the types of events, parties, and celebrations that are held at the location.

Parallel to that business, María also makes and sells lejia (an alkali made from ashes, flour, and some fruits, that is used in chewing coca leaves) at wholesale. This business is making enough money to subsist.

María needs money to be able to increase her production of lejia. She will buy ingredients and raw materials at wholesale prices, and thereby ensure her income and the wellbeing of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

María Elena L., casada y madre de tres hijos, se dedica a la atención de un local de fiestas perteneciente a su familia, en ese recinto ella posee un ambiente donde vende una variedad de regalos y presentes adecuados para el tipo de eventos, fiestas y celebraciones que se realizan en ese local. Paralelamente a esta actividad, María se dedica a la fabricación y venta de lejía (preparado a base de ceniza, azúcar, harina y algunas frutas para acompañar la masticación de la hoja de coca) al por mayor, negocio que está generando los ingresos suficientes para poder subsistir. Actualmente María necesita de dinero para poder incrementar la producción de Lejía, comprando insumos y materia prima al por mayor, de esta manera asegurar sus ingresos y el bienestar de su familia.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and raw materials used to make lejia at wholesale prices

loans.name: Maria Irma

texts.es:
Maria Irma is from San Nicolás de los Garza, in Nuevo León. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a merchant, however, the income he receives is not sufficient to cover the needs of the family. Three of their children are in school, and it is very difficult to cover their expenses, which is why Maria began her own business four years ago selling fruits and vegetables. Fortunately, her business has grown. She now works in the markets. In order to provide good service, her oldest son, who is 14 years old, helps her.

The desire to give her children a good education has motivated Maria to work harder every day. She is requesting a loan of $250.00, which she will use to buy merchandise, so that she can continue growing her business. She offers to repay the loan in 3 months. Today is the time to help. Decide to contribute to the development of this business and improve the life of this family. They are sincerely grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Irma es originaria de San Nicolás de los Garza en Nuevo León, está casada y tiene cuatro hijos, su esposo es comerciante, sin embargo el ingreso que obtiene es muy bajo e insuficiente para cubrir todas las necesidades de su familia, tres de sus hijos están en la escuela y era muy difícil cubrir todos los gastos por lo que Maria inició su propio negocio con la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace cuatro años, afortunadamente ha logrado crecer con su negocio, ahora se instala en los mercados y para poder ofrecer un buen servicio recibe la ayuda de su hijo mayor, de 14 años de edad.

El deseo de darle a sus hijos una buena educación ha motivado a Maria a esforzarse más cada día, ahora está solicitando un préstamo de $250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para continuar creciendo con su negocio, ella ofrece devolver el préstamo en 3 meses. Hoy es tiempo de ayudar, decídete a contribuir al desarrollo de este negocio y mejorar la vida de esta familia, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Remedios

texts.es:
Remedios F. Quispe is a mother with four children. She prepares and sells food from a cart in all of the markets in El Alto.

She has participated with Pro Mujer for five years, which is the same amount of time that she has had this business. Thanks to Pro Mujer she was able to buy what she needed to get started. Remedios used to make cinnamon ice cream, but she had to quit that business to take care of her children, who were very young.

Now she tends to her food cart with help from her children, due to the existing demand and her need to generate income. She is in need of money to buy a mini-bus, which her husband can use to facilitate their work. This will lessen the work load on Remedios and also her children, who work alongside her.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Remedios F. Quispe, es madre de cuatro hijos se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida en un puesto ambulante en todas las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Ingresa a Pro Mujer, hace cinco años, que es el mismo tiempo que ella se dedica a su actividad, puesto que gracias a Pro Mujer ella compra todo lo necesario para la atención de su puesto de venta de comida. Anteriormente Remedios se dedicaba a la fabricación y venta de helados de canela, pero tuvo que dejar esta actividad por no descuidar la atención de sus hijos que eran muy pequeños. Actualmente Remedios atiende su puesto de venta con la ayuda de sus hijos a raíz de la demanda existente y la necesidad de generar ingresos. Ella precisa de dinero para poder comprar un minibús, con el fin de proveer de una herramienta de trabajo a su esposo y de esta manera aliviar su carga laboral, tanto de ella, como de sus hijos que trabajan a su lado

loans.use: To buy a mini-bus, which her husband can use to facilitate their work. This will lessen the work load on Remedios and also her children, who work alongside her.

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.es:
María Antonieta C., a divorced mother of three, is the president of the association of "little ants" (industrious and dilligent workers) for ProMujer (ProWomen). She has worked in the preparation of fried empanadas at a little place installed within her mother's home. Unfortunately and for economic reasons, her mother had to sell her home, consequently leaving María without a source of income. For this reason, María had to dedicate herself to selling her pastries in a different manor. With the help of a small oven, she prepares and sells her products by pushing a little cart through the streets of different parts of the city of El Alto.

María Antonieta already is a well-known person in the parts of town that she visits. She needs capital to buy ingredients so that she will have better sales and be able to fulfill contracts for birthdays, weddings, and other events.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

María Antonieta C., divorciada y madre de tres hijos, es presidenta de la asociación hormiguitas de Pro Mujer. Ella se dedicaba a la preparación de empanadas fritas en un pequeño puesto instalado en casa de su madre. Lastimosamente y por razones económicas se tubo que vender la casa de su madre, dejándola sin fuente de ingresos. Por ese motivo María tuvo que dedicarse a la repostería, con la ayuda de un pequeño horno, ella prepara y vende sus productos deambulando con un pequeño carrito que ella empuja por las distintas zonas de la ciudad de el Alto. María Antonieta ya es un personaje conocido en las zonas que ella visita por tal motivo precisa de capital para la compra de insumos ya que ahora tiene mayor venta y en ocasiones contratos para la atención de cumpleaños, matrimonios y otros.

loans.use: Capital is necessary to buy ingredients for empanadas so that María can fulfill birthday and wedding orders.

loans.name: Armandina

texts.es:
Armandina is a very hardworking and responsible woman. She is married and has two children; they have been the reason why she decided two years ago to begin selling jewelry. Her husband is a carpenter and works on commission and they do not have a secure salary. After seeing their needs, Armandina began her own business so that she would be able to care for their children. Little by little she has increased her number of clients and orders.

In order to offer better service, Armandina is requesting a loan of $200 that she will use to buy merchandise, so she will be able to fill the orders that she has. She promises to repay this amount in three months. Be an important part in the development of this business and in the life of Armandina and her family. Many thanks.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Armandina es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, está casada y tiene dos hijos, ellos han sido el motivo por el cual decidió empezar a vender joyería hace dos años, su esposo es carpintero y trabaja por su cuenta, por lo que no tiene un salario seguro y al ver las necesidades por las que pasaban Armandina inició su propio negocio ya que éste le permitiría estar al cuidado de sus pequeños, poco a poco ha ido incrementando su número de clientes y pedidos.

Para poder ofrecer un buen servicio Armandina está solicitando un préstamo de $ 200 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, para surtir todos los pedidos que tiene, ella promete devolver esta cantidad en 3 meses. Forma parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio y en la vida de Aremandina y su familia, muchas gracias.

loans.use: Jewelry merchandise

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Maria Teresa is married. She has two small children. Her husband works in a local firm, but his salary is very small. To contribute to the family income, Maria Teresa decided to start her own business selling shrimp coktails and ceviche. Her love of cooking and her desire to give her family everything they need have helped Maria increase her business, and demand for her products grows daily.

Maria wants to establish her business on a firmer footing. She wants to buy a food stand, and she is asking for a loan of $250, which she agrees to repay in three months. Be an important factor in helping this business grow, and please decide to support Maria. She and her family will always be grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio and Sarah Padial, Kiva Volunteers

Maria Teresa es casada y tiene dos pequeños hijos, su esposo trabaja en una empresa de la localidad pero recibe un salario muy bajo, para obtener un ingreso extra Maria decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de cócteles de camarón y ceviche hace dos años, su gusto por la cocina y el deseo de darle todo lo necesario a su familia le ha permitido a Maria a crecer con su negocio y la demanda por sus productos mejora día con día.

Maria quiere establecer bien su negocio y para comprar un puesto está solicitando un préstamo de $ 250 dólares, mismos que se compromete a regresar en 3 meses. Forma parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio y decídete a apoyar a Maria, ella y su familia te lo agradecerán siempre.

loans.use: To buy a food stand

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Eleazar

texts.es:
Eleazar is an enterprising woman with a strong desire to get ahead. She is married and lives in Tampico. To help her husband meet household expenses and improve their quality of life, Eleazar started her own business, offering her services as a hair stylist. She set up her living room as a salon in which to offer these services, and today she also makes housecalls. Because of her excellent service, her business has grown along with her clientele. She now wants to buy beauty supplies to expand the range of services she offers.

Currently Eleazar needs a loan of $750 to buy beauty supplies such as dyes, gel, shampoo, and so on. She has agreed to repay the loan in six months. With your help, this business can grow, improving the life of this family. They sincerely appreciate your help.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio and Sarah Padial, Kiva Volunteers

Eleazar es una mujer emprendedora con muchos deseos de superación, está casada y vive en la localidad de Tampico, Tamaulipas. Para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia Eleazar inició su propio negocio ofreciendo sus servicios de estilista hace cuatro años, acondicionando la sala de su casa empezó a trabajar, ahora también lo hace a domicilio, la buena calidad del servicio que ofrece le ha permitido crecer e incrementar su número de clientes así como adquirir equipo para ampliar sus servicios.

En estos momentos Eleazar necesita un préstamo de $ 750 dólares que utilizará para comprar insumos que emplea para realizar su trabajo como tintes, gel, shampoo, etc., ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Con tu ayuda este negocio podrá creer y mejorar la vida de esta familia, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use: To buy beauty supplies

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
Eusebia is 56 years old and lives in the town of Tampico, Tamaulipas. She is married and has three children; only the youngest daughter remains single. Her husband is a mason and with the salary that he receives, it was impossible for the children to keep studying. In order to give them this opportunity, Eusebia began her own business twelve years ago with grocery sales. She set up a place in front of her home to open her shop. Little by little she improved her business to meet the needs of her clients. The good work that she did has allowed her to continue the business for so long.

Now Eusebia needs a loan of $375 that she will use to purchase merchandise and give her store a better supply. She promises to repay this amount in five months. You can be an important part in the development of this business. Choose to support Eusebia; she sincerely appreciates your help.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Eusebia tiene 56 años de edad, vive en la localidad de Tampico, Tamaulipas, está casada y tiene tres hijos, solo la menor está soltera. Su esposo es albañil y con el salario que recibe era imposible que sus hijos continuaran estudiando, para poder darles esa posibilidad Eusebia inició su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes hace 12 años, acondicionando un lugar frente a su casa para abrir su tienda, poco a poco fue surtiendo mejor su negocio para cubrir todas las necesidades de sus clientes, el buen trabajo que realiza le ha permitido continuar en el negocio por tanto tiempo.

Ahora Eusebia necesita un préstamo de $ 375 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para tener un mejor surtido, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 5 meses. Tú puedes formar parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio, decídete a apoyar a Eusebia, ella te lo agradece sinceramente.

loans.use: Merchandise for grocery store.

loans.name: Alioune

texts.fr:
This is a group loan to be shared by the seven members of the Ardica association, led by Mr. Alioune S.. In their loan application, the group describe their business as setting up a tourist shop, selling eco-label souvenirs from the isle of Carabane, which has strong tourism potential. For the group's entire description, please see the French original below: «Contexte : Le présent projet s’appuie sur une zone pilote:l’île de Carabane le village qui en porte le méme nom Le programme dans lequel il s’insére s’intitule SEM du Réseau Sénégalais des Ecovillages et a pour objet la lutte contre la pauvreté dans les villages membres

Rattaché à la région de ZIGUINCHOR Département d’OUSSOUYE arrondissement de KABROUSSE, Communauté rurale de DIEMBERING ,le village de Carabane où convergent tous les flux régionaux de voyageurs et de marchandises ayant choisi la voie maritime

Sous références socioculturelles s’inscrivent dans la culture Diola Katas,connu pour son fort attachement à la terre et l’importance de la valeur du travail,en vue d’assurer son autonomie la population à majorité Diola mène essentiellement des activités de rizicultures,pêche,tourisme,artisanat et petit commerce d’appoint en liaison avec le passage du bateau

Carabane,comme la plupart totalement des nappes phréatiques superficielles,seules sources d’approvisionnement en eau des populations Or,celles-ci subissent un phénomène croissant de salinisation,qui entraine une dégradation globale des conditions environnementales,et affecte du meme coup toutes ses activités

D’une superficie de 57 km² ,l’ile de Carabane se caractérise néanmoins par un potentiel spatial ainsi qu’un potentiel en ressources naturelles,lesquels,s’ils étaient appréhendés de subsistance

Et pour faire face à cette situation,nous contons avec le concours de SEM,mettre en œuvre une série d’activités génératrices de revenus que nous exposons ci-dessous :

Objectif : mettre en œuvre des activités génératrices de revenus

Notre projet veut mettre en place une boutique qui vend des articles imprimés avec le label de l’écovillage de Carabana,étant donné que l’île a une forte potentialité touristique qui permet au visiteur de se ravitailler sur place en cadeaux à emporter Notre ambition est de participer,avec les bénéfices acquis,à l’achat de fourniture didactique aux élèves de la maternelle,du primaire afin de soutenir les parents d’élèves et équiper le foyer des jeunes en matériel audiovisuel et de sonorisation ce qui nous permettra de créer des emplois,et aussi soutenir la jeunesse locale dans ses activités socoiculturelles et sportives

Activités : -Equipement de la boutique artisanale du village et l’équiper -achat de produits bruts -transformation des produits bruts ;(couture,teinture, impression) -Exposition et vente du matériel de la boutique »

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, which provide the rural poor throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these groups are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional associations from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance. Visit our website at www.sem-fund.org to learn more!

loans.use: Tourist Shop

loans.name: Khady

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the five women of the Corepa group, led by Ms. Khady S.. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“This business project is proposed by the Corepa group in Palmarin, a village located in the region of Fatick in central Senegal. Palmarin is a fishing village which, after Joal, is one of the biggest providers of fish in the 'petite cote' region. The main activity of the women of this area is the cleaning and drying of fish and other seafood products.

Our objectives are to improve living conditions, reduce women's labor, and combat migration of young women from the village. The business will consist of purchasing fresh fish, drying them and selling them in the market.”

Original French business description:

«Contexte : Ce projet est un projet du groupement COREPA de palmarin, village situer dans la région de Fatick au centre du Sénégal. Palmarin est un village de pêcheur qui après Joal est l’un des plus grand fournisseur de poisson dans la petite côte. La principale activité des femmes de la localité, reste la transformation et le séchage du poisson et d’autre produits de mer.

Objectifs : Alléger le panier de la ménagère, réduire le travail des femmes, et lutter contre l’exode des jeunes filles Activités : Acheter le poisson frais, le transformé et le revendre dans le marché.»

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance. Visit our website at www.sem-fund.org to learn more!

loans.use: Purchase of fish and equipment for dried fish production

loans.name: Iliganoa

texts.en: Iliganoa is 37 and a mother of six children. She runs a fishing business with her husband. Both she and the husband go out fishing 3 days a week if it’s good weather, but when the weather’s bad, her husband will go alone. The fish they catch they sell along the road side instead of transporting it to the main fish market in town. Most of the people who buy from them are passers by, because they know that they always sell fresh fish. Iliganoa feels that there should be an improvement to their business, which is why she’s now applying for a loan to purchase a fishing boat for her business. She believes that this boat will help them catch more fish and big ones too. She has got all her equipments needed and is looking forward to her new boat.

loans.use: Loan will be used to purchase a paopao (fishing boat)

loans.name: Sophie

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the four women of the Fata Ngouss group, led by Ms. Sophie D.. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“This business project is proposed by women of Palmarin, a village located in the region of Fatick in central Senegal. Palmarin is a fishing village that uses great quantities of salt to produce dried fish and other seafood products.

Our objectives are to increase our production of salt and its value, and to satisfy the demand for salt in the interior of the country. The business will consist of producing sea salt and marketing it throughout the surrounding region.”

Original French business description:

«Contexte : Ce projet est un projet des femmes de palmarin, village situer dans la région de Fatick au centre du Sénégal. Palmarin est un village de pêcheur qui utilise le sel en grande quantité pour le séchage du poisson et d’autres produits halieutique.

Objectifs : Augmenter la production, valorisation du sel et approvisionner le marché intérieur en sel .

Activités : Extraction de sel et vente dans touts les marché de l’intérieur comme de l’extérieur.» Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance. Visit our website at www.sem-fund.org to learn more!

loans.use: Production and marketing of sea salt - paying men to dig wells in the nearby salt flats, purchase of  equipment to produce salt, and transportation of the finished product to market

loans.name: Faavevela

texts.en: Faavevela F. is a 35-year old mother of four children; she’s also a new member to the programme, running a fishing business. Faavevela feels confident about her business - that it’s earning good money with fewer expenses. All they have to buy and keep in stock are the batteries and strings unless there’s a need for replacement for equipment. Faavevela doesmost of her fishing on Saturday night, to sell on Sunday morning at the fish market where fish sell quickly for a good price. With her requested loan, she plans to buy a cooler to keep her fish in when selling it, instead of hanging them out which gives the fish an off taste.

loans.use: Loan will be used to purchase a cooler

loans.name: Sepuita

texts.en: Sepuita's talent has become a major helping hand to her family. She’s a creative lady that enjoys designing materials. She never attended any training to learn how to print, but everything came natural to her. She’s a mother of only 1 son, who is six years old. Sepuita is now 42 years old and can’t have another baby, due to the removal of her other ovary that was infected. Her elei printing business has become famous to some of the Ministries in town. Her main customers are the employees of the Samoa Water Authority whom she supplies with printed yards of materials for their uniforms. Not only does she supply for the ministry, she also supplies individual orders from the employees and she says it’s now getting to the stage that she’ll need a helping hand in providing the materials - there is too much demand and she can’t handle it. So with her requested loan, she’ll be purchasing more materials and fabric paints for her production, and will also be looking at hiring someone to help her out with her business.

loans.use: Loan will be used to purchase more materials and fabric paints.

loans.name: Tafaoga

texts.en: Tafaoga F. is  25-year old  mother of 2 who runs a fishing business. She joined SPBD six months ago when seeking financial support to start her business. She has now got a business that is running well with great support from her husband and relatives. Tafaoga has never had any experience in fishing, but learned a lot from her husband, and is very interested in her business now. Both her and her husband are otherwise unemployed, and their business is what they’ll be concentrating on in order to save up some money to send their two kids to school. Neither of them got a chance to graduate from school due to lack of support from their families, and it’s a problem that they want to overcome, so it does not happen to their children. Tafaoga aims to stay longer in the programme and maintain her business for a better future for her family.

loans.use: Loan will be used to purchase new fishing gear

loans.name: Onosai

texts.en: Onosai M. is a 72-year old mother of twelve children. She’s one of the very active old members in the program who started with a pig rearing business, then took on a taro plantation, and is now running a shop business. She is the chief of their community of 32 ladies, all active except one that is now working. With her great support in their community, she has been able to help the young women follow in her footsteps; she has become a great role model to all the ladies in her community, and also the program. She is one of the best savers as well and this encourages the other ladies to save up like her. With her years in business, she has now ended up with a shop, which she believes suits her strength and age. With her requested loan, she will  purchase a freezer and to restock  her shop. Good members like her are needed in the program.

loans.use: Loan will be used to purchase a large freezer and restock her shop.

loans.name: Ualesi

texts.en: Ualesi S. is a single mother of two children running a taro plantation business. She lives together with her 2 children in her parents' house. Rhe great support of her parents has now made it possible for Ualesi to run her taro plantation herself. She works at her plantation every day of the week except Sunday, and sells her taros at the main market on Saturdays only. Ualesi is looking at ways to export her taro to one of the neighboring islands American Samoa, where there’s good money to be earned. Ualesi has requested a loan of $300 to buy weed killer chemicals and fertilizers for her business.

loans.use: Loan will be used to purchase chemicals

loans.name: Kika

texts.en: Kika F. is a strong 35-year old mother of eleven children from the village of Faleasiu. Having eleven children is not making her nervous or struggle in bringing them up. Her husband is a brick layer by profession who works at Graigs Construction, and also doing extra work for himself on Saturdays, which is giving him extra earnings apart from his salary. Kika’s business is a food stall, doing sandwiches, donuts, fried chicken and sausages. She supplies to the village primary school 5 days a week. With her previous loan she purchased a new gas stove to place in her house for easy preparation of her food. With her requested loan she plans to buy equipment like a frying pan, toaster and other equipment to help provide the best product.

loans.use: Loan will be used to purchase equipment and ingredients for her products.

loans.name: Adolat

texts.ru:
Adolat S., 40 is married and has 2 children. She has been in business for a few years. Adolat buys vegetables wholesale and then resells them at local markets. The wholesale market is located on the border with Uzbekistan. Adolat and her husband go there early in the morning to purchase vegetables from Uzbek wholesalers. Because Adolat resells at the below-the-market prices, she has a lot of clients. Adolat asks for this loan to finance wholesale purchase of vegetables, while the prices remain low, so that she can earn additional profit.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Адолат 40 лет, она замужем и у нее 2 детей. Вот уже несколько лет она занимается мелким предпринимательством. Она оптом покупает овощи и продает их по окрестным рынкам. Оптовый рынок расположен на границе с Узбекистаном. Она и ее муж едут туда рано утром, и когда узбекские оптовики приходят к границе, они покупают у них овощи. Цены Адолат старается придерживать ниже рыночных и поэтому у нее много клиентов. Сейчас Адолат хочет получить новый займ для оптовой закупки овощей, так как цены приемлемые. Это принесет ей дополнительную прибыль.

loans.use: For wholesale purchase of vegetables

loans.name: Eyzangul

texts.en:
is a refugee from the Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict territory Gubadli region, situated in the western part of Azerbaijan.  She is 37 years old and amother of 2 children.  She began her business with $300 in 2004. At first, she was selling children's clothing and earning little money. This money was enough for only some of her family's basic needs. She had difficulty in covering other family consumption needs for medication, clothes, school etc. 
 
Eyzangul travels around and sells a range of products.  She wants to improve her business and increase the number of clients and income. Eyzangul wants to sell her goods at the central market to private customers, rather than having to travel around. She thinks that expanding her business like this will improve the living conditions of her family. She will repay the loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To open a stall at the central market to sell her goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more fruit to sell in her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more pumpkins to sell in her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more tomatoes to sell, and to build a shop to store them in

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: There has been an increment in my profit making since I started borrowing from LAPO says Mrs. Ann I. who hails from Benin City, Nigeria.
