She has been with LAPO for 3 years; she is 37 years old, married mother of five (5) children. she sells food stuffs in an open-air market. She has been in this business since 1998. She needs the US$ 800 loan to buy more foodstuffs and drinks and increase her profit.

loans.use: To buy drinks and foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Docas

texts.en: Mrs. Docas E. is 51 years old, married, and a mother of six.  She sells beads and decorating materials.  She also provides decorating services at special occasions such as weddings and marriage ceremonies.  She started her business in 1997.  She has the intention of increasing the size of her business with a loan of US $625.  She is the secretary of her union (LAPO).

loans.use: To buy more beads and decorating materials

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mr. P. Pov is married and has 6 children: 4 sons and 2 daughters. He has been in the fishing business for almost 20 years. He began fishing by learning from the older generation in his family. When not fishing, he raises vegetables, and his wife sells the fish and vegetables in the local market or in other villages.

He has received three loans from MAXIMA, which has helped him improve his business. He is requesting another loan in the amount of $400 so he can purchase one fishing boat and fishing net, which will enable him to further improve his business and his income.

loans.use: To purchase one fishing boat and fishing net to expand existing business.

loans.name: Chnathou

texts.en:
Mrs. D. Chanthou is married in 2004 with 1 son. She just started her business of weaving scarf by using semi-automatic machine at home in early this year. So far she learned and worked for the neighbor in weaving scarf. She currently owns one machine and now she purchases two more semi-automatic machines to expand her business in scarf production. One machine will be setting up for her husband, who is currently assisting her sometimes. Another one she will hire her neighbor to weave. 

She is asking a loan from MAXIMA for the first time with the amount of $800. She will use this part of loan to purchase 2 semi-automatic machines and cotton fabric to expand her scarf production.

loans.use: Purchasing two more scarf semi-automatic machine and cotton fabric.

payments.comment:
Dear lenders,

Mrs. Chnathou Deap has enough money to pay off her loan early before contract. Thank you so much for lending to her.

loans.name: Benedict

texts.en: The industrious Mrs. Benedict O. sells clothes, bags and shoes at her shop in the market.  She is seeking a US $800 loan to buy more clothes, bags and shoes to sell.  She is 43 years old, married, and the mother of five children.

loans.use: to buy clothes, bags and shoes to sell

loans.name: Seak

texts.en:
Mrs. K. Seak is married and has 4 children: 3 sons and 1 daughter. She has sold the Khmer noodle and desserts in the local market since 1988. Her husband plants vegetables in the village and has been a motor-taxi driver since 1987. These business activities have provided the necessary income to send all of their children to school.

Mrs. Seak has had two loans from MAXIMA. She is now requesting loan from MAXIMA for $200. She will use this loan to buy a new motorbike for her husband's motor-taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike for her husband's motor-taxi business

loans.name: Thou

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Thou is married and has 7 children: 4 sons and 3 daughters. She learned to weave silk from her the older generation in her family since 1966 and she started her silk production at that time. She did not weave during the Khmer Rouge regime from 1975-1979. She began her weaving again after 1979. Her husband is a wood-construction contractor, which he contracts to do with the community people. 

She has had 5 loans from MAXIMA. She is now requesting a loan of $200, which she will use loan to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom. This will improve her income and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Mrs. Elizabeth O. is 32 years old, married and a mother of two children. She is a leader of one of LAPO's unions.  She is currently in the 4th stage of a loan. She has a tailoring shop and also sells provisions. She is an industrious woman that has the zeal to boost her business.  In addition, she has 6 years of experience in running a business and hopes to buy more crates of drinks and tailoring materials with a US $400 loan.

loans.use: to buy tailoring materials and crates of drinks

loans.name: Hasifa

texts.en:
N. Hasifa, commonly known as Hajjati, is a resident of Mengo, a suburb of Kampala city. She is 45 years of age with six children, three boys and three girls. Fortunately, her first-born finished University and has gotten a job recently. Her other children are in secondary school. Her husband died some time back; fortunately she has managed to look after her children very well.

She operates a retail shop near the hospital and sells sugar, rice, samosas, doughnuts, bread, various categories of juices, air-time cards for mobile phones and operates a pay phone. All this at the end of the day generates approximately USD180 in sales. She is very grateful to Pearl Microfinance, which has enabled her to make her life meaningful and giving a bright future to her children.

Hajjati started with a loan of USD170 in 2001 and since then she has never stopped. She has been able to borrow USD285, 457 and 570 which she comfortably paid back. At the beginning of the term, she normally depletes her stock because of the requirements of school-going children. The loan will help her to restock her shop to operate smoothly.

loans.use: Hajjati wants to restock her shop with 5 bags of sugar, 3 bags of rice, assorted biscuits, toothpaste and juices.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia I. is 45 years old married mother of six (6) children. She has 14 years experience in business. She has equally been a LAPO member for 4 years. She hails from semi-urban area in Edo State. She sells provisions, drinks and food stuffs in her shop. Patricia says she need a loan US$1,175 to enable her buy more provisions, drinks and food stuffs for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, foodstuffs & drinks for sale

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet K. is a young entrepreneur, aged 30. She is married with three children aged six, four and two years. Her first-born is in primary one while the rest spend their time with their grandmother.

Juliet sells matoke (green bananas), a staple food for Baganda and Banyankore. There is ready market because a big percentage of the population in Kampala eat matoke. In addition to matoke, she sells tomatoes, onions and cassava at wholesale. In a week she is able to make two trips, which give her net sales of about USD860 and a net profit of about USD170.

She started with a loan of USD100, and to date she has built a permanent house with her husband who sells motor spare parts. She plans to buy her own pick-up in future to help her transport her bananas and other food items. This will cut the cost of transport as well as supplying matoke to clients on time.

loans.use: Juliet wants to buy more bunches of matoke, at least a lorry-load per week, to meet the ever increasing demand.

loans.name: Hesret

texts.ru:
Hesret M. was born in 1966 in Aksu where he lives today. Hesret is a good family man and a father of 3 children. In 2005, he took $300 loan from Aksu branch of Normicro to start a mobile sales business. Now, Hesret M. drives a taxi. He asks for a loan to repair his taxi car.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Хесрет Мамедов. 1966 год.рождения. Родилься и проживает в городе Аксу.Хороший семьянин, имеет троих детей. 2005 году взял в кредит 300$ из Нормикро Аксунского филиала и начал заниматься передвижной торговлю. Теперь Хесрет занимаеться таксовкой. Он нуждаеться в кредите , чтобы отремонтировать свою машину.

loans.use: Auto repair

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Mrs. Elizabeth J. is 47 years old, married and the mother of five children. She is a leader in one of LAPO's unions.  She runs a business selling provisions and producing nylon. This business, which she runs with her husband, enable her to pay for family expenses. She has 14 years of experience in this business.  She is requesting for a loan of US $550 to buy more provisions and materials needed to produce nylon.

loans.use: to buy more provisions and materials for the production of nylon

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a 30-year-old mother of three, a resident of the Buguruni community in the Dar Es Salaam area. She sells common traditional attire known as kanga and Vitenge. (The yellow and black one she is putting on is called kanga in Swahili). She buys her stock from Kariakoo, Dar Es Salaam’s trading powerhouse and sells in the Buguruni area as a retailer. She also owns a small restaurant in addition to her clothing business.

She has been in business for the past two years, and it has helped her to support her children at school since she is a single mother. She is in need of USD 400 to help boost her business.

loans.use: Boost her business

loans.name: Nazek

texts.en:
Nazek A. M. works from her home in Sabra. She does crochet and knitting work and sells it to various shops. She also has clients that visit her to make orders. Nazek is a wife and a mother of 3 children, the youngest one being 6 months old. She needs $300 to buy the necessary materiA. for her knitting and crochet work.

Nazek is part of a group with other women. Her group name is 'A. zouhour,' which means flowers. This is a group of self-chosen women, living in vulnerable conditions, mostly in rurA. areas. Group lending is based on an incrementA. increase of loan amount and group solidarity to guarantee repayment. The strength of the group loan is that is encourages the collaborative approach in the borrowing community. The group loan is a very powerful tool towards women's economic empowerment.

loans.use: To buy material for crochet and knitting work

loans.name: Ebtissam

texts.en:
Ebtissam A. H. sells all kinds of goods. You can find perfumes, make up, deodorants, creams, everything related to cosmetics. To support her family and her 5 children she started her business 3 years ago from home in Ard jalloul. 
Now that the academic year is about to begin she wants to buy clothing for children at school: pants, shirts etc. 1000$ is the amount that can help her expand her business.

loans.use: buy clothing

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Mrs. Edith A. is 36 years old, married and a mother of six children.  She is a member of one of LAPO's unions.  She hails from Edo State, Nigeria. She sells kerosene to people in her community.  She is seeking a loan US $400 to expand her business. She has three years of experience in her business.

loans.use: to buy kerosene to sell

loans.name: Zebo

texts.en: A. Zebo is one of the active clients of MicroInvest. She engaged in business for over 9 years. She is very honest   and responsible person. She always repays her loans in time. She is married and has 3 children. Her business is to trade of biscuits, cakes and candies. She has many clients and her business is going well. For September she received big order from two wedding and she needs in extra capital for making purchase. She must purchase 12 boxes of candies, 8 boxes of biscuits and 20 kg of cakes.

loans.use: Business developing

loans.name: Naila

texts.en: Naila R. is an Internally Displaced Person from the Jabrail region of Azerbaijan. In 1993 she fled to Baku and settled in the Darnagul settlement  with her two children as a result of the military conflict with Armenia. Naila is a widow so she has to provide for her two children herself.  She travels around selling clothes, household items etc. .This is the only way she can earn a living for her family. She sells from her house as well. In 2006 she applied to the Normicro Baku branch and borrowed 300$ to buy more goods to sell. Having successfully repaid the first loan, she is now applying for a loan of 800$ to oncrease her inventory.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Shafoat

texts.en: Aripova Shafoat is mother of 5 children. She is a good businesswoman. Her business is trade of household goods. She engaged in trade for over 10 years. During this time she got enough experience in trade. Today she has many constant clients and she knew their style. She always tries to attract them with the variety of her goods. Most of her clients are housewives. Shafoat easily helps them to find goods, in which they need. All her clients are very satisfied of her service. In nearest future she wants to increase her working capital and collect money for her son’s wedding.

loans.use: Business developing

loans.name: Godwin

texts.en: Mr. Godwin A. is 37 years old, married and the father of six children.  He is a leader in one of LAPO's union and he been engaged in his business since 2004.  He produces liquid soap, toilet washes and air fresheners.  The people in his community likes his products. He needs a loan of $400 to buy materials for the production of soap.

loans.use: to buy materials for the production of soap

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Mrs. Grace O. is a widow and the mother of seven children. She is 54 years old and sell provisions, drinks and ground tomatoes for a living.  She hopes to buy more drinks, provisions and a machine for grinding tomatoes with a US $250 loan.  She has been in this business since 2002.  She has been with LAPO for 4 years and she depends on the profit from her business to take care of her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy more drinks, provisions and an additional machine for grinding tomatoes

loans.name: Muminjion

texts.en: Muminjon is an experienced person in the Ckalovsk market, in Khujand. He works here since 1994. He started his business from trade of national bread and watermelons. He has big family: his wife, 5 children and his old parents. For supporting his family he tried every day to develop his business. Gradually he increased his turnover and changed his business to trade of different kind of meat product such as sausages, ground meat and meat loaf. He has an agreement with several workshops of meat product. His business is going well. He has good turnover of his working capital. In future he plans to increase the number of his product and for this action he needs in additional refrigeration.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy an additional sewing machine and beauty shop supplies.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 40-year-old mother of three, a resident of the Buguruni area in Dar es Salaam city. She sells Vitenge (traditional attire) and cosmetics. She is been doing business for the past four years and is a recipient of the Youth Self Employment Foundation organized business and entrepreneur trainings.

Ever since she received the training, her business has improved and she can now make more profit than before and is able to cater for most of her family needs. She is in need of USD 550 to help her expand the business.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en: Mr. Anthony O. is 32 years old, married and the father of three children. He sells drinks, provisions, and foodstuffs in addition to being a tailor.  His business has potential for growth if he has enough funds.  He wants to improve his business with a loan of $400.  He has been in this business since 2006 and is a LAPO member.

loans.use: to buy more drinks, provisions, foodstuffs and tailoring materials

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Mrs. Felicia U. is a married mother of four children.  She is 29 years old. She hails from Benin City, Edo State in Nigeria.  Everyone in the community needs kerosene.  Felicia hopes to receive a loan of $400 so that she can buy more kerosene to sell.  This will improve her turnover and profit.

loans.use: to buy kerosene to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy two dairy cows

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Mrs. Eunice A. is 39 years old and is married with three children.  She hails from Benin City, Edo State, in Nigeria.  She sells provisions, drinks and foodstuffs.  She has been in this business since 1992.  She needs a $250 loan to buy more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.use: to buy more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther T. is 35 years old, married and the mother of two children.  She has been in LAPO as a union leader for the past 2 years.  She hails from a semi-urban in Benin City, Edo State, in Nigeria. She sells wholesale drinks and provisions.  She has been in her business since 2000 and needs a loan of $800 to buy drinks and provisions to sell.

loans.use: to buy more drinks and provisions

loans.name: Kimbaire

texts.en:
A. is a 33-year-old single mother, resident of the Buguruni area in Dar Es Salaam City. She owns a kiosk, which sells mainly water and soda and other soft drinks, a business that is common inhot and humid Dar Es Salaam. She has been in various businesses for the past seven years, and alongside her kiosk, she also sells used clothes.

She now wants to build a permanent premises for her shop and expand her stock. She is in need of USD 450 to facilitate a few of her plans.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Queenett

texts.en: Queenett N. is married and a mother of two children.  She hails from a semi-urban area in Benin City, Edo State, in Nigeria.  She rents out building tools such as wheelbarrows, shovels, head pans, sledge hammers etc. to builders and individuals in need of these tools. She is seeking a $400 loan to buy more tools for her business.

loans.use: to buy wheelbarrows, shovels, and head pans to rent out

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Mrs. Florence N. is married and has eight children.  She is 50 years olds and sells provisions, drinks and foodstuffs for a living.  She hails from Benin City, Edo State, in Nigeria. She has been in her business since 1990.  She needs a loan of $175 to buy more provisions and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.use: to buy more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs

loans.name: Aziza

texts.ru:
Aziza D. was born in 1956 in Aksu. She is married and has 6 children. Aziza started her business to provide for her family. She rented a space at the central market where she sells fruits and vegetables. Normicro helped her with $500 loan. Now, Aziza wants to expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Азиза Джафарова, родилась 1956 году в городе Аксу.Замужем имеет шестеро детей. Чтобы обеспечиват семью она начала заниматься бизнесом. Центральном рынке в городе Аксу арендовала место для продаж фруктами и овощами. Она обратилась за помощью Нормикро Аксуниского филиала. Взяла кредит 500$.Теперь Азиза хочеть расширят свой бизнес.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Chioma

texts.en: "There has been an increase in my business since I started borrowing from LAPO," says Mrs. Chioma O., who hails from the urban sector in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She 32 years old, married, the mother of three (3) children. She bas been in this business since 2005 and needs the loan amount of $800 to buy more cloths and shoes for sale. She has been a LAPO client for 7 years.

loans.use: To buy more singlets, boxers shorts and shoes

loans.name: Nigarkhanum

texts.ru:
Nigarkhanum T. was born in 1953. She was born and lives in the town of Aksu. Nigarkhanum is a widowed mother of 4 children. When her husband died, her family lived through some hard times. Nigarkhanum was able to recover by taking a $300 loan from Aksu branch of Normicro. She used the money to start selling fruits and vegetables on the central market. Now, Nigarkhanum wants to take another loan to increase the variety of goods sold. Nigarkhanum expresses her gratitude to all of you, who consider helping her and others.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Тарвердиева Нигарханум 1953 года рождения.Родилась и проживает в городе Аксу. Имеет четверо детей, вдова. Когда умер муж семье стало тяжело.Взяла в кредит из Нормикро Аксуниского филиала 300$ .На центральном рынке начала заниматься торговли фруктами и овощами.Теперь она хочеть взять еще кредит чтобы, купить больше товаров.Нигарханум благодарна тем людям который ей помогает.

loans.use: To increase the variety of goods sold

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Mrs. Victoria E. is 60 years of age, married with eight (8) children. She sells native pottery and firewood. She has been a leader in a union for the past 8 years and hails from urban sector of Benin City, Nigeria. She has been in this business since 1985 & she is seeking a $400 loan to buy more firewood and clay and to improve her turnover.

loans.use: To buy firewood and clay to make native pots for sale

loans.name: Josephine Friday

texts.en: "I am proud to be a LAPO member for 7 years," explained by Mrs. Josephine Friday A.. She is 35 years old, married, and the mother of 5 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State. She sells yams in the market and hopes to improve her turnover & profit with the loan amount of $400. She has been in this business since 1994.

loans.use: To buy more yam

loans.name: Saimon

texts.en:
Saimon is a resident of Gongolamboto area, in Dar es Salaam. Saimon owns a butchery and buys cows and slaughters them at his site. On an average, he slaughters two to three cows and his business pays most during festival seasons and at the end of month. Clients do come direct to his site, and sometimes he distributes the meat for those other clients by special request. He has been in this business for the past seventeen years. He also owns a grocery alongside his butcher shop.
Saimon is in need of USD 350 to help him expand both of the businesses.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Cresty

texts.en: Cresty S. is an experienced trader who sells yams to people in her neighborhood and has a shop in the market. She is from a rural area in Edo State, aged 32, married, and the mother of 5 children. She is a LAPO member. She has been in this business since 2000. She needs $400 to buy more yams to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.use: To buy more yams

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla is a widow with two grown daughters. She lives in Melitopol, Ukraine. Alla started as an entrepreneur selling bicycle components. However, it was not a profitable business and Alla decided to change her type of inventory. She now sells household supplies in the central market. She has rich experience working in this trade, and has been a market vendor for 12 years. Currently, she has about $1400 in inventory. Her gross income is about $1000 a month and her net profit is about $250 a month. Alla supports her family, and helps her elderly, retired Mom too. 

She is requesting a loan of $600 to increase her stock, which will improve sales and improve the living standards of her family. Her ability to be a good manager of her business, to stay optimistic and to offer good customer service will definitely help her succeed in her venture and repay this loan without delinquency

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Vera

texts.en: A mother of two children and aged 34 years old, Vera hails from Benin City in Edo State. She sells provisions in her community. Mrs. Vera O. has been able to send her two children to school. She is a LAPO leader in one of the unions. She is looking forward to getting this loan of $550 to improve her business and buy more provisions for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sale

loans.name: Ulyana

texts.en:
Ulyana is married with two twin sons. She lives in Stryi, Western Ukraine. Ulyana sells men’s clothing and knitted wear in the city market. Her business stall is well known for having a good selection of inventory and reasonable prices. Ulyana has been in this trade for 10 years. Currently, she has about $3000 in inventory. Her gross income is about $1400 and her monthly net profit is about $400. Ulyana has repaid 4 loans from Nadiya Ukraine without any delinquencies.   

She is requesting a loan of $500 to re-stock her inventory before the fall season so she can increase her income. She wants to invest her profit in her sons’ college education. She believes her main goal as a Mom is to make sure her sons get a good education and do well in life. Moreover, Ulyana wants to provide her family with everything they need and improve their financial situation.

loans.use: To purchase 40 men’s sweaters/pullovers

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mrs. Mary I. is the owner of Mary Boutique in Upper Sakponba Road, Benin City, Edo State. She sells baby-wear in her boutique. She is 43 years old, married, mother of four (4) children. She has been in this business since 1988 and also a LAPO member. She is eager to get the loan for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more baby clothing for sale

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is a divorced mother of two children. Her son resides in Moscow, Russia and is working there. Her daughter is 17-years old and just graduated from high school this year. Tatyana would love to see her daughter obtain a good education and would like to use earnings from her seafood sales business to support her daughter and help her go to college.

Tatyana has run a small kiosk selling frozen fish and sea products (seaweed, crab meat, shrimp, etc.) for four years. She is a happy, joyful, hard-working lady who enjoys her business and her customers. She is one of the few competitors in her market that sells fish and sea products in the summer, so she has a good business demand and likes to have a nice assortment to offer her customers.

Tatyana is requesting a $300 loan to broaden her inventory. She always requests small loans, because the great turn around enables her to repay very fast. Her hard work and great entrepreneurial business habits have helped her be successful and support herself. She makes about 1,000 to 1,200 Ukrainian Ghrivna ($200-$240) per month in profit and has around 5-6 thousand Ghrivna invested in inventory.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Ariza

texts.ru:
Ariza M. was born in 1964 in the town of Aksu, where she lives now. She is married and has 3 children. In the past, Ariza’s family raised cattle. In 2004, Ariza M. took a $200 loan from Aksu branch of Normicro to purchase sheep. Since 2006, Ariza switched to selling clothing for women. Now, she wants to expand her business by adding clothing for children to her assortment of goods. Ariza asks for a $1000 loan to fund the expansion.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Ариза Мехтиева, родилась 1964 году в городе Аксу. Данный момент проживает в этом же городе. Семейная, имеет троих детей. Семья ранще занималась скотоводством. 2004 году она взяла кредит из Нормикро Аксуниского филиала 200$ и купила овцы .С 2006 года Ариза стала заниматься торговли женскими одеждами.Теперь она хочеть расширят бизнес и торговат детскими одеждами.Она еще раз хочеть взять кредит 1000$.

loans.use: To increase inventory for business expansion

loans.name: Vasiliy

texts.en: Vasily is a hard-working entrepreneur from the Ivano-Frankovsk region in Ukraine. He owns a small market vending business where he sells house shoes and robes at this busy locale. Vasily decided to start his own business after he was unable to find other work. Now, two years later, he has about $2000 invested in inventory and he makes about $700 a month profit. In addition to his business, Vasily also works part time as a tractor driver in the small village where he lives, which enables him to earn a little more income. Vasily has requested a loan of $800 to purchase some new inventory for his business. The extra capital will allow him to buy 120 pairs of house shoes and 100 new robes. Vasily will use profits from his business to improve his standard of living and do some remodeling to his home.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Mrs. Doris Aghourenren is 38 years old. She lives in a semi-urban area of Benin City, Edo, Nigeria, where she sells drinks, provisions and fried meat to people. She is married and the mother of 6 children. She is a dedicated client of LAPO. According to her, if given the sum of $550, her business will be able to expand and she will be able to buy more provisions, drinks and meat for sale. She has been in business since 2004.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, drinks & meat

loans.name: Atanacio

texts.es:
Atanacio is 37. He and Carmen, 35, have four children between the ages of 8 and 17. His oldest son helps him with his daily chores. Atanacio didn't have the opportunity to go to school; he completed only the sixth grade, because his family was poor. He says that he has a plot where he grows an assortment of vegetables, including lettuce, chard, broccoli, cauliflower, and parsley. He began working when he was very young on his parents' farm, but he struck out on his own twelve years ago and today has his own farm that generates adequate income. He gets up early every day to travel to the market, near the capital, where he sells his produce. With much sacrifice and effort, he was able to pull together the money to buy a pick-up truck, which is now indispensable in his work. He would use the loan to buy needed supplies such as fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio and Sarah Padial, Kiva Volunteers

loan of Atanacio tiene 37 años, vive en pareja con Carmen que tiene 35 años de edad. Tienen 4 hijos de entre 17 y 8 años. El mayor de sus hijos ya le ayuda en sus labores diarias. No tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, solamente hizo hasta el 6to. año de la primaria, debido a que provenía de una familia muy humilde. Comenta que tiene una huerta en donde cultiva todo tipo de hortalizas como ser: lechuga, acelga, brócoli, coliflor, perejil, etc. Comenzó a trabajar desde muy pequeño en la huerta de sus padres pero hace 12 años que se independizó y hoy día tiene su propio cultivo que le genera muy buenas ganancias. Todos los días se levanta muy temprano para trasladarse hasta el mercado de abasto de la ciudad capital para comercializar sus productos. Con mucho sacrifico y esfuerzo logró reunir dinero para comprarse una camioneta que hoy día es un instrumento de trabajo indispensable para el mismo. En esta oportunidad necesita de un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de insumos que utiliza en sus cultivos como ser: abono, semillas e insecticidas.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides

loans.name: Catharine

texts.en: Mrs Catharine E. sells wooden combs to people in her community. She is 54 years of age, married, and mother of 7 children. She is the secretary of her union in LAPO. She needs the loan amount of $625 to boost her business, which she started 2002.

loans.use: To buy more for sales

loans.name: Docas

texts.en: Mrs. I. Docas rears pigs on her farm and sells them to people living in her community. She is 43 years of age, married, and the mother of 3 children. She is a leader of her union (LAPO). She needs a loan of $925 to buy more piglets for sale. She started this business in 1997.

loans.use: To buy more piglets

loans.name: Vero

texts.en: Mrs. Vero A., a LAPO distinguished client, cherishes taking about LAPO loans & the poor in Nigeria. She rears birds and sells them. She is 54 years old, a widow, and mother of 3 children. She is seeking an $800 loan to buy more birds and feeds for sale, and also to support her family. She started this business in 1990.

loans.use: To buy more birds & feed

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: "I am encouraged about my business," says Mrs. Joy E.. She is 26 years old, married, and the mother of three (3) children. She is from Benin City. She sells electrical appliances & electronics to the public. She hopes to buy more electrical appliances and electronics for sale if this loan is given to her. She has been in business since 2000.

loans.use: To buy appliances and electronics for sale

loans.name: Amelia Domingos

texts.pt:
Amelia is married, and mother of 2children. She joined the Program for the Development of Women in 2006. She initially borrowed 125$. Since her business benefited from the loan and prospered, she decided to request more loans in order to increase her stock to keep up with growing demand. Amelia sells her merchandize at her stand in the market of the Limpopo city.

She is a reliable borrower since she has repaid her previous loans on time. Since her business has been thriving, Amelia noticed improvements in her life. She is now able to help her husband with the home expenses. In the future she plans on continuing her accounting studies which she had to abandon when she had her first child. In addition she is able to provide a more balanced diet for her family. Amelia hopes that all continues well so she can buy a home and move from her in-laws.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Amelia é casada e tem 2 filhos. Entrou para o Programa do Fundo de Desenvolvimento da Mulher em 2006, tendo tomado um empréstimo no valor de $125. Porque o negócio dela prosperava foi tomando mais empréstimos, para poder responder a demandada. Neste preciso momento ela quer tomar um terceiro emprestimo, para poder aumentar o numero de fardos de roupa dada a crescente demanda, justificada pelo numero de clientes que diariamente visitam a sua banca. Ela desenvolve as suas actividades num dos mercados da cidade chamado Limpopo.

Ela é uma boa cliente, pois que sempre pagou pontualmente a sua dívida, Pelo facto de o seu negócio estar a crescer, notam-se mudanças positivas na sua vida. Ela já consegue apoiar o marido nas despesas caseiras. e no futuro pensa dar continuidade aos seus estudos terminando o curso de Contabilidade, que o interrompera no nível básico por falta de condições financeiras para o fazer. Isto porque estava no começo de sua vida de casada e a chegada repentina do primeiro filho. Por outro lado já consegue assegurar uma dieta equilibrada para a sua família o que contribui para um crescimento harmonioso e saudável para os seus filhos. Se tudo continuar a correr bem como tem sido até então pensa futuramente em ter sua própria casa, pois que de momento vive em casa dos sogros.

loans.use: Amelia precisa do emprestimo para a compra de mais fardos de roupa para a venda, pois que a procura aumentou devido ao numero de clientes que visitam a sua banca.

loans.name: Isoken

texts.en: "I started benefiting from LAPO loan in 1999," says Isoken A.. She is 37 years old and is the secretary of a LAPO union and she is from Benin City. She sells drinks to the community and is the married mother of three (3) children. She needs the loan to boost her business and buy more drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more crates of drinks for sale

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Mrs. Florence O. says that LAPO came to her rescue in 2000 when she was in need of money to boost her business. She is 32 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She is from Benin City and sells provisions and drinks to the public. If given an $800 loan, she promises to expand her business and buy more drinks and provisions.

loans.use: To buy more crates of drinks & provisions

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es:
Freddy produces cow milk that he sells to PIL Andina (a milk industrial plant). He also does work as a bricklayer and mason in his community. By these two means, he earns an income that he uses to take care of his family, which includes his wife and four year-old son. They live in the town of Chahuira-Pampa located two and a half hours from the city of La Paz.

Freddy will use the loan to buy a milk cow of a superior breed to increase the production of milk. It is his first loan with IMPRO and the evaluation done for him qualifies him to receive a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Freddy, es productor de leche de vaca que comercializa a Pil Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche), también se dedica a trabajos de albañilería en la comunidad, logrando así ingresos con los que mantiene a su familia que consta de su esposa un hijo de 4 años. Vive en la Comunidad de Chahuira-Pampa ubicada a dos horas y media de la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo destinara en la compra de una vaca lechera de raza mejorada para incrementar la producción de leche. Es el primer crédito con Impro y la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo

loans.use: Purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Eduviges

texts.es:
Mrs. Eduviges G. lives on Unión Fátima Avenue in the city of El Alto. She has a kiosk from which she sells meat dishes, vegetable dishes, cookies, and so on. She has two children who currently live with her. Her husband works as a farmhand in the country. She would use the loan to buy merchandise to sell from her kiosk, increasing her sales and income. This is her first loan with IMPRO. The evaluation IMPRO conducted qualifies her to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio and Sarah Padial, Kiva Volunteers

La señora Eduviges vive en la avenida Unión Fátima de Villa Cooperativa de la ciudad de El Alto, posee un kiosco donde se dedica al comercio de refrescos carne, verduras, galletas etc. Tiene dos hijos que actualmente viven con ella, su esposo trabaja en el área rural. El crédito será invertido en la compra de mercadería para su negocio y así mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Es el primer crédito con Impro. La evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to sell from her kiosk

loans.name: Casiano

texts.es:
Caciano lives on Carmen Álvarez Street, in the February 16 district of the city of El Alto. He dedicates himself to the manufacture of footwear, which he and his wife sell in different street fairs and markets around the city. He has two children, 10 and 4 years old. The demand for his products is rising. He would use the loan to buy supplies (leather, glue, and so on) and in this way increase his income. This is his first loan with IMPRO. The evaluation IMPRO conducted qualifies him to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio and Sarah Padial, Kiva Volunteers

Caciano, vive en la calle Carmen Álvarez, de la zona 16 de Febrero, de La ciudad de El Alto. Se dedica a la elaboración de calzados, los cuales los comercializa junto a su esposa en las diferentes ferias de la ciudad. Su familia actualmente consta de dos hijos menores de 10 y 4 años. El crédito le invertirá en la compra de mercadería (cuero, pegamento, etc) para su negocio y así mejorar sus ingresos económicos, pues la demanda por sus calzados se ha incrementado. Es el primer crédito con Impro. La evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.

loans.use: Compra de materia prima

loans.name: Eliseo

texts.es:
Eliseo sells cow milk to PIL Andina (a milk industrial plant) and he is also dedicated to selling the agricultural products that he produces on his lands. He lives with his wife and four children, who are sixteen, twelve, eight, and five years old. He lives in the community of Chahuira-Pampa, which is located two and a half hours from the city of La Paz.

He will use the loan to buy a milk cow of a superior breed so that he can increase the production of milk and meet the demands of PIL Andina. This is his first loan with IMPRO and his evaluation shows a sufficient income to qualify him to receive a loan.

Translation from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Eliseo es productor de leche de vaca que comercializa a Pil Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche), también se dedica a la comercialización de productos agrícolas que producen en sus tierras, vive junto a su esposa y sus 4 hijos de 16,12,8 y 5 años. Vive en la Comunidad de Chahuira-Pampa ubicado a dos horas y media de la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo destinara en la compra de una vaca lechera de raza mejorada para incrementar la producción de leche que la Planta PIL demanda. Es el primer crédito con Impro y la evaluación realizada muestra un flujo de caja suficiente y le califica para otorgarle el préstamo

loans.use: Purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Severo

texts.es:
Severo is a dairy operator who contracts with Pil Andina (Industrial milk production plant). He also serves his community preaching Christian religion. He lives with his wive and two small children, ages 9 and 4. They live two and a half hours from La Paz, in the community of Chahuira-Pampa. Severo will use this loan to purchase an improved breed of milk cow to increase his milk production. This is necessary, as the PIL plant has raised the demand of milk in the area in such a way that the producers must meet their needs at once. This is his first loan with Impro and he has been qualified through a credit evaluation.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Severo es productor de leche de vaca mismo que comercializa a Pil Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche), también se dedica a predicar la religión Cristiana en su comunidad, vive junto a su esposa y sus dos pequeños hijos de 9 y 4 años. Vive en la Comunidad de Chahuira-Pampa ubicado a dos horas y media de la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca lechera de raza mejorada para incrementar la producción de leche, pues la Planta PIL ha incrementado su demanda en todo el sector de tal manera que los productores de leche de la región necesitan cubrirla inmediatamente. Es el primer crédito con Impro y la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo

loans.use: Purchase of a milk cow

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Vicente works manufacturing cloth bedspreads for babies. His wife sells their product in different markets in the city of El Alto. He purchases his raw material in bolts of fabric. Vicente also works as a high school teacher in Colegio de la ciudad de El Alto. His requesting this loan for use in purchase of the raw material (cloth) necessary to continue running his business. This will be the sixth loan that he has requested from Impro, and his payment history and credit evaluation have qualified him for another loan as a trusted client.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Vicente se dedica a la elaboración de cobertores de telas para bebes. Su esposa comercializa el producto en las diferentes ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Como materia prima utiliza telas las cuales adquiere por rollos; Vicente también trabaja como profesor de secundaria en un Colegio de la Ciudad de El Alto. Vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos en la calle General Santalla de la ciudad de El Alto. El crédito que ahora solicita será invertido en la compra de materia prima (telas) necesaria para continuar con su empresa. Este será el sexto crédito que solicita de Impro; su historial de pagos y la evaluación realizada lo califica como un cliente confiable para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Working capitol

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria is 26 and unmarried. She embroiders napkins, tablecloths and blouses which she sells to intermediaries for resale in tourist centers of Chiapas. She is a member of the Cruz 3 cooperative along with Maria A. Pérez and Maria Pérez Pérez. Together, they will use this loan to buy thread in bulk.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

MARIA. Tiene 26 años, soltera se dedica a la artesanía bordando servilletas, manteles, chales, blusas, las cuales vende entre las personas de su ciudad quienes posteriormente las llevan a comercializar a los centros turísticos de la zona. Forma parte del grupo Cruz 3 junto con doña Maria A. Pérez (artesana) y Maria Pérez Pérez( artesana ) Con sus préstamo invertirán ambas comprando hilos al por mayor .

loans.use: To buy thread for embroidery in bulk.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe is married and has two children ages 10 and 12. He lives in Chahuira-Pampa two and a half hours from La Paz. He has two sources of income--baking bread and keeping dairy cows. PIL Andina, the local dairy, has recently begun buying more milk in the region so Felipe would like to borrow money to buy an improved-breed cow. This is his first loan from IMPRO. Our research shows he is credit-worthy.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Felipe es productor de leche de vaca mismo que comercializa a Pil Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche); también se dedica a la elaboración de pan en la comunidad, ingresos con los cuales mantiene a su familia que consta de su esposa y dos hijos de 10 y 2 años. Vive en la Comunidad de Chahuira-Pampa ubicado a dos horas y media de la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo destinara a la compra de una vaca lechera de raza mejorada para incrementar la producción de leche, pues la Planta PIL ha incrementado su demanda de leche en la region. Es el primer crédito con Impro y la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
Pascuala is 23 years old and unmarried. She embroiders tablecloths, napkins and traditional clothing which she sells in her own village or at the market in San Cristobal. With the money she makes she helps her parents with household expenses. She is a member of the Cruz 3 cooperative along with Juana Sánchez Pérez and Maria López Sánchez, who also embroider. They will use this loan to buy the thread and cloth they need to embroider.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

PASCUALA , se dedica a la artesanía confeccionando manteles , servilletas y ropa artesanal todo bordado a mano y de esta forma ayuda a sus papas en el mantenimiento del hogar ya que ella es soltera y tiene 23 años , sus productos los vende en el pueblo o en el mercado de artesanía de la ciudad de San Cristóbal de manera ambulante . Forma parte del grupo Cruz 3 junto con doña Juana Sánchez Pérez (artesana) y doña Maria López Sánchez (artesana). Sus préstamos lo ocuparan comprando hilos y telas para confeccionar mayor cantidad de artesanías.

loans.use: To buy thread and cloth for embroidery.

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
Ignacio Q. lives with his twenty year old son in his own home in the Pasankeri neighborhood on the west side of La Paz. He teaches at a night school in La Paz. As it stand now Ignacio's home is centered on its lot, but the neighborhood association is requiring him to extend the facade so that the municipality will pay for improvements to the street. This loan will pay for the needed section of wall and to build a room for Ignacio's son. This is Ignacio's first loan from IMPRO. Our analysis shows he is qualified.

Translated by Kiva volunteer.

El señor Ignacio Q. vive en casa propia en la zona de Pasankeri ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz con su hijo de 20 años de edad; el señor Ignacio trabaja como profesor de primaria en una escuela nocturna de nuestra ciudad. Su vivienda esta construida en la mitad de la fachada y la junta de vecinos le exige que edifique el total de su propiedad por cuanto ese es un requisito para que el gobierno municipal realice las mejoras viales en la zona. El crédito solicitado es para el cerramiento del muro frontal y la construcción de una habitación para su hijo. Esta es la primera vez que solicitan un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: To complete the facade of a private home and add a room.

loans.name: Pacifico

texts.es:
Pacifico lives in his own home at #992 Vicente Ochoa in the Gran Poder neighborhood of La Paz. He is married and has two grown children. He will use this loan to maintain a minibus he drives as a member of the Eduardo Avaroa transport workers union in La Paz. This is Pacifico's first loan from IMPRO. Our review of his finances shows he will be able to repay the loan.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Pacifico vive en casa propia en la Calle Vicente Ochoa Nº 992 de la zona de Gran Poder de la ciudad de La Paz, es casado y tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad. El crédito que solicita es para el mantenimiento de su movilidad, un microbús, con el cual trabaja en la ciudad de La Paz, afiliado en el sindicato de transportistas Eduardo Avaroa. Es cliente nuevo y el análisis financiero indica que cuenta con los recursos necesarios para pagar su deuda; en consecuencia, puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: To buy new tires for a bus.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina hand-weaves coverlets, blouses and pillow cases and sells them to intermediaries who in turn resell them in tourist areas of Chiapas. She is twenty years old and married and has one son. Her husband works in the fields and with her work she helps with the household expenses. Alejandrina belongs to the Expina 2 cooperative along with Antonia H. Pérez and Pascuaza Gómez Santiz, two other weavers. They will use this loan to buy cloth and thread.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

ALEJANDRINA, es artesana teje a mano sus tapetes, blusas y cojines y los vende en la ciudad mas cercana a su comunidad con gente que compra al por mayor y posteriormente vende en las zonas turísticas del Estado.Tiene 20 años es casada y tiene un hijo, su esposo trabaja en el campo y ella le ayuda con su trabajo a mantener el hogar. Pertenece al grupo Espina 2 junto con doña Antonia H. Pérez (artesana) y doña Pascuaza Gómez Santiz (artesana).Compraran hilos y telas y se repartirán entre ellas

loans.use: To buy materials for hand-weaving.

loans.name: Paola

texts.es:
Paola lives in an "anticretico" apartment at #52 Tocopilla lane in Bajo Tacagua, La Paz. [An antichretic, or land-pawn, contract is a special rental arrangement common in Bolivia. You can read more about it here: http://www.escapeartist.com/OREQ3/Rent_Free_Bolivia.html--translator] She is married and has a one-year-old son. Her husband works at the botanical gardens. Paola has a shop in her own home where she and two employees make jackets. These are sold in La Paz and other cities. This loan will serve to increase her working capital. Paola is a first-time borrower from IMPRO. We are happy to report that she is a hard worker and her income and that of her husband generate enough cash flow to service this loan.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Paola vive en anticretico en el pasaje Tocopilla Nº 52 de la zona de Bajo Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz; es casada y tiene un hijo de un año de edad, el esposo trabaja en el Jardín Botánico. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar capital ya que trabaja en la elaboración de chamarras las cuales reparte en varias ciudades de Bolivia y en La Paz. Tiene su taller en el mismo domicilio y trabaja con dos operarios. Paola es cliente nuevo de IMPRO y vemos con mucha complacencia que es una mujer trabajadora y que sus ingresos y los de su esposo alcanzan para flujo de caja que necesita para acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: Working capital for a garment shop.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is 44 and has seven children. Like other women in her village, she specializes in embroidery. Her work is held in much esteem. She sells her embroidery to neighbors who travel to tourist areas in Chiapas to sell it. Juana belongs to the Espina 2 cooperative along with Basilia Montejo Gómez. They will use this loan to buy materials for embroidery.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

JUANA, tiene 44 años, siete hijos, ella trabaja la artesanía al igual que todas las mujeres de su comunidad ya que sus productos bordados son muy apetecidos por los turistas que visitan la zona .Ella vende sus artesanías a personas de su comunidad las cuales posteriormente viajan a las zonas turísticas del Estado y ahí ofrecen sus prendas a los extranjeros que visitan la localidad. Pertenece al grupo Espina 2 junto con doña Basilia Montejo Gómez (artesana) Invertirán sus prestamos en materiales para la confección de sus productos.

loans.use: To buy thread and cloth for embroidery.

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es:
Clotilde is 48 and is married to Julio who is 46. They have 5 kids who are 28, 26, 22, 18 and 16. Their three eldest sons work and their 2 younger daughters are in high school.

Clotilde tells me that her husband used to be a salesman for his brother's company where they made foods like sauages, chorizo (spicy sausage) etc. It was there that he learnt the secrets of making these products.

Her husband, after working for his brother for 7 years, decided to start his own factory to make more money.

Now they both work making and selling food products. Julio goes out to sell them on his own motorbike. He says that he is very sucessful and his clients increase each day due to the good quality of his products. They are united and will work until the end to overcome each day.

Clotilde's dream, the same as her husband Julio's, is to expand their small factory by increasing their food production levels and obtaining more income.

They now need a loan in order to buy the basic ingredients which they use to make their products such as: bacon rinds and condiments.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Clotilde tiene 48 años y está casada con Julio que tiene 46 años. Tienen 5 hijos de 28, 26, 22,18 y 16 años de edad. Los tres hijos mayores ya trabajan mientras que las dos hijas menores van aún a la secundaria. Clotilde comenta que anteriormente su esposo trabajaba como vendedor para una empresa, propiedad de su hermano, en donde se fabricaban embutidos de todo tipo como ser: salchichas, chorizos, fiambres, etc. Fue allí que aprendió los secretos para fabricar dichos productos. Su esposo, después de trabajar 7 años como empleado de su hermano, un día decidió montar su propia fábrica a fin de obtener mayores ingresos. Hoy día ambos se dedican a la fabricación y venta de embutidos, Julio sale a vender en una moto que es de su propiedad. Afirma que tiene mucho éxito y que día a día va aumentando su clientela debido a la buena calidad de sus productos. Ambos son muy unidos y trabajan con el fin de ir superándose día a día. El mayor deseo de Clotilde, al igual que el de su esposo Julio, es el de agrandar aún más su pequeña fábrica a fin de aumentar la producción y generar mayores ingresos. En esta oportunidad necesitan de un préstamo para adquirir la materia prima que emplean en la elaboración de sus embutidos como ser: almidón, tocino y condimentos.

loans.use: To buy bacon, condiments/Compra de almidón, tocino, condimentos

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Mrs. I. Patience is a 47-year-old woman who sells wholesales & retail drinks to people in her environment in Nigeria. She is proud of her business & promises to effectively use the $1175 loan. She is from Benin City of Edo State, married with 6 children. She has been in business since 2003. She is a leader of her union.

loans.use: To buy more drinks

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia is dedicated to the selling fruits and vegetables in her home and also to dressmaking and embroidering the typical handmade clothing worn in the region she lives. She is 43 years old, married, has six children and her husband is a rural workr. She belongs to a group called "Espina 3" together with Juana Díaz Pérez, a craftswoman. Claudia will use the loan to stock up on a variety of fruits and vegetables and improve the place where she sells these products. Juana will use the loan to buy linen and cloth to increase her craftworks.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

CLAUDIA, se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en su casa y además confecciona y borda ropa artesanal típica de la zona donde vive ella tiene 43 años, casada, seis hijos y su esposo es campesino. Pertenece al grupo Espina 3 junto con doña Juana Díaz Pérez (artesana). Con su préstamo Claudia surtirá el negocio con variedad de frutas y verduras y acondicionara mejor el lugar de las ventas , en cambio Juana invertirá su préstamo comprando hilos y telas para aumentar sus artesanías .

loans.use: To sell fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es:
Dionisia is 20 years old, three children and is married to a field worker. She is an artisan who makes blouses, tapestry, pillows, wallets and purses. She takes these to be sold at the local artisans house. Some times, she also goes to a nearby town to sell as well. She belongs to the group Espina 3, togehter with doña Marcela Hernández Hernández (artisan). They will invest this credit to purchase threads and fabric for embroidering.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

DIONISIA, tiene 20 tres hijos, es casada y su esposo trabaja en el campo, ella es artesana hace blusas, tapetes, cojines, monederos y bolsas y los lleva a vender a la casa de las artesanías de su localidad y otras veces al pueblo mas cercano. Pertenece al grupo Espina 3 junto con doña Marcela Hernández Hernández (artesana).Con el préstamo esperan invertirlo en la compra de telas e hilos de bordar

loans.use: Purchase threads and fabric for embroidering.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manulea works as an artisan making wallets, blouses and pillows and selling them from home. She sells to customers that already know her work and visit her to purchase these crafts. She is single and 18 years old. She helps to maintain her parents' family with her income. She belongs to the group Espina 4, togheter with doña Maria Hernández Díaz (artisan). They will invest this loan into purchasing threads, fabrics and looms to increment their craft production.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

MANUELA, se dedica a la artesanía haciendo monederos, blusas, cojines y los vende en su casa a clientes que conocen de su trabajo y la visitan para comprar las artesanías, es soltera y tiene 18 años y con sus ingresos ayuda a la manutención de la familia de sus padres. Pertenece al grupo Espina 4 junto con doña Maria Hernández Díaz (artesana). Invertirán el préstamo en la compra de hilos, telas y telares para aumentar la producción de sus artesanías.

loans.use: ARTESANA

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria sells vegetables and travels rural areas within the Department (state/province) of La paz to sell her products. Her husband is employed in a fabric factory and hence they make their main income with which they provide for her two year old daughter.

She lives in the Villa Ingenio area in the El Alto City, in the street of Tiwuanacu .

She will use the credit she is requesting to purchase merchandise, since there is a high demand for vegetables in the areas that make her market. In that way, Maria hopes to increase her family's income.

It is her first credit with Impro; her wishes to move on and the evaluation realized allow her access to the loan request.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Maria es comerciante de hortalizas y viaja a las zonas rurales del Departamento de La Paz para vender su producto. Su esposo trabaja como empleado en una fabrica de tejidos y así reúnen los ingresos principales con los que mantienen una hija de 2 años. Vive en la zona Villa Ingenio de la Ciudad de El Alto, en la calle Tiwuanacu. El crédito que solicita lo destinara para comprar mercadería, pues existe mucha demanda de hortalizas en las zonas que forman su mercado. De esa forma Maria piensa incrementar sus ingresos familiares. Es el primer crédito con Impro, pero sus deseos de superación y la evaluación realizada le permiten acceder al préstamo solicitado.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela tailors blouses, purses, serviettes, and table cloths which she knits and sells in the city of San Cristobal, Chiapas to the people who already have an established store selling handcrafts.

She is 34 years old, has 7 children and belongs to group "Espinola 4" together with Doña María Díaz Díaz (artisan) and doña Petrona Hernández Díaz (breeding of sheep and chicken). With the loan, Manuela and María will buy string and fabrics for their handicrafts and Doña Petrona will invest purchasing animals to breed.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


MANUELA, se dedica a la confección de blusas , monederos , servilletas , manteles los cuales borda y vende en la ciudad de San Cristóbal a las personas que ya tienen locales establecidos de artesanías...Ella tiene 34 años, siete hijos y pertenece al grupo Espina 4 junto con doña María Díaz Díaz (artesana) y doña Petrona Hernández Díaz (crianza de borregos y gallinas).Con el préstamo Manuela y María compraran hilos y telas para sus artesanías y doña Petrona invertirá comprando animales para su crianza.

loans.use: Artisan

loans.name: Anacleto

texts.es:
Anacleto is a cow milk producer. His produce is commercialized by PIL Andina(Milk Industrializing Plant). He also works as an inter-province driver in order to increment his income. He has three children who depend on him for sustenance.

He lives in the Villandrani Community (which is about an hour away from La Paz).

He would use the loan to purchase a medium race cow in order to increment the milk production because the PIL plant has recently expanded in this region.

This is the first credit he gets with Impro and the evaluation qualifies him to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Anacleto es productor de leche de vaca que comercializa a Pil Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche); también trabaja como chofer inter provincial para poder incrementar sus ingresos con los que cubre la manutención de sus 3 hijos que dependen de él. Vive en la Comunidad de Villandrani (A una hora de la ciudad de La Paz). El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca de raza mediana para incrementar la producción de leche que la planta PIL ha incrementado en la región. Es el primer crédito con Impro y la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase milking cow

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.en: "I started this business a year ago and it has helped me take care of my family. I know how to safeguard my capital to ensure continuity in business." All these are the words of Mrs. Elizabeth O.. She is from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is 40 years of age, married, the mother of 3 children. She sells doors, windows, wall panels & frames. She hopes to increase her business and buy more doors, windows, wall panels & frames for sale with the loan amount of $1175. She has been a LAPO member for 5 years.

loans.use: To buy a saw machine & wood for making windows

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa is an 18 year old artisan. She is married and has one son. She works as an embroider of blouses, wallets and pillows. She sells her work in San Cristobal and in other communities that are closer to where she lives. She is part of the group Espina 7, togehter with doña Andrea Díaz Gómez (artisan) ,doña Maria Hernández Hernández 1st (artisan) y doña María Hernández Hernández 2nd (artisan) . They will invest this loan into purchasing threads from various colors for their artisan work.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

TERESA, es artesana tiene 18 años, es casada y tiene un hijo, ella se dedica al bordado de blusas, monederos y cojines los cuales vende en la ciudad de San Cristóbal o en las comunidades mas cercanas a su hogar. Pertenece al grupo Espina 7 junto con doña Andrea Díaz Gómez (artesana) ,doña Maria Hernández Hernández 1era (artesana) y doña María Hernández Hernández 2da (artesana) Con sus préstamos invertirán en hilos De colores variados para sus artesanías

loans.use: purchase threads for artisan work

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria is 29 years old, married, has six children and her husband is a rural worker and she is dedicated to embroidering blouses, table cloths, cushions and selling them to locals in who sell products in other states. She belongs to a group "Espina 8" together with Mrs. Micaela Díaz Hernández, who sells fruits and vegetables and Mrs. Matea Hernández Díaz, another craftswoman. Matea and María will use the loan to invest in linens and Micaela in fruits and vegetables so they all can increase their incomes.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

MARIA , tiene 29 años , es casada , seis hijos , su esposo es campesino y ella se dedica al bordado de blusas , tapetes , cojines y lo vende con personas de su misma localidad que llevan sus productos a comercializar a otros estados .Pertenece al grupo Espina 8 junto con doña Micaela Díaz Hernández (vende frutas y verduras) y doña Matea Hernández Díaz(artesana) .Con sus prestamos Matea y María invertirán en hilos y Micaela en frutas y verduras para incrementar sus ingresos .

loans.use: craftsmanship

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy two cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a variety of grains to sell

loans.name: Adelina

texts.es:
Ms. Adelina is 38 years old and was born in Choctaloma, in the Julcán province of the La Libertad region. She attended elementary school up to third grade. She has been living in the Alto Trujillo Projects in the Florencia de Mora district in Trujillo for the past ten years. She has four children and three are her dependants. When she left her village, she looked for a job and found one removing the veins of yellow chili peppers (aji escabeche) for drying or grinding. She made very little money and starting her own business was always on her mind, so she paid close attention to everything that could be of help and this is how she learned to peel garlic. As she worked removing the veins of peppers, she bought small quantities of garlic to peel and sell. She found out about the existence of the Communal Banks through a neighbor from her native village, and they decided to form “Las Conquistadoras” Communal Bank. Since obtaining her first loan, of approximately $96, she quit her job and started buying garlic, to peel and sell in bulk at the “La Hermelinda” market in Trujillo. She presently peels and sells 300 kilograms of garlic weekly, giving jobs to three young women. With the recent loan of approximately $318, granted by Manuela Ramos, she intends the buy a scale and shelves, in order to open a grocery store at her home, since her neighborhood is new and there are no stores in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Adelina tiene 38 años de edad, nació en Choctaloma, caserío de la Provincia de Julcán, Departamento de La Libertad y estudió sólo hasta el tercer grado de primaria. Hace 10 años que vive en el Asentamiento Humano Alto Trujillo en el Distrito de Florencia de Mora en Trujillo. Tiene 4 hijos y 3 dependen de ella. Al emigrar de su pueblo, buscó trabajo y consiguió uno para desvenar ají escabeche para ser secado o molido. Ganaba muy poco y tuvo siempre la idea de tener un negocio propio, así que estuvo atenta a todo lo que podía servirle, y así aprendió a pelar ajo. Al mismo tiempo que desvenaba el ají, compraba pequeñas cantidades de ajo para pelar y vender. Por una vecina se entera de la existencia de los Bancos Comunales en su pueblo de origen y deciden formar el Banco Comunal “Las Conquistadoras”. Con su primer crédito de S/.300 ($ 96 aprox.) compró ajo y dejó el trabajo de desvenar ají. Desde ahí se dedica a comprar ajo, pelar y luego vender al por mayor en el mercado “La Hermelinda” de la ciudad de Trujillo. En la actualidad, pela y vende 300 kilogramos semanales dando trabajo a tres jóvenes mujeres. Con el reciente préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/.1,000 ($ 318 aprox.) piensa comprar una balanza y estantes para poner una bodega en su casa, ya que el barrio donde vive es nuevo y no hay bodegas en la zona.

loans.use: Grocery store equipment.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha runs her own workshop where she makes quilts and bedspreads, which she sells in the city of La Paz. She has a stall in the Fair in July in the city of El Alto. She has eight children, and two of them depend on her. She has been a widow for 10 years and lives in her mother's home in th 16th Zone within El Alto since July.

The loan will be used to buy raw material (cloth and fiber), so she can increase her family income and thus, will be able provide better living conditions for her two last children.

This is the third loan with IMPRO; her good previous credit history approves and validates her current loan search.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Martha tiene su taller de costura y confecciona edredones y cubrecamas los cuales comercializa en la Ciudad de La Paz y tiene un puesto en la Feria 16 de Julio de la Ciudad de El Alto. Tiene 8 hijos, dos de ellos depende de ella. Es viuda hace 10 años, vive en la casa de su madre en la Zona 16 de julio de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinara para comprar materia prima (tela y fibra), de esa forma incrementar sus ingresos familiares y ofrecerá mejores condiciones de vida para su dos últimos hijos.

Es el tercer crédito con IMPRO; el buen comportamiento de pago en los dos créditos anteriores permite aprobarle la solicitud de préstamo actual.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
For a living Flor produces milk cow and sells potatoes and chuño. In that way her combined incomes allow her to provide for her two children.

Se lives in the Caluyo de Batallas Community (two hours away from the city of La Paz ).

The credit will be used to purchase a milk cow of medium breed and increase the production of milk.

This is her second credit with Impro; the first credit was given to her in December 2006 and to date it's completely repaid. Her evaluation qualifies her for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Flora se dedica a la producción de leche de vaca y comercialización de papa y chuño, de tal manera que sus ingresos combinados le permiten cubrir la manutención de sus dos hijos. Vive en la Comunidad Caluyo de Batallas (A dos horas de la ciudad de La Paz). El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de una vaca de raza mediana para incrementar la producción de leche. Es el segundo crédito con Impro; el primer crédito fue concedido en Diciembre de 2006 y esta completamente pagado a la fecha. La evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo solicitado.

loans.use: Purchasing a milk cow

loans.name: Albina

texts.es:
Ms. Albina is 32 years old, attended school up to 9th grade, is the single mother of a girl and is expecting a second child. She lives is the Alto Trujillo Projects in the Florencia de Mora district of the Trujillo province. Ms. Albina started her business with a loan of approximately $96 she obtained from “Las Conquistadoras” Communal Bank. With that loan she bought fruits and vegetables to sell at the market of the Victor Larco district at the Trujillo province. With her next loan, she incorporated little outdoor coal stoves (“briquetas encendidas”) to her sales, which yielded a higher income. However, due to her pregnancy, she was forced to stop selling them, as the emanated smoke constituted a health risk. With the latest loan of approximately $286, given by Manuela Ramos, she bought corn and all kinds of produce to sell at a regular stand she now has in that same market. Ms. Albina dreams about traveling to the Sierra, to her native village of Cuyuchugo, in order to bring potatoes and other products to sell in bulk. She also wants to own her stand at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Albina tiene 32 años de edad, estudió solo hasta tercer año de secundaria, es madre soltera de una niña y está en espera de otro bebé. Vive en el Asentamiento Humano Alto Trujillo del Distrito de Florencia de Mora de la Provincia de Trujillo, Departamento de La Libertad. La señora Albina inició su negocio con el préstamo de $ 96 dólares aproximadamente, que recibió del Banco Comunal “Las Conquistadoras”, con lo cual compró frutas y menestras para poner a la venta como ambulante en el mercado del distrito de Víctor Larco en la Provincia de Trujillo. Con su siguiente crédito, se dedicó también a vender briquetas encendidas (pequeñas cocinas de carbón de piedra), negocio con el que obtenía mayor ganancia, pero tuvo que dejarlo debido a su embarazo, ya que el humo que emana es perjudicial para su salud. Con el reciente préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos de $ 286 dólares aprox., compró maíz para chufla y todo tipo de menestras para vender en un espacio fijo que ahora tiene en el mismo mercado. La señora Albina sueña con viajar a la Sierra, a su pueblo natal, Cuyuchugo, para traer papa y otros productos y venderlos al por mayor. Además quiere tener un puesto en el mercado que sea propio.

loans.use: Purchase of grains and produce.

loans.name: Osahumwense

texts.en:
"LAPO has rained on me," says Mrs. Osahumwense K., a trader who sells provisions wholesale and retail, and sells drinks to the public. She is 35 years of age. She is from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.

Married and mother of 3 children, she hopes to increase her growth of business, that is buy more drinks if the loan amount of $550 comes. She has been in this business since 2002. She is the treasurer of her union.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and provisions

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario is a small farmer and producer of cheese. His wife helps him selling the cheese, potatoes and chuño which they make themselves. From these activities they derive their main income with which they cover the family's expenses.

He lives in the Caluyo de Batallas Community (two hours away from La Paz City).

The credit will be used to purchase a milk cow of medium breed to increase the production of milk and make a greater quantity of cheese.

This is his second credit with Impro; the first credit was given to him in December 2006 for $150 and to date it's completely repaid. His payment history and the evaluation realized qualifies him for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Mario es pequeño agricultor y productor de queso; la esposa ayuda comercializando los quesos, papa y chuño que producen ellos mismos y de estas actividades derivan los ingresos principales con que cubren la manutención de su familia. Vive en la Comunidad de Caluyo de Batallas (A dos horas de la ciudad de La Paz). El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca de raza mediana para incrementar la producción de leche y producir mayor cantidad de queso. Es el Segundo crédito con Impro; el primer crédito fue concedido en Diciembre de 2006 por $150 y a la fecha esta completamente pagado. Su historial de pagos y la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchasing of a milk cow

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Ms. Rosa is 35 years old, she completed high school, and she is the mother of 4 children. She lives in the Agallpampa district, Otuzco province, La Libertad department. Ms. Rosa was a Community Health Promoter with the Reproductive Health Project of the Manuela Ramos Movement, and she used all her persistence to form the Communal Bank "Women of the Morning" in her community. She received her first loan of approximately $96, which she used to buy some guinea pigs and chickens, and in that way she started her business raising and seliing animals. At present she raises and sells not just guinea pigs and chickens, but also pigs, sheep, and cattle. In the afternoons, she weaves sweaters, shawls, key rings, etc. - whatever is requested by her customers in the city of Trujillo.

With the loan approved by Manuela Ramos for approximately $477, she purchased sheep and pigs, because she wants to fatten them to sell during the festival of the Virgen de La Puerta in the city of Otuzco, which is celebrated in the month of December.

Ms. Rosa hopes that her children will be professionals and that she and her husband will have enough resources so that he can open a carpentry workshop.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

La señora Rosa tiene 35 años de edad, estudió secundaria completa, es madre de 4 niños y vive en el distrito de Agallpampa, de la Provincia de Otuzco, Departamento de La Libertad. La señora Rosa fue promotora comunitaria de salud del Proyecto Reprosalud del Movimiento Manuela Ramos y puso todo el empeño para formar en su comunidad el Banco Comunal “Mujeres del Mañana”, recibió un primer préstamo de S/.300 ($ 96 aprox.) y con él compró unos cuanto cuyes y gallinas e inicia así su negocio de crianza y venta de animales. Actualmente cría y vende no solo cuyes y gallinas sino también cerdos, ovejas y ganado vacuno; Por las tardes teje chompas, chalinas, llaveros, etc. De acuerdo a lo que pidan sus clientes generalmente de la ciudad de Trujillo.

Con el préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/.1,500 ($.477 aprox.) compró ovejas y cerdos porque quiere engordarlos para venderlos en la Fiesta de La Virgen de La Puerta de ciudad de Otuzco que se celebra en el mes de diciembre.

La señora Rosa sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales y con tener los recursos suficiente para que su esposo pueda implementar su taller de carpintería.

loans.use: Compra de ganado (ovejas, cerdos).

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Felix has a tailor shop where he makes sportswear, short vests, and sweatshirts. His home and workshop are located in the 14th of September neighborhood of the city of La Paz. This is the fifth time he has requested a loan from our institution. He has been a client of ours since 2005. His history with our institution qualifies him as a level-1 client, which is to say he has good compliance in the repayment of his debt. The amount he is requesting will be used to buy basic materials (fabric, lining, thread, interfacing).

His work and credit histories allow him to accept this loan, since he has experience in this business, and it gives him income to cover the loan.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Felix tiene un taller de costura donde elabora ropa deportiva, chalecos cortos y buzos. Su domicilio y taller se encuentran ubicados en la zona 14 de septiembre de la ciudad de La Paz. Es quinta vez que solicita un crédito de nuestra institución. Es cliente nuestro desde el año 2005. Su historial en nuestra institución lo califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado compra de materia Prima.( tela, forro, hilo, pellon)

Sus antecedentes crediticios y trabajo le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio, el cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther E., who operates a restaurant business, solicits the loan amount $550 to enable her to buy more food items and drinks to boost her restaurant business. She is 62 years old and a widow, mother of 6 children, and she has been a faithful member of LAPO for the past 7 years. She lives in Benin, Edo State in Nigeria and has been in business since 1989.

loans.use: To buy more crates of drinks and food items

loans.name: Verail

texts.es:
Mrs. Verail was born in Muchamaca, a small village in the province of Otuzco, but from a very young age she has lived in the Otuzco district, Otuzco province, department of La Libertad. She is 42 years old and has two young daughters who depend on her. She attended school just up to the third year of high school.

Mrs. Verail says that she learned to work from a very young age, because she helped her mother sell things on the streets of Otuzco. She became pregnant at age 19 and, because her husband was a student, she had to look for some form of work to help cover the expenses.
