She started processing dried potatoes and wheat in small quantities to sell in the market, but when she became ill she was prohibited from spending much time in water, so she could no longer process grains. She thought then she could buy grains in bulk and sell them wholesale. Because she needed capital for this, she accepted an invitation from a neighbor to join the Communal Bank called "The Olive". With her first loan of approximately $96, she purchased a large quantity of wheat and potatoes, and sold it wholesale. In this way she worked for about two years, saving her resources to start a warehouse, which she did successfully. At present, she does various activities: she and her children take turns working in the warehouse, she buys and sells grains wholesale, and and on Wednesdays and Sundays she sells cheeses in the plaza to pilgrims visiting the Virgen a la Puerta.

The loan that was recently approved by Manuela Ramos for approximately $636 will be used to buy grains such as wheat and corn, as well as dried vegetables, in bulk. Mrs. Verail hopes to buy a car and two motorcycle taxis to rent out, and in that way she can generate more income.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

La señora Verail nació en Muchamaca un caserío de la provincia de Otuzco pero desde muy pequeña vive en el distrito de Otuzco, Provincia de Otuzco del Departamento de La Libertad; tiene 42 años de edad y dos hijas menores que dependen de ella. Estudió solo hasta tercer año de secundaria.

La señora Verail dice que aprendió a trabajar desde muy pequeña porque ayudaba a vender a su mamá por las calles de Otuzco (cancha y marcianos). Se embarazó a los 19 años de edad y como su esposo era estudiante tuvo que buscar la forma de trabajar para ayudar a cubrir los gastos; empezó a pelar papa seca, trigo, y mote en pequeñas cantidades para vender en el mercado pero como enfermó le prohibieron estar mucho tiempo en el agua por lo que ya no podía pelar granos, pensó entonces en comprar granos en mayor cantidad y venderlos al por mayor, como necesitaba mayor capital para ello acepta la invitación de una vecina para formar parte del Banco Comunal “El Olivo” con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 (aproximadamente $ 96) que recibió compró mayor cantidad de trigo y papa y lo vendió al por mayor, así trabajó aproximadamente dos años, guardando sus utilidades para poner una bodega lo cual hizo con éxito. Actualmente realiza varias actividades: ella con sus hijas se turnan para atender la bodega, compra y vende granos al por mayor y además los días miércoles y domingos vende quesos y quesillos en la plaza de armas a los visitantes de la Virgen a la Puerta.

El reciente préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/.2000 ($ 636 aprox.) será utilizado para comprar granos como trigo, maíz y menestras al por mayor. La señora Verail sueña con comprar un auto y dos mototaxis para ponerlos en alquiler y así poder generarse otros ingresos.

loans.use: To buy grains (wheat, corn) and dried vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Ysabel Margarita

texts.es:
Ms. Ysabel is a native of Mache district in the province of Otuzco, department of La Libertad. She is 41 years old and has 4 children, but only one (age 8) is still dependent upon her. She attended school through the third year of high school.

At age 14, she started working, selling eggs and local dishes called choclos and cachangas on the buses that came and went from Mache. Later she got married, and after 15 years together her husband abandoned her with 3 children. She was left completely alone, as not even her relatives supported her. She traveled to the city of Trujillo in search of work, but she didn't get any, and she had to sell sweets on the mini-buses and collect trash in the streets to feed herself.

She decided to return to Mache and raise some livestock; there she was invited to participate in the Communal Bank "Women of Mache". With her first loan of approximately $96, she bought cheeses to bring to Trujillo to sell, and some guinea pigs to fatten and later sell. With her subsequent loans, and with the support of her present partner, she opened a small store.

At present, she has the store, but she also works making and selling cheeses, buying and selling grains wholesale, and she also has cattle. With the loan recently granted by Manuela Ramos for approximately $731, she will buy two bulls to sell later at a better price.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

La señora Ysabel es natural de Mache distrito de la Provincia de Otuzco, Departamento de La Libertad, tiene 41 años y 4 hijos pero solamente uno (de 8 años de edad) depende de ella. Estudió hasta tercer año de secundaria.

A los catorce años empezó a trabajar vendiendo huevos, choclos y cachangas en los buses que llegaban y salían de Mache, luego se casó y después de 15 años de convivencia su esposo la abandonó con tres niños; se quedó en la más completa orfandad ni siquiera sus familiares la apoyaron. Viajó a la ciudad de Trujillo a buscar trabajo pero no lo consiguió, tuvo que vender dulces en los microbuses y recoger basura de los mercados para alimentarse.

Decidió regresar a Mache a criar algunos animalitos; ahí la invitaron a participar del Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Mache”. Con su primer préstamo de S/.300 ($96 aprox.) que recibió compró quesillos para llevar a vender a Trujillo y algunos cuyes para engordarlos y luego venderlos. Con sus siguientes préstamos y también con el apoyo de su actual pareja implementaron una pequeña bodega.

Actualmente tiene la bodega pero también se dedica a la preparación y venta de quesillos, a la compra y venta de granos al por mayor y además tiene ganado vacuno; Con el préstamo recientemente otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,300 ($ 731 aprox.) comprará dos toros para posteriormente venderlos a un mejor precio. Su sueño es poner una farmacia en su comunidad porque cree que los pobladores no tienen acceso a muchos medicamentos necesarios.

loans.use: To buy livestock (2 bulls)

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
K. Rachael is 50 years of age. She is married with three children. All the children go to school, one boy aged 15 is in senior three, and two girls aged 18 and 20 all in senior six. She has four stepchildren (two boys/two girls) who are currently in secondary school. She is operating a small hardware shop where she sells wall paint, wood vanish, wood glue, plywood, door locks and many more wares in small quantities.

Rachael would wish to get a loan of $800 to increase her stock to cater for the demand of her clients. Her business is located in the city suburbs were there are many carpentry workshops. This seemingly hard working lady is optimistic that if she adds more capital to her business it will enable her pay school fees for her children and, in future, construct rental units.

loans.use: Increasing stock

loans.name: Aimalefoa

texts.en:
Aimalefoa T. runs a lawn mowing business. She has five children and her husband is a carpenter. All her five children are attending village school and are supported by their father.

Aimalefoa decided to join SPBD for financial assistance to start up her business, because she feels that her family will be having financial problems in the future due to her children’s educational needs. This is why now she’s a member of the program, running a lawn mowing business. Her customers are mainly village people, and she’ll be looking at ways of getting more customers by having all the equipment needed for better service to offer to clients.

loans.use: Loan will be used to purchase knives, brooms and pay for her children’s semester fees.

loans.name: Apulu

texts.en:
Apulu F. is not a strong mother, she can barely walk or hear, but has got a very sharp mind in dealing with money. She’s a very bright lady running a pig raising business, with support from her sons. Apulu has 6 children and all are boys, four of them have migrated overseas and the other two are staying with her helping out with the business.

Apulu explains that all the work is being done by her sons. She only deals with the money of the business, and sometimes checks on counting her pigs to make sure that her sons are not selling them behind her back. Her business is now running smoothly, generating good income and making her earn good profit. She has successfully paid off her US$300 loan and now requests another loan to build a proper kitchen for her family.

loans.use: Loan will be used for home improvement.

loans.name: Aiva

texts.en:
Aiva A.’s business is elei printing; she’s not only talented in printing but also interested in gardening. She’s a mother of 7 children, four boys and three girls. Both she and husband are unemployed but work very hard at home with their small businesses to financially support their children. Her husband works in their vegetable garden and taro plantation, and Aiva works on her elei printing and doing her garden.

Aiva is a new member of the program. When she joined SPBD, she had already had an existing business that needed financial support to improve. She lives far away from where their community assembles and never misses a day or a weekly payment. Aiva would like to continue with SPBD, which she believes is offering opportunities to the poor ladies who can not access credit.

loans.use: Loan will be used to purchase materials, brushess and fabric paints.

loans.name: Fanolua

texts.en:
Fanolua M. is from Faleasiu, a mother of two sons, unemployed but running a small cattle farm with her husband. Fanolua M. is the secretary for their community, and a very active member in the program. She has been in business for 4 years now and is still going strong because she believes that there is a future in her business.

Her business is their only source of income to support her children’s schooling needs. Her eldest son will be graduating from University this year, and she is very looking forward to celebrating it. This is why she’s now requesting a $900 loan to do maintenance on her house and to pay for her son’s school fees. Fanolua aims to expand her business in the near future when both her sons successfully graduate from school.

loans.use: Loan will be used to purchase materials for home improvement and to pay for her son’s school fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy assorted fruit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more assorted fruits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more oranges for her business.

loans.name: Blanca Alicia

texts.es:
Blanca Alicia tiene 40 años de edad y tiene dos hijos, ellos son originarios de la localidad de Escobedo, Nuevo León. Blanca es una mujer emprendedora que se ha esforzado mucho para sacar adelante a su familia ella sola, hace seis años inició su propio negocio con la venta de papelería, donde recibe la ayuda de su hijo menor, de 18 años de edad, afortunadamente sus clientes se han incrementado y ahora ha incorporado la venta de productos naturales, obteniendo una muy buena respuesta de sus clientes.

En estos momentos Blanca necesita un préstamo de $ 550 que empleará en la compra mercancía para continuar creciendo con su negocio, con esto Blanca espera poder ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes y cubrir sus necesidades, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Forma parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio, y ayuda a esta familia, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
Sergio is a very responsible and hard working man. He is married and has two young kids; a girl aged 6 and a baby boy aged 1. They have been the motive for which 7 years ago Sergio decided to start his own business selling clothes, shoes, and beddings since the wages he received in his former job were too low to provide for all of the family's expenses.

Sergio wishes to give his children a good education and a better quality of life. This drives him to make a good job and grow his business.

In order to purchase more merchandise for this new season and buy coverlets which have a high demand in cold weather, Sergio is requesting a loan for $375 which he is committing to pay back in 5 months.

Be an important part of Sergio and his family's life by contributing to the growth of his business. They sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Sergio es muy responsable y trabajador, está casado y tiene dos pequeños hijos, una niña de 6 años de edad y un pequeñito de sólo un año, ellos han sido el motivo por el cual hace siete años Sergio decidió emprender su negocio con la venta de ropa, zapatos y cobertores, ya que el salario que recibía en su empleo era muy bajo y no lograba cubrir todos los gastos de su hogar. Sergio desea darle a sus hijos una buena educación y una mejor calidad de vida, esto es lo que lo impulsa a realizar un muy buen trabajo y crecer con su negocio.

Para poder adquirir mercancía de esta nueva temporada y comprar los cobertores que tienen mucha demanda para el tiempo de frío Sergio está solicitando un préstamo de $ 375 dólares que se compromete a devolver en 5 meses. Forma parte importante en la vida de Sergio y su familia, contribuyendo al crecimiento de su negocio, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Maria Cruz

texts.es:
Maria is an optimist and entrepreneurial woman. Originally from Tampico, Tamaulipas, she is married and has three children aged 14, 21 and 25 who are all going to school.

Maria enjoys selling and has had the opportunity of selling different types of products. She started 22 years ago selling furniture, then cosmetics and since 6 years ago she sells natural products.

Her character and her will to move on with her family have helped her increase her sales and make an effort to grow her business. That is why now she has a strong customer base.

In order to supply the demand of her clients, Maria is currently requesting a loan for $475 which she is committing to payback in 4 months. Be an important part of this business, Maria and her family really appreciate it.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Maria es una mujer emprendedora y optimista, originaria D. L. localidad D. Tampico en Tamaulipas, es casada y tiene tres hijos, D. 14, 21 y 25 años D. edad, quienes están estudiando. A Maria le gustan mucho las ventas y ha tenido L. oportunidad D. vender diferentes tipos D. productos, inició hace 22 años con muebles, después cosméticos y desD. hace 6 años comercializa productos naturistas, su carácter y sus ganas D. salir adelante con su familia le han ayudado a incrementar sus ventas y a esforzarse mucho por hacer crecer su negocio por lo que ahora cuenta con una amplia cartera D. clientes.

Para poder cubrir las demandas D. sus clientes, en estos momentos Maria está solicitando un préstamo D. $ 475 dólares que se compromete a regresar en 4 meses. Forma parte importante en el desarrollo D. este negocio, Maria y su familia te lo agradecen mucho.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Fadai

texts.en: Fadai A. lives in Gahramanli Village. It is a small city in the Beylagan Region, which sits in southwest Azerbaijan. He is married and has 3 children. His business is cattle-breeding. Fadai established his business 10 years ago. He borrowed 3 loans from the Normicro Beylagan Branch and paid back those loans on time. He now needs $400 in an additionaly loan to buy a calf.

loans.use: To Buy a Calf

loans.name: Akber

texts.en: Akber A. lives in Dashburun village of Beylagan region, a small city in the south-west Azerbaijan. He owns a café in the village. He started his business in 1990. He has 4 employees which work as a waiter at his café. He needs $1200 to buy new tables and chairs for his café and increase the area of his café.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en: Yelena H. lives in Gahramanli Village. It is a small city in the Beylagan Region, which sits in southwest Azerbaijan. She is married and has 3 children. Her business is cattle-breeding. She has 5 years experience in this business. She wants to buy a cow, but does not have enough money. Therefore, she applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch for a loan. Yelena wants to borrow $300 and use the loan to buy a calf.

loans.use: To Buy a Calf

loans.name: Farhad

texts.en: Farhad I. lives in Gahramanli Village. It is a small city in the Beylagan Region, which sits in southwest Azerbaijan. He is 26 years old and he is single. His business is cattle-breeding. He just started this business, and therefore faces some obstacles. He would like to buy more cows and expand his business. He needs $600 to buy a cow, and so he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Ayyub

texts.en: Ayyub I. lives in Dashburun Village. It is a small city in the Beylagan Region, which sits in southwest Azerbaijan. He is 54 years old, is married and has 4 children. He sells tractor spare parts. He has one employee. Ayyub established his businees in 1998. At first he was selling his goods at a small booth. He built a new shop 2 years ago. He needs $600 to buy more kinds of goods for his shop.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Vagif

texts.en: Vagif I. is an Internally Displaced Person from the Jabrayil Region of Azerbaijan. He has been living in Dashburun village, which is in the Beylagan Region, since 1993.  He is married and has 6 children. His business is cattle-breeding. He has had 3 loans from Normicro Beylagan Branch. Now he needs $400 to buy a calf.

loans.use: To Buy a Calf

loans.name: Mohammad Masan

texts.en: Mohammad Masan lives in district 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has two children and also has the responsibility of supporting his father and mother. He has a retail shop. He wants to expand his business so he wants to take an individual to buy peaches, baga of nuts, pears, limes, apples, peanuts, oranges, and extra items to help him make a good income and support his family. He is happy with the opportunity to take this loan.

loans.use: To buy produce for his grocery store

loans.name: Sayaad Gulam Hussin

texts.en: S. Gulam Hussin lives in district 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is an old man who has a  retail shop and he has good work experience. He has a lots of clients and he needs money to expand his business so he wants to take an individual loan to buy potatoes, onions, garlic, radishes, and beets. This will help him to make a good monthly income to help his family. He is happy with AFSG group loans.

loans.use: To buy produce for his store

loans.name: Mir Zamen

texts.en: Mir Zamen lives in district 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has a small store where he sells different kinds of glassware that he imports all from other countries. He needs money so he wants to take an individual loan to buy different kinds of glassware and some extra things for his shop. He wants to expand his business and support his family better. He is happy with this loan.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of glassware

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Help educate children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase his stock

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 36 years old. She's married, and her husband is unemployed. They have two children, and one of them is going to join the primary school this year. The family is living in a rented house in Kirkuk. The entrepreneur applied to borrow $1200 to purchase a new sewing machine and some fabric in order to increase her income and create a better life for her family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy environmental friendly bags and other household goods for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more ingrediants and cooking utensils for her food-vending business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more green maize for resale

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
In 1998, M. Milly decided to start up a retail shop near her home in Kyebando, near Kampala city. The business started very well, but she had a limited stock while the demand for household items was high.

After three month in operation, she requested a loan from a government program known as the Poverty Alleviation Programme (PAP), which was giving start-up loans to entrepreneurs then. She was given a loan of USD171 which she used to stock a variety of household items commonly bought by residents in the area. The business grew. After one year, she paid back the loan and received another loan of USD28 from Feed The Children Uganda in December 1999. She has become an expert in using loans to expand her business.

Her business generates weekly sales of about USD114, and she anticipates it will grow further. She borrowed USD285 from Pearl Microfinance and paid it very well. Kyebando is an up-and-coming residential area. Milly has noticed two hardware shops in the area. She wants to start selling cement in addition to the retail shop.

Milly is married and has five children who are all in school. She has a supportive husband who pays school fees for all the children. The couple has been able to build a residential house where they are staying.

loans.use: Milly wants to buy 15 bags of cement as well as sugar and rice for the retail shop.

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en:
N. is an enterprising woman. She deals in a unique business, and it’s known by very few people. She buys blood in slaughterhouses, dries it, and then sells it to two poultry feed processors in Kampala: Kagodo and Ngondwe Feeds. She also has a retail shop in Bunamwaya where she stays.

She started her retail business in 1988 and the poultry business in 1995. She makes net sales of about USD120 daily, and this help her to repay the loan. She graduated from borrowing USD28 in 1999 to USD857. She has completed repayment of the USD857 loan. She is a committed lady and very grateful to Feed The Children Uganda –Community Banking Program for opening their eyes in 1999 when she received her first loan.

She separated from her husband, and now the business is her sole source of income, unlike other women who are supported by their husbands. However, she has no regrets because her four children and three dependents are going to school. With the profits from her business, she bought a refrigerator, sofa set, beds for her six children, a television set, and a plot of land in Bunamwaya where she plans to build a house in a few months to come.

loans.use: Flavia wants to increase collection of blood from slaughter houses from 215 litres of blood to 350 litres per week to increase her returns.

loans.name: Ung

texts.en:
Mrs. Ung C., 37 and mother of four children, lives in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. To support her household, she sells various kinds of desserts to the people in her area and typically makes about $3/day of income. Her husband is both a construction worker and a motor-taxi driver, while two of her children work at construction and together earn up to $12 per day.

Mrs. Ung C. hopes this loan will help her purchase a motorcycle for her husband to use to operate a business. She also plans to buy pigs to raise on her piece of land to generate additional income.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her husband to operate a business and also buy pigs to raise on her piece of land

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Ung Chanthol has paid this loan back early.

Thanks to investments like yours, entrepreneurs around the world have access to low-interest loans to help finance their small businesses and to support their families. We hope you will continue your support on Kiva.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Edison

texts.en:
“I don’t know how I can thank Feed The Children Uganda for what they have done for me,” says Edison T., a resident of Kiwatule in Kampala. He joined Tuwoda, a group of women and men who came together in order to get loans from FEED (now Pearl Microfinance Ltd), in 2001. He has borrowed and repaid loans ranging from USD115 to USD900 between 2001 and 2007.

He has managed to buy a banana plantation in his home area, Rukungiri, in southwestern Uganda, and a plot of land in the same area. He sells Bitenge textiles from Congo and works as a tailor. He is completing a residential house where his family will stay. He is 33 years of age and married with five children who are all in primary school. The business is doing very well; however, it can not finance the completion of the house.

loans.use: Edison would like to complete his house and the materials to be used include: 5 bags of cement, glass, window frames, and paint.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
N. Jennifer - the “fruits woman,” as she is commonly known along Kiira Road next to Kiira Road Police Station - is a very hard-working young lady who is 28 years old and a mother of three. Her first child is in primary one at Kitante Primary School, one of the good schools in Kampala.

She sells all types of fruits such as yellow bananas, mangoes, paw paws, pineapples, apples, oranges, pears, passion fruits, and Matoke. Her main customers are the passers-by on the busy road that goes to Ntinda, Bukoto, and Kiwatule, which are big residential areas in Kampala. In a day she sells about USD85. She says her sales would be high if she had enough money to buy matoke (green bananas) because of high demand.

She started her business in the year 2000, and her first loan was USD110. She later graduated to USD171, USD285, USD457, and USD 742. She said she has built a house for her parents in Mbale, a major town in eastern Uganda, and bought a banana plantation in her home area. She is looking forward to getting enough capital to increase sales which will eventually increase profits. She has opened another strategic outlet in Ntinda, and this will be run by her sister, whom she has trained in the same business.

loans.use: Jennifer wants to buy five boxes of the commonly bought fruits: passion fruits, mangoes, pineapples, paw paws, vegetables, and fifty bunches of matoke per purchase.

loans.name: Yim

texts.en:
Mrs. Yim S. M. is 27 years old and lives with her husband and 3 school-aged children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. To support her family, Mrs. S. M. sells live fish in her community, which enables her to generate around $5 in income each day. Her husband is a worker and makes only $2.50 each day.

This loan is vitally necessary to them and will be used to expand Mrs. S. M.'s fish-selling business as well as to fix their house in order to keep it from leaking during the rainy season.

(This is a picture of her husband because Mrs. S. M. was unavailable.)

loans.use: To expand her business and also to fix her house in order to keep it from leaking during the rainy season

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
M. Godfrey is the first-born in the family and takes care of his three young sisters who are school, one in primary seven and two in secondary school. He is married and has three children. Two are attending nursery education and the other is a baby.

He operates a retail shop in Butakabukirwa-Kamwokya, a very congested shantytown in Kampala. His shop is well organized, expensive, and handles customers very well. This has made his business grow because of repeat purchases by customers, which leads to good returns in the long run. He started his business in the year 2000 in his home area, Rukungiri, in southwestern Uganda.

In 2001, he decided to relocate to Kampala and opened a small retail shop in Kamwokya. He later boosted the business with a loan of USD110 from Feed The Children Uganda (now Pearl Microfinance Ltd.). The business went very well, and he paid back the loan and requested another loan of USD228. Because he was a good member, his loan was approved. Through the years, he has bought a plot of land and a house in Kamwokya and a banana plantation in his home area. His daily sales range from USD110-150. He sells almost all household items and all soft drinks and beer. Godfrey would like to renovate his house and start renting it at USD110 per month.

loans.use: Godfrey would like to renovate his house and start renting it at USD110 per month.

loans.name: Rodiyah

texts.id:
From her hobby cooking, finally Rodiyah was able to work independently and open a food stall in her home, with a capital of only Rp 300,000 (about US $33.00)/day, Rodiyah was able to collect a profit of about Rp 75,000 (about $8.00)/day from her sales of: rice, various kinds of small dishes, vegetables, drinks, and other various small selection of other light meals. The business that she worked since 10 years was barely enough to pay for her daily household expenses, and pay for schooling of her three children. Rodiyah opens her foodstall from daily form 09:00 to 23:00, serving mostly student renters who live in the same location as Rodiyah. The funds she will receive from DINARI will be used by Rodiyah to buy  a small push cart to sell meat-balls that her husband would use to sell those meatballs around the neighborhood, and therefore increase the household income for daily expenses and pay for the children schooling.

__________________

Dari hobinya memasak akhirnya Rodiyah mempunyai usaha sendiri yaitu membuka warung makan ditempat tinggalnya, dengan modal 300.000 rupiah/hari Rodiyah mampu mengumpulkan keuntungan sekitar 75.000 rupiah/hari dari hasil jualannya berupa; nasi, berbagai macam lauk-pauk, sayur-sayuran, minuman dan makanan kecil lainnya. Usaha yang ditekuninya Sejak 10 tahun yang lalu ini mampu mencukupi kebutuhan rumah tangganya, bahkan menyekolahkan ketiga anaknya. Rodiyah membuka warungnya dari pukul 09.00 sampai pukul 23.00, para pembelinya adalah anak-anak kost yang tinggal selokasi dengan Rodiyah. Dana yang diterima dari DINARI dipakai oleh Rodiyah untuk membeli rombong bakso (gerobak bakso) yang nantinya akan dipakai suaminya untuk berjualan bakso keliling sehingga dapat mendongkrak pendapatan rumah tangga mereka untuk kebutuhan setiap hari dan membiayai anak-anak sekolah.

loans.use:
To buy Food ingredients and a small push cart to sell meat-balls
___________
Untuk membeli bahan-bahan makanan serta membeli Rombong Bakso.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.pt:
Rosa T. is 41 years old. She is married and she has 3 children. Her residency is located in Albasine - a town located in Maputo city. She sells meat from her home. She joined the program on May 10th, 2007 with a loan of 3.000 MT and now she is going to start the second cycle of the loan. She will request the amount of 5.000 MT to be paid off in 5 months. She plans to invest the loan amount in business.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Rosa T. tem 41 anos de idade, vive maritalmente e é mãe de 3 filhos.Tem a sua residência no bairro Albasine, arredores da cidade de Maputo. Vende carne por encomenda e parte vende em casa. Entrou para o programa em 10 de Maio de 2007, com um empréstimo inicial de 3.000 MT e agora vai para o 2º ciclo de empréstimo e pretende tomar 5.000 MT para pagar em 5 meses, os quais pretende aplicar no negócio.

loans.use: Aumento do Stock

loans.name: Me

texts.en:
Mrs. Me S. is 27-year-old mother of one child and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. Mrs. S. works selling a variety of vegetables at an open-air market, earning around $2/day in profit. Her husband is not only employed at a private company, but he also works in his farmland growing different kinds of vegetables. Whilst he is free in the evenings after work, he even drives a motor-taxi. These activities can earn him on average around $5/day in income.

Recently, this couple has applied for a loan to purchase a water pump, seeds for their crop expansion, and to purchase a motorcycle for Mr. S. to use in his motor-taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump, seeds,  and to purchase a motorcycle to operate a motor-taxi business

loans.name: Luísa Petrosse

texts.pt:
Luisa Petrosse T. is 40 years old. She is a widown and has one son. She lives in the city of Polana Caniço in Maputo. She sells different sorts of food from her home and she wishes to take out a loan in the amount of 10.000 MT that will be paid back in 6 months. This amount will be used to strenghten her business. She is new to the program.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Luísa Petrosse T. tem 40 anos de idade, é viúva e mãe de um filho. Vive no bairro Polana Caniço em Maputo. Vende diversos produtos de mercearia em sua casa e pretende tomar um empréstimo de 10.000MT para pagar em 6 meses para reforçlar op seu negócio.É nova no Programa

loans.use: Aumento do Stock

loans.name: Matânia Paulo

texts.pt:
Matania Paulo M. is 58 years old. She is a single mother and has 2 children. She lives on the 16th Kilometer in Boane. She is a fashion designer. She makes and sells clothes from her home. She is new to the program and she is pursuing a loan in the amount of 4.000 MT that will be paid back in 5 months. The loan will be used to purchase more material needs for her line of business, such as fabric, threads, buttons, ec.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Matânia Paulo M. tem 58 anos de idade,é mãe solteira de 2 filhos e vive no KM 16 em Boane. É modista , faz e vende roupa em sua casa. É nova no programa e pretende um empréstimo de 4.000 MT para pagar em 5 meses para aplicar na compra material para a sua actividade(tecidos, linhas, botões, etc.).

loans.use: Compra de Materia Prima

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Phorn Sokhum is a 36-year-old mother of three children and works selling food and some grocery products to the people in her community, where she can typically earn around $ 4 each day. Her husband is self-employed as a construction foreman and also works as a farmer, earning only a meager sum.

Mrs. Phorn Sokhum has recently applied for a loan to expand her inventory by adding more grocery products and invest in her business to grow it.

loans.use: To expand her inventory by adding more grocery products and reinvest in her business

loans.name: Mutabar

texts.en: Mutabar S. is the owner of three stalls selling men’s clothing and fabrics. Her business is located in Atushbazaar, Khujand, Tajikistan. She has 7 children and 12 grandchildren. Her younger daughter helps her in the business. Her grandchildren are also old enough to help granny in the market. When Mutabar goes to purchase goods at the wholesale market, she leaves her grandchildren at her place of business. She brings her goods from Karosu, once a month. Mutabar says that her business is going well. For the moment, she has wide assortment of goods and the turnover of her working capital is fast. She is planning to spend the requested US$ 1,200 loan purchasing seasonal goods for resale.

loans.use: purchasing seasonal goods for her men's clothing shops

loans.name: Naim

texts.en:
Naim R. started his business in 1989 selling food products. Gradually he increased his working capital and changed his business field to selling children's clothes. Naim is married and has two children. His wife is his business partner; she sells their goods when he is away on purchasing trips.

Naim buys his goods from Istaravshan, Khujand two times a week. The turnover of his business is good. As he has two kids of his own and really loves children, he has no trouble choosing clothes children like.

Naim is very satisfied with his business, but for the coming cold season he needs to purchase a batch of warm clothes such as jackets, cardigans, and dungarees. For this purpose he is requesting a loan of US$ 1,200.

loans.use: purchase seasonal clothing for resale

loans.name: Dilfuza

texts.en:
Dilfuza U. has been selling children’s and men’s clothing for over 5 years now. Her business is located in Atushbazaar, Khujand. She brings goods in herself from Istaravshan once a month.

Dilfuza became a client of MicroInvest in March of 2007 with a beginning loan of US$ 150. Now her working capital is about $ 500. She says that her business is profitable as she is able to sell her goods in a short time.

Dilfuza wants to increase her inventory by purchasing new, up-to-date goods for the coming autumn season. For this purpose she needs a loan in the amount of US$ 400.

loans.use: purchase seasonal goods for her clothing stall

loans.name: Meriamo

texts.pt:
Meriamo Macuacua is 56 years old. She is married and has one son. She lives in the town of Hulene "A" in Maputo. She sells basic need products from home and from her ranch in the Khongolote zone. She joined the program in October, 2006, when she received a loan in the amount of 3.000 MT. She will now start her third loan cycle and this time she will borrow 6.000 MT, which will be paid off in six months. She will use the loan amount to increase her inventory.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Meriamo M. tem 56 anos de idade, é casada e mãe de um filho. Vive no bairro Hulene "A" em Maputo. Vende produtos de 1ª necessidade em casa e também tem machamba na zona de Khongolote. Entrou para o Programa em Outubro de 2006, tomou como 1º empréstimo 3.000MT e agora vai para o terceiro ciclo e vai tomar um emprestimo de 6.000MT pagável em seis meses com vista a reforçar o stock.

loans.use: Aumento do Stock

loans.name: Lina Bernardo

texts.pt:
Lina Bernardo M. is 41 years old. She is a widow, mother of 4. She lives in the neighborhood of Massaca, in the district of Boane, in the province of Maputo. Lina has a store where she sells basic groceries. She is also a cook in the Casa do Gaiato. Lina has recently joined the program . She has requested her first loan of 4.000MT, to be repaid is 5 months, to increase the stock of her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Lina Bernardo M. tem 41 anos de idade, é viúva e mãe de 4 filhos. Vive no Bairro Massaca no distrito de Boane província de Maputo.Vende produtos de 1ª necessidade e é também cozinheira na Casa do Gaiato. É nova no programa e pretende tomar um empréstimo de 4.000MT pagáveis em 5 meses para aplicar compra de mercadoria para o seu negócio.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.en:
Shahodat I. has been selling perfumes and household goods since 1997 in Atushbazzar, Khujand. She started her business in an open-air market. Gradually she increased her working capital and rented a shop for her business. She has 4 children, who are all at school.

Shahodat's business partner is her husband who helps her to brings goods from the wholesale market in Panjshanbe, Khujand, two times a week. She also receives some goods from distributors of firms such as P&G, Pamiss, Oriflame, and Dove.

Today her business is going well but Shahodat would like to increase her inventory so as to offer a greater variety of goods. For this purpose she is requesting a loan of US$ 1,200.

loans.use: purchase a more varied inventory for her stall

loans.name: Azarias Francisco

texts.pt:
Azarias Francisco V. is 37 years old. He is married and father of 5 children. He lives in Corumana in the district of Moamba, in the Province of Maputo. Azarias sells clothes and other basic products, in addition to soft drinks. He joined the program in June 2006 and his first loan was of 6.000MT. Azarias is now in the 2nd cycle of the program. He is requesting a loan of 15.000MT, to be repaid in 6 months, in order to increase his stock.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Azarias Francisco V. tem 37 anos de idade, vive maritalmente e é pai de 5 filhos.Vive em Corumana no Distrito da Moamba, província de Maputo. Vende roupas , diversos produtos de 1ª necessidade e ainda bebidas e refrigerantes.Entrou para o programa em Junho de 2006 e tomou 6.000MT como 1º empréstimo. Vai no 2ºciclo e vai tomar 15.000Mt para pagar em 6 meses com vista a reforçar o negócio.

loans.use: Increase Stock

loans.name: Sopiah

texts.id:
Sopiah is the mother of 3 children, and a grandmother of 7; yet Sopiah still has a strong will to be productive despite her elderly age. Sopiah has a catering business to make cakes for the family living. The business she is in includes making colored rice, mixed rice, uduk (meat & spices) rice, yellow rice, bolu (some sort of local) cake, tart cake, and others. In a week Sopiah received orders of around 200 to 500 rice products, and each rice package were priced between Rupiah 5000 -7000 (about 60-80 US cents) depending on the taste of the orderer. Sopiah begins to work on her food around 03:00 in the morning, until finished, then deliver the order by her motor bike. In a week Sopiah is able to profit about Rupiah 500,000 (about $56), and with that profit Sopiah was able to provide basic schooling for her children until they finished; now she even like to help her grandchildren to fulfill their dream.
__________________

Sopiah adalah ibu dari 3 orang anak dan nenek dari 7 orang cucu namun dengan begitu Sopiah masih mempunyai semangat yang luar biasa untuk menjadi manusia yang produktif meskipun usianya sudah semakin senja. Sopiah mempunyai usaha Catering serta membuat kue untuk menghidupi keluarganya. pekerjaan yang dia tekuni adalah; membuat nasi jinggo, nasi campur, nasi uduk, nasi kuning, kue bolu, kue tart, dan lain-lain. dalam waktu seminggu Sopiah mendapat orderan sekitar 200 sampai 500 bungkus nasi yang perbungkusnya diberi harga bervariasi antara 5000 rupiah - 7000 rupiah tergantung dari selera pemesan. Sopiah mulai mengolah bahan makanan sekitar jam 03.00 pagi sampai selesai kemudian diantar ke pelanggan dengan menggunakan sepeda motor. dalam seminggu Sopiah mampu mengumpulkan keuntungan dari usahanya sampai 500.000 rupiah/minggu dan lewat keuntungan itu Sopiah mampu menyekolahkan anaknya sampai selesai bahkan bertekat untuk membantu cucu-cucunya dalam menggapai cita-cita mereka.

loans.use:
To buy Food ingredients ________________
Membeli bahan-bahan makanan

loans.name: Ziyeddin

texts.en:
Ziyaddin A. is 40 years old and married with 5 children. He is from Azerbaijan in the Agdam region, an Armenian conflict territory situated in the western part of Azerbaijan. He is the only income-earner of his family. Ziyaddin started his business in 1999 when he purchased one milk cow with money he had saved. This money was not enough to cover all of the family expenses.

In 2005 Ziyeddin borrowed $600 from Normicro and expanded his business by purchasing another milk cow. Since January 2006, prices have doubled and Ziyeddin has applied for a loan of $1000 from Normicro to purchase two calves for meat production to expand his business and considerably increase his income.

Ziyeddin would like to receive a $1,200 loan in order to acquire 3 small bulls and feed for them, and to make some repairs. He will repay the loan within 6 months. He hopes to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: To acquire 3 small bulls and feed for them, and to make some repairs.

loans.name: Neman

texts.id:
Neman S. is a Used Goods Collector, he employs 12 staff to help him out. All of them live in a rented house at Jalan Bung Tomo no. 6, which cost them 35.000.000 rupiah for 5 years. This is not a small sum for Neman, however with hardwork and perseverance, Neman also manage to raise his two schooling children. His daily revenue depends on his 12 staff's daily collection of used goods, which average to around 150.000 - 200.000 rupiah daily. Which is just barely enough to support his business's and his children's daily expenses.

Translated from Bahasa by bernard , Kiva volunteer.

Neman S. adalah seorang pengepul barang-barang rongsokan dengan memperkerjakan 12 anak buahnya yang tinggal ditempat yang sama dengan mengontrak sebuah rumah di jalan Bung Tomo no. 6 dengan biaya kontrak 35.000.000 rupiah/5 tahun. ini tentunya bukan biaya yang sedikit bagi seorang pemulung seperti Neman, namun dengan tekad yang besar Neman mampu menjalaninya dengan kerja keras apalagi untuk membiayai kedua anak-anaknya yang masih sekolah. keuntungan yang didapat perharinya tergantung dari usaha dari ke 12 anak buahnya dalam mencari barang rongsokan tetapi keuntungan yang didapat berkisar antara 150.000 - 200.000 rupiah perhari yang harus dipotong biaya hidup yang tidak sedikit dan sebagian lagi harus disisihkan untuk biaya sekolah anaknya.

loans.use: Untuk membeli barang-barang rongsokan - To buy Used Goods

loans.name: Sihami

texts.id:
Madam Sihami P., has two child a boy and a girl. She lives with her family at a rented place. Her husband runs a drink stall. Her cake selling business is to increase her household income. She starts work from 5am in the morning till 9pm. Besides selling her cakes at her stall, she also takes delivery orders. Her average daily revenue is around Rp 50.000,00. With this extra Rp 700.000,00 she hopes to take in more order by stocking up more ingredients and materials for the upcoming festival. She also plans to buy a mixer, to ease her cake making task.

Translated from Bahasa by bernard , Kiva volunteer.

Ibu Sihami P. merupakan ibu rumah tangga yang dikaruniai seorang putra dan seorang putri. Dia tinggal di rumah kontrakan bersama suami dan kedua anaknya. Suaminya memiliki usaha air minum isi ulang. Usaha kue ini dia jalani untuk menambah penghasilan keluarga. Dia mengerjakannya mulai dari jam 5 pagi sampai dengan jam 9. Setelah itu dia titipkan di warung - warung untuk dijual. Selain itu dia juga menerima pesanan. Penghasilannya perhari berkisar Rp 50.000,00. Modal sebesar Rp 700.000,00 ini dia harapkan untuk menambah modal pembelian bahan - bahan mentah. Sehubungan dengan hari raya Lebaran yang akan datang. Tentunya akan banyak sekali pesanan yang akan bisa dipenuhi oleh Sihami dengan modal yang besar. Selain itu juga untuk rencana pembelian mixer. Alat ini sangat memudahkan Sihami dalam proses pembuatan kuenya.

loans.use: Membeli bahan - bahan membuat kue dan rencana membeli mixer  - To buy ingredients for making cake and a mixer

loans.name: Patrício Piloto

texts.pt:
Patrício Piloto M. is 30 years old. He is married and father of one daughter. He lives in the neighborhood of Magoanine, around the city of Maputo. He sells basic groceries in a smallstand in his home. Patrício joined the program in August 2006 ad requested a loan of 3.000MT. He is now in the 3rd cycle of the program. Patrício is requesting a loan of 7.000MT, to be repaid in 7 months. He plans on increasing his stock, and strengthening his business.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Patrício Piloto M. tem 30 anos de idade, vive maritalmente e é pai de uma filha. Vive no bairro de Magoanine, arredores da cidade de Maputo. Vende produtos de 1ª necessidade numa pequena barraca na sua residência. Entrou para o programa em Agosto de 2006 com um empréstimo de 3.000MT. Está no 3º ciclo de mepreéstimo e vai tomar 7.000 para pagar em 7 meses com vista a reforçar o seu negócio.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Suliati

texts.id:
Suliati started her stall about 5 years ago. With a daily capital of Rp.275.000, Suliati manage to gain a net profit of Rp.45.000 which she used to finance her daily expenses and savings for her children who will start schooling next year. Suliati is very hardworking, her daily schedule start from 4 am in the morning till 9 pm in the evening. Her husband helps her out in the stall. With the financial assistant from kiva's partner DINARI, Suliati will do renovation to her stall and expand her business.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by bernard Kiva volunteer.

Usaha warung yang ditekuni Suliati sudah lama ditekuninya kira-kira 5 tahun yang lalu dan cukup berjalan dengan baik, dengan modal perhari Rp.275.000.-. Suliati memperoleh keuntungan Rp.45.000.- yang digunakan untuk membiayai kehidupan sehari-harinya dan sebagian disisihkan untuk persiapan sekolah anaknya tahun depan. Suliati menjalankan usahanya cukup tekun, bangun mulai dari jam 04.00 pagi mempersiapkan semuanya sampai jam 21.00. Suaminya ikut membantu sehingga Suliati merasa pekerjaannya sedikit ringan. Modal yang diterima dari DINARI akan digunakan untuk memperbaiki warungnya yang masih banyak yang kurang seperti: lantainya masih semen kasar.

loans.use: Food Stall Renovation

loans.name: Siti

texts.id:
Siti age 45 started making and selling cakes since 5 years ago. Her daily journey starts as early as 3am where she needs to prepare the materials and be ready the delicacies before dawn. She would later distribute her cakes to stalls and her usual customers. Her daily revenue is 50.000 rupiah which is used to finance her daily expenses and remainder will be saved for rainy days. She lives with her husband Abdullah. Her monthly rental expenses is 120.000 rupiah. Siti hopes that with kiva's help she will be able to raise her 3 kids, to buy her own house and lastly expand her business.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Diusianya yang ke 45 tahun Siti tetap dengan usahanya yang Ia jalani sejak 5 tahun yang lalu yaitu membuat kue basah dan menjualnya. bahan-bahan yang dibeli oleh Siti mulai diolah pada pukul 03.00 subuh sehingga ketika matahari mulai menampakkan sinarnya semua adonan kue telah siap dipasarkan. Kue-kue tersebut nantinya akan diantar Siti ke warung-warung dan para langganan lainnya yang biasanya bekerjasama dengan Siti. Siti mendapat keuntungan dari usahanya adalah 50.000 rupiah/hari, keuntungan tersebut digunakan untuk biaya hidup setiap hari dan sebagian disimpan untuk keperluan yang tidak terduga. Siti tinggal bersama suaminya yang bernama Abdullah dengan mengontrak kos-kosan dengan biaya 120.000 rupiah/bulannya dan ditempat inilah Siti mengolah kue yang dipasarkannya. dengan keahliannya ini Siti mampu membesarkan ketiga anaknya impian untuk mempunyai rumah sendiri dan usaha yang berkembang merupakan harapan Siti dimasa yang akan datang.

loans.use: Untuk membeli bahan-bahan kue - To purchase ingredients for making cakes

loans.name: Ruhadiyah

texts.id: Ibu Ruhadiyah bersama dengan suaminya, Sunarto, menjalankan usaha membeli barang-barang rongsokan untuk dijual ke pengepul. Mereka tinggal bersama serorang putri mereka, Sumiati, yang berumur 12 tahun namun tidak sekolah. Mereka tinggal di kos-kosan Rp 140.000,00/ bulannya. Setiap hari mereka berangkat jam 6 pagi berbekal gerobak yang berfungsi sebagai tempat barang-barang rongsokan yang mereka beli. Setiap hari mereka berkeliling menempuh jarak kurang lebih 2 km. Setiap harinya mereka mendapatkan untung Rp 50.000,00. Itu masih belum terhitung dengan biaya hidup perhari mereka. Harapan mereka adalah kehidupan yang lebih baik. Anak mereka bisa bersekolah dan memiliki rumah sendiri.

loans.use: Membeli barang-barang rongsokan untuk dijual ke pengepul

loans.name: Sonia Zauria

texts.pt:
Sonia is married and mother of 3 children. Her oldest child is 5 years old, the middle one 3, and the youngest is 1 year old. Sonia’s husband is a miner, and works in a neighboring country.

She is requesting a loan for the first time. She wants to invest this money on buying chicken feed and more chickens. Sonia also wants to increase the space of the chicken coop, buy medicines and water bowls for the chickens. Sonia’s husband is usually away working in 12 month contracts, so Sonia takes care of the home and the children. Sonia relies on her chicken business for everyday expenses and savings for the periods her husband is away.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Sonia e casada e mae de 3 filhos. Todos ainda sao menores o mais velho tem 5 anos o do meio 3 anose o mais pequeno tem 1 ano. O marido trabalha num pais vizinho porque e mineiro.Esta a tomar emprestimo pela primeira vez. Ela quer aplicar este dinheiro na compra de racao para os frangos enquanto nao sao compradose adquirir mais pintos. Quer aumentar tambem o espaco onde ela cria os pintos enquanto pequenos, e comprar bebedouros, comedouros e mais vacinas. Porque o marido trabalha fora do pais ele tem estado foraa por 12 meses pois que o contrato dele e anual. Assim ela e que cuida da casa e dos filhos. por isso ela deve ter o seu proprio negocio para as despesas urgentes e inadiaveis enquanto o marido nao regressa.

loans.use: Sonia is requesting a loan in order to buy more chickens, chicken feed, expand her chicken coop, and to purchase vaccines for her business.

loans.name: Minavvar

texts.en: Minavvar is pictured with her husband. They have 3 children. This family lives in Khachmaz region in the Seyidler village. Minavvar is 45 years old. This family has been in this business for 6 years. They plan to buy a cow; therefore, they have applied for a loan of $725.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Olga Elias

texts.pt:
Olga is married, currently separated. She has 4 children, who are all in school. She used to be a Bank clerk. She now works in a security company and owns a small store where she sells basic products. Olga’s husband left her and moved to the north region. She is requesting this loan in order to increase the stock of her small store. Olga’s children are all in school, and she is working hard to support them after her husband left. She has been able to repay the loans she requested before and invest in her small business.

She joined the Women Development Funds in 2005. She has been able to improve her home. Olga is also very good at managing her business and has been making payments in a timely manner.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Olga e casada mas de momento esta separada do marido. Ela tem 4 filhos e todos estao a estudar. Outrora ela foi funcionaria de um banco Comercial. Agora trabalha numa empresa de Seguranca. Ela tem uma pequena loja onde vende produtos de primeira necessidade. O marido abandonou-lhe e foi radicar-se na zona norte do Pais.. Ela quer tomar este emprestimo para adquirir mais produtos paraa sua lojinha que se situa num dos bairros limitrofes da cidade.. Todos os seus filhos estao a estudar e ela consegue sustenta-los apesar de o marido ter-lhe abandonado. Ela conseguiu pagar dividas que ele tinha contraido e ainda conseguiu fundos para aplicar na lojinha.

Ela entrou para o Programa de credito do Fundo de desenvolvimento da Mulher em 2005. Ela tem uma casa melhorada e consegue gerir muito bem o seu negocio. Ela paga pontualmente as suas dividas.

loans.use: Olga is requesting a loan to purchase products for her grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more electronic accessories, belts and men's hats

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Mrs. Alice E. is 48, married, and has six children. She sells bread and provisions to earn her living. She needs a small loan in the amount of US$ 400 to enhance her business, i.e., buy more bread and provisions for resale. This will enable Alice to earn a better living as well as taking better care of her family. She has been a faithful and trustworthy member of LAPO for the past 7 years.

loans.use: To buy more bread & provisions for resale

loans.name: Luis A.

texts.es:
Luis studies computer science in a school called Escuela Industrial, and he lives in an area known as Alto San Pedro. His main source of income comes from the maintenance, repair and creation of small computer programs. Luis needs to finish his studies, and with his income he will be able to repay the loan.

This is the first time Luis has requested a loan. The requested amount will make it possible for him to buy his own computer. This will help him a great deal, as he will save on the costs of renting equipment.

Luis estudia en la Escuela Industrial la carrera de informática. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Alto San Pedro. Su principal fuente de de ingresos es el mantenimiento, reparación y elaboración de pequeños programas de computación, ya que tiene que solventar sus estudios, teniendo la fuente de repago para cubrir el préstamo. Es primera vez que solicita un crédito. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de una computadora y esto le servirá de gran manera y así podrá ahorrar los fletes de equipo.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: purchase a computer

loans.name: Osatohamwen

texts.en: Osatohamwen O. is a member of LAPO's union and she is happy with her kind of business. She sells all kinds of drinks and fried meat in her restaurant and needs a small loan in the amount of US$ 400  to boost her business by buying more drinks and meat for resale. She is 40 years old and has 3 years' experience in her business. She also has four children.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for resale

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en:
"I am proud to have been a LAPO member for five years now," says Mrs. Philomena I.. She is 39 years old and is married and mother of four children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.

Philo sells food items to people in her community. She needs a small loan in the amount of US$ 400 to boost her business by adding to her inventory. She has been in this business since 1994.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her stand

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy curtains, fabrics, and bedcovers for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more second-hand trousers for sale and rent a stall for his business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mrs. Mary E. deals in tomatoes & fruit in an open-market in a semi-urban area in Edo State, Nigeria. She needs a loan in the amount of US$ 800 to buy more tomatoes and also fruit  for the expansion of her business. Mary is married, mother of 4 children, and has been a LAPO client for 5 years. She has a total of 11 years' experience in business.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes & fruits for resale

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en:
Mr. Ilham is a low-income vulnerable person. He is 32, married with two children, and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Ilham rents a barber shop and has two employees. They serve clients and pay the master for the rent at the end of each month. There is a school season coming up, and as a rule all schoolchildren cut their hair before going to school. Ilham's barber shop isn't in good condition and needs to be renovated immediately. Ilham applied for a $500 loan from the Normicro Saatli branch. After getting the loan and renovating the shop, he plans to collect more customers and increase his daily income.

loans.use: To renovate the barber shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more trousers for resale and fund a new stall location for his second-hand clothing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her stock of new shoes and handbags for sale

loans.name: Babek

texts.en:
Mr. Babek is a low-income, vulnerable person. He is 40, married with three children, and lives in the village of Saatli in the south-central plains area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Babek has a place in the local market of Saatli where he sells watermelons seasonally. The business is running well but needs to increase its daily turnover. That's why Babek has applied to Normicro's Saatli branch for a loan of US$ 500.

With this loan as business capital, Babek intends to increase his turnover and thus his income from selling so as to better provide the necessities of life for his three children.

loans.use: To expand volume of business

loans.name: Isokan

texts.en:
Mrs. Isokan A. is a fashion designer. She sews and sells clothes to people in her community. She is a 37-year-old, married mother of 2 children. She is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 475 to buy more tailoring materials for the expansion of her business.

Isokan has been in this business since 2001 and has also been a LAPO member for 4 years.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring materials for her business

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
"LAPO has rained good things on me," says Mrs. Lucy Osahonkhoe. She hails from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Lucy hopes to expand her business with the requested loan amount of US$ 400, i.e. buy more food items for resale in an open-air market.

Lucy has been in this business since 2000 and is a LAPO leader in one of the unions. She is 45 years old, married, and mother of five children.

loans.use: To buy more food items for sale

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.en:
Mr. Rovshan is a low-income, vulnerable person. He is 26 and lives in Saatli in the south-central plains area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Rovshan rents a small shop in the local bazaar of Saatli and sells food. The business is very successful but needs some investment of capital to increase its daily turnover.

Rovshan has no collateral that would allow him to apply to commerial banks. That's why he has applied to Normicro's Saatli branch for a US$ 500 loan. This loan will allow him to buy bigger amounts of goods for resale and to better provide the necessities of life for his children.

loans.use: To increase the variety of goods in his inventory

loans.name: John

texts.en: "My tyre business gives me hope of living a better life. I need additional business capital to boost my business, though," says Mr. John A., who lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. John is 29 years old, married, and father of 2 children. He has been in this business since 2005 and is the secretary of his union. With the loan amount John intends to expand his inventory (i.e., buy more tyres for sale).

loans.use: To buy more tyres for sale

loans.name: Kamran

texts.en:
Kamran is a low-income, vulnerable person. He is 45, married with three children, and lives in Saatli in the south-central plains area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Kamran rents a small shop in the local bazaar of Saatli town where he sells souvenirs, toys for children, etc. The business is very successful but needs some investment of capital to increase the daily turnover.

Kamran has no collateral that would allow him to apply to the commercial banks for a loan to provide capital for his little shop. That's why he has applied to Normicro's Saatli branch for a US$ 500 loan. This loan would allow him to buy bigger quantities of goods for resale and provide better for the necessities of life for his children.

loans.use: To increase the variety of goods

loans.name: Ruhid

texts.en: Mr. Ruhid is a low income vulnerable person. He is 29 and lives in the Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Rovshan rents a sandwich bar in the local bazaar of Saatli town and prepare and sells sandwiches to customers and vendors. The business is going well and needs some investments to increase the daily turnover. But Rovshan has no collateral to apply to the commercial banks. That's why he applied to Normicro Saatli branch for $500 loan. This credit could let him to buy and sell bigger amount of goods and to increas his monthly income.

loans.use: To expand volume of business

loans.name: James

texts.en: James E. is a client of LAPO and lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. He is 32 years old and married. He sells drinks wholesale. He is eager to receive this loan in the amount of $475, so that he can buy more drinks for sale and improve the growth of his business. He has been in this business since 2000.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Mrs. Francisca is 48 years old, she is married and has two children. She sells and buys recyclables since more than 15 years ago. Thanks to this job and to the help of her husband she could raise and educate her children, as well as improve her home with basic commodities. Francisca, comments that this job of buying and selling recyclables is very complex because one needs to be a quick assessor; when her neighbors come and sell her the products she needs to value and quote on the spot. Francisca and her husband are hard-working dynamic people. They are early risers, they start their working day very early, because of this they sell their products in the main recycling plants of the city. The previous loans that she got from Fundacion Paraguaya were invested in the purchase of a scale and for the enlargement of the floor in her backyard to store the products. Now, she is asking for a loan so she can buy more recyclables such as irons, plastics, and cartons.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Francisca tiene 48 años, está casada y tiene 2 hijos, se dedica a la actividad de vender y comprar artículos reciclables hace más de 15 años y gracias a éste trabajo y con la ayuda de su marido pudo mantener y educar a sus hijos, como así también pudo dotar las comodidades mínimas a su casa. Francisca, comenta que éste oficio de comprar y vender éstos artículos es muy complejo ya que uno debe ser un tasador veloz, porque los vecinos de la zona se acercan a su domicilio a ofrecerle los artículos y en el momento debe cotizar y pagar por la compra. Tanto, Francisca, como su marido, son personas trabajadoras y muy dinámicas, ya que se levantan a muy tempranas horas para iniciar su jornada laboral, debido a que estos productos ellos los venden a las principales fábricas de la ciudad. Los préstamos que obtuvo anteriormente de la Fundación Paraguaya los ha invertido en la compra de una báscula, y también en la ampliación del piso de su patio para almacenar sus mercaderías. Ahora solicita un préstamo nuevo que lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para reciclar como hierros, plásticos, cartones, etc.

loans.use: compra de materiales para reciclar como hierros, plásticos, cartones, etc.

loans.name: John

texts.en: "I was trained how to make furniture for 3 years, and I opened my own business 2 years later," says Mr. John E.. He is 36 years old, married, and has two children. He is a leader in the LAPO union, and he looks forward to receiving the above loan to enable him to buy more materials to make furniture.

loans.use: To buy more materials to make furniture

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Mrs. Faith I. is 48 years old, married, and the mother of five (5) children. She sells eggs wholesale to market men and women. She has been in this business since 1987 and hopes to increase her business if the loan is given to her.

loans.use: To buy more crates of eggs for sale

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: When I heard about what LAPO is doing for the poor I was amaze to seek their help and hopefully, I was given loan to increase my business. Eunice A. plaits hair for people in her community. She is 68 years old, a widow mother of nine (9) children. She needs the loan  of $400 to boost her business. She has been in business since 1967.

loans.use: To buy more materials

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.es:
Joaquin is a 28 years old, single photographer. His photographic studio is located downtown Caacupe, he has been this job for more than 10 years. Currently, he has all the necessary elements to cover most of the events on the Cordillera department, which encompasses many towns and villages, Caacupe among them. The events he works are weddings, birthdays, baptisms, etc. He comments that he initially started with a single camera, with the more clients and work he had, Joaquin purchased two digital cameras to his already existent stock, thanks to the loans ‘Fundacion Paraguaya’ gave him before hand. Today, Joaquin has a broad client base and he affirms that photography is a very competitive niche and he needs to be up-to-date with the new digital equipment that are out in the market. In his short term projects he has to improve his photography studio and to get a computer and decorate the studio salon, he asks for a loan of $575.-

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva Volunteer.

Joaquín tiene 28 años, es soltero, y es fotógrafo; su estudio fotográfico está ubicado en el centro mismo de la ciudad de Caacupé, éste oficio lo viene desarrollando desde hace más de 10 años, actualmente ya cuenta con todos los elementos necesarios para cubrir los más exigentes eventos en todo el departamento de la Cordillera que está comprendido de varias ciudades y pueblos, entre ellos Caacupe. Entre los eventos que asiste podemos citar casamientos, cumpleaños, bautismos, etc. Comenta que inicialmente empezó con una sola cámara fotográfica y a medida iba teniendo más trabajo y la clientela se volvía exigente, incorporó dos cámaras digitales a su ya existente stock de elementos de trabajo, esto gracias a los préstamos que la Fundación Paraguaya le otorgó anteriormente. Hoy día tiene formado su clientela y afirma que la fotografía es un rubro muy competitivo y se requiere estar actualizado constantemente con los nuevos equipos digitales que actualmente existen en el mercado. Esta dentro de sus proyectos a corto plazo la de mejorar su estudio fotográfico con la incorporación de una computadora y decorar su salón de estudio; para ello solicita un crédito de $ 575.-

loans.use: Para comprar una computadora

loans.name: Taiwo

texts.en: "LAPO has brought light to my family," says Mrs. Taiwo O.. She specializes in the sale of bags of pure water. She is from Edo State and is 37 years old, married, and the mother of four (4) children. She needs an additional loan of $800 to buy more bags of water. She has 6 years of business experience.

loans.use: To buy more bags of water

loans.name: Owokhan

texts.en: "There is a positive difference in my business and my life," explained Miss Owokhan F.. She has a fashion shop, is 29 years old, single, and lives in Benin City, Edo State. She wants to buy an additional sewing machine and materials for her shop. With this loan, she will be able to serve her customers better. She has 6 years of experience in her business.

loans.use: To buy an additional sewing machine and materials

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: "River fish and palm oil are consumable goods, hence the demand for this item is high," says Mrs. Mary O., who hails from Benin City of Edo State. She is 47 years old, married, and a mother of four (4) children. She hopes to get this loan for business expansion, i.e., to buy more river fish and palm oil for sale. She has been in this business since 2001.

loans.use: To buy more river fish, palm oil and Ogbonor for sale

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: An industrious woman who sell plastic products, Mrs. Bridget A. is 38 years old, married, and the mother of one child. She is from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is requesting the above loan of $800 to buy more plastic products for her business. She has 6 years of experience in business and has been a LAPO member for 2 years.

loans.use: To buy more plastic products

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: She is happy because whenever she needs funds for expansion, LAPO always come to her rescue. Mrs. Joy Atafo is a fashion designer by profession and has been in business for 3 years. She is 54 years old, married, and has six (6) children. She is requesting an additional loan of $1,175 to enable her to buy more tailoring materials. She has been in this business since 2001.

loans.use: To buy an additional machine and materials

loans.name: Odia

texts.en: "Rental and sales of VCD plates is a very good business if you invest in the business," says Mr. Odia A.. An Edo man by tribe, he owns a shop and hopes to expand his business by buying more VCD plates for sale and rental, if the loan of US$475 is given to him. He is 35 years old, and has been in this business since 2003.

loans.use: To buy more VCD plates for sale

loans.name: Ibukun

texts.en: Mrs. Ibukun E. is a woman who has experience in her line of business. She is a married mother of two children that are in school. She is 43 years old. She hopes with the loan of $475 she will be able to buy more provisions and drinks for sale. She has 3 years of experience in this business.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks

loans.name: Christy

texts.en: "I am delighted to be engaged in the sale of WAEC scratch cards, forms and rechargeable cards for people through wholesale. With this business, I was able to pay my child's school fees and take care of myself,"says Christy O..  She is 45 years old, married, and has one child. She hopes to expand her business with the above loan, i.e., buying more rechargeable cards and scratch cards. She is from Benin City, Edo State.

loans.use: To buy WAEC scratch cards, forms and rechargeable cards

loans.name: Wilfrido

texts.es:
Wilfrido is 51 years old, married, and has a 25 year old son who helps in his business. Wilfrido has owned a general store and butcher shop for more than 20 years. He explains that just like all businesses, he has ups and downs in his sales, and right now the drought that is affecting the whole country has caused a small crisis in the number of cattle and with agriculture as well. Milk and wheat products have gone up in price, causing a drop in sales at the shops.

One of Wilfrido's greatest hopes is that the economic situation in his country improves. The current crisis is leading to a lack of opportunities for young people. This affects entire families, forcing people into economic exile and in turn, causing a migration of people out of Paraguay to other countries in search of work.

Wilfrido says that thanks to his business, he was able to buy his own house, take care of his family and help his son continue his studies at the university. With his loan from Fundacion Paraguaya, he would like to buy products to better stock his store, especially with those products that move daily such as milk, meat, beer, soft drinks, wine, noodles and other food products.

El señor Wilfrido tiene 51, está casado y tiene un hijo de 25 años quién le ayuda en la atención del negocio. Wilfrido es propietario de una despensa y carnicería desde hace más de 20 años, comenta que como todo negocio tiene sus momentos de altas y bajas en cuanto a las ventas, actualmente la sequía que está afectando al país genera una pequeña crisis en el rubro de la ganadería y la agricultura, por lo que la carne vacuna, la leche y los productos derivados del trigo aumentaron de precio, eso trajo consigo una disminución de las ventas en las despensas. Uno de sus mayores anhelos es que mejore la situación económica actual por la que está pasando el país ya que la falta de oportunidades para los jóvenes genera una consecuencia que afecta a las familias, y que trae como consecuencia el exilio económico de nuestros compatriotas, ósea la migración de las personas a otros países en busca de trabajo. Comenta que gracias a su negocio pudo hacerse de casa propia, mantener a su familia y ayudar a su hijo a cursar estudios superiores en la universidad, tiene pensado renovar su crédito con la Fundación Paraguaya y comprar productos para surtir más su despensa en especial las mercaderías de mayor rotación diaria como la leche, carne, cerveza, gaseosas, vino, fideo, entre otros productos.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, herb tea, oil, meat and various types of beverages for his store

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
" I have not been able to put up a protective fence around my house to provide more security for my family. There have been a lot of robberies in the area where we live. I am requesting $700 for the construction of this protective fence."

“Me hace falta poner una barda al frente de mi casa para darle más seguridad a mi familia, ya que han robado mucho en ese fraccionamiento en donde vivimos”. Solicito $ 700.00 dlls para la construcción de una barda.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Construction of a protective fence

loans.name: Loyola Yolanda

texts.es:
Loyola is 41 years old and married. She and her husband have three children ages 7, 12 and 18. Loyola has a business serving food and drinks while her husband drives a minibus. They both work hard to give their children a good education and quality of life. On weekends, the whole family works together to serve traditional Bolivian meat dishes, but during the week Loyola's husband is off driving his minibus and Loyola works by herself, or with the help of her children if they aren't in school. The restaurant is well-situated in the family's home. They have been open for 12 years and Loyola's cooking is very popular. This loan, the family's ninth from Agrocapital, will pay for installation of a new gas tank for the minibus, saving the family money on fuel. The family counts on the vehicle both for shopping and for the passenger fares it brings in. In her relationship with Agrocapital Loyola has demonstrated herself to be a responsible individual with an excellent record of loan repayment.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Loyola es una señora casada de 41 años, la pareja tiene tres hijos de 18, 12 y 7 años respectivamente. La señora Loyola tiene un negocio familiar de venta de comidas y refrescos, y su esposo presta servicios de transporte de pasajeros en rutas locales, ambos se esfuerzan en el trabajo para dar a sus hijos un nivel de vida mejor y una buena educación. La Sra. Loyola trabaja junto a su esposo e hijos los fines de semana en los que ofrece a su variado público platos tradicionales como son el charque, pato, chancho, enrrollado, etc. Después de lunes a viernes el esposo de Loyola trabaja con su trufi y ella se quedan con sus hijos, quienes la ayudan en los tiempos que no tienen que estudiar o ir a la escuela. El negocio familiar se encuentra muy bien ubicado en instalaciones propias de la familia de Loyola, y gracias a su buen trato, 12 años de experiencia, calidad en sus comidas es que cuenta con bastante afluencia de clientela. Con la presente solicitud, que es la novena en la Institución, comprara un equipo de gas para su movilidad y con el saldo pagará al mecanico por su respectiva instalación. Esta transformación permitirá a la familia economizar en combustible ya que este vehículo tiene dos funciones el de transportar pasajeros y también para comprar en el mercado los insumos para el restaurante. Durante el tiempo de relación de Loyola con Agrocapital demostró ser una persona responsable y con excelente pago de sus cuotas.

loans.use: To buy a gas system for a minibus.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es:
"I have a blacksmith business that I run from my house. I would like to invest in material and tools which will make my work easier and faster, and allow me to provide better service to my customers. I am asking for $900 to invest in this business."

“Tengo un negocio de herrería en mi casa pero me gustaría invertir en algo de material y herramientas, que hagan más fácil y rápido mi trabajo para poder dar un buen servicio y así tener más clientes” Solicito $ 900.00 dlls para invertir en mi negocio.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen is 31 and the single mother of a ten year old son. She worked very hard to earn a professional degree so that she could support herself and her son. For the last four years she has been working as an education administrator for a social services organization. This work often takes her to rural areas where she teaches and does outreach with farmers.
