texts.en: Mrs. Jane Osakuguomwan is 40 years old, a married mother of three children, and lives in Benin City. She sells drinks and food items wholesale and retail. According to her, the loan of US$ 400 will help her improve her business and achieve a better standard of living for her family. She has been in this business since 1993.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and beans for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Mrs. Florence N. sells provisions, bags of rice, and beans to her community. She is 49 years old, a married mother with three children. Florence is also a leader of a group in LAPO unions and she has been in this business since 2000. She is asking for a loan in the amount of US$ 1,175 to enable her to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and bags of  rice and beans for resale

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith O. is 42 years old; she operates a mini provisions store, selling bread, local gin, & provisions to earn her living. She is a married mother of one child and has been with LAPO for the past 6 years, a faithful and trusted member of LAPO union. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria, and has been in business since 1996. Edith is asking for a loan of US$ 475 to increase the variety of her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, local gin and bread for resale

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Mrs. Faith O. is a 43 year old married mother of six (6) children, and sells all kinds of food items in the village market. According to her the loan of US$475 will enhance her business and also reach out to more customers that will come and buy from her. She has been in this business since 1992. She resides in Benin City.

loans.use: To buy more food items such as garri and plantain for sale

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Mrs. Lucy E. is a 41 year old woman who has a mini Depot where she sells drinks wholesale to retailers and also sells food items as well. She is asking for a loan of US$800 to buy more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs. She is a married mother of four (4) children and has been in business since 1991.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs

loans.name: Dupe

texts.en: Miss Dupe O. is 31 years old, and she has a communications stand at the University of Benin (UNIBEN). She sells rechargeable cards of all networks by wholesales, and makes calls for customers. She would like a loan of US$725 to improve her business. She is a faithful LAPO client, and she has two years of experience in this business.

loans.use: To buy more phones and rechargeable cards for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more mens and ladies undergarments

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Mrs. Esther A. is 45 years old and is married with seven (7) children. She hails from Benin City. She is asking for a loan of US$400 to enable her to buy more provisions and food items for sale. She is a dedicated LAPO client and has been in business since 2004.

loans.use: To buy more provision and foodstuffs

loans.name: Anthonia

texts.en: Mrs. Anthonia E. is a 30 year old married mother of three (3) children. She is a hairdresser by profession and also sells drinks and coconuts in the market. She is a dedicated LAPO woman and has been with the organization for the past 5 years. She said if the sum of $475 is given to her, it will boost her business and she will be able to buy more drinks, coconuts and hair cream/relaxer.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and hair dressing equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en: Mrs. Magdalene F. a 30 year old married woman with two (2) children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She purchases yams, garri, bush meat and river fish from the village market and supplies them to retailers. She is asking for a loan in the amount of $625 to enable her to improve her business. She is a LAPO client and has been in this business since 1998.

loans.use: To buy more yams, garri, bush meat, and river fish

loans.name: Anjela

texts.en:
Anjela started her souvenir/knick-knack sales business about four years ago. She presently has a busy little kiosk at the Progress market in Beregovo, Ukraine. Beregovo is located just across the border with Hungary in beautiful southwestern Ukraine, near the Carpathian Mountains. This area enjoys a special economic trade status, different from the rest of Ukraine, which encourages business development.

Anjela hopes in the future to expand her business by opening an additional sales location. She has requested a loan of $1200 to purchase new inventory for her business.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory for her micro-business

loans.name: Ejiose

texts.en: Mrs. Ejiose A. is a native of Benin, and is a married mother of six (6) children. She is 38 years old. She sells crayfish wholesale and she has been in this business since 2004. She has been a LAPO client for 5 years. She needs the loan of $400 to buy more crayfish and for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: To buy more crayfish

loans.name: Aliakbar

texts.en:
Mr. Aliakbar S. lives on a low income, which is vulnerable to the local economy. He is 40, married with three children, and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Mr. S. owns and operates a mini shop in the Saatli town. But, as you see in the picture, the inventory he has is very limited and he has no opportunity to diversify his assortment of goods to sell. For this purpose he has applied to Normicro, Saatli branch, for a loan of $500.

loans.use: To increase variety of spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Lubov is married and has two sons, one who is 21 and one who is 19. Five years ago, she decided to start a small market business selling something her husband and sons would probably appreciate – household tools. She offers a wide range of practical products from tape and screwdrivers to flashlights and electric cords.

Currently, Lubov makes around $650 per month in profit from her business – a large percentage of the total income for her family. Eventually, Lubov hopes to be able to secure a store for her business and she is working toward that goal. She has requested a loan of $875 for additional working capital to use in her business.

This is Lubov's fourth loan from Nadiya Ukraine. We are happy for another opportunity to assist Lubov in improving her business and the well-being of her family.

loans.use: Increase working capital for her little hardware kiosk

loans.name: Valeriya

texts.en:
Valeriya A. has a little business located at the Progress market in Beregovo, southwestern Ukraine. Her business is very aptly named “1000 Gadgets.” She sells a huge variety of all those little household items that everyone needs at one time or another.

Valeriya has been in business for about a year. She has been able to obtain a good location at the market and has built up around $3000 in working capital. She currently makes about $500 a month in profit. Valeriya has requested a loan of $500 that will allow her to broaden and replenish her inventory so she can continue developing her business.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory for her kiosk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir supports his wife and three-year-old daughter by driving a taxi in the western Ukrainian city of Ivano-Frankivsk. He has been driving a taxi for around 4 years. Before that he worked in a government security force.

Vladmir has a good reputation among his fellow taxi drivers. He works hard and is a positive influence on others. Vladimir recently made a large investment in his business by purchasing a new car on credit. One of his immediate goals is to pay off his car. Vladimir has requested a loan of $500 from Nadiya Ukaine to help him buy a cash register for his business and buy insurance. We are happy for the opportunity to help him improve his business and position himself for a successful future.

loans.use: Purchase cash register and insurance

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: A business woman who sells river fish and crayfish, Mrs. Betty O. hails from Benin City. She is 49 years of age, has two (2) children, and is married to Mr. O.. According to her, if the amount of $400 is given to her, it will go a long way in boosting her business by allowing her to buy more river fish and crayfish. She is a trustworthy LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy more crayfish and river fish

loans.name: Yevgeniya

texts.en:
Yevgeniya is married with 4 grown sons. She runs a small business selling cosmetics and perfumes in one of the local markets in Kamenka-Dneprovskaya. It’s the only source of income for her family. Yevgeniya has been in this business for a long time – about 12 years. She has many loyal customers. Recently, she opened a new sales location which is now the biggest kiosk selling perfumes and beauty items in the market. Nadiya Ukraine loans and Yevgeniya’s personal determination have contributed a lot to the expansion of her small venture. Currently, her gross income is about $8,000. Her customers are very pleased with her work and the quality of service in her kiosk.

Yevgeniya is requesting a loan of $1000 to increase her assortment of inventory, purchase new types of products and attract new clients. One of her long-term goals is to become a leading entrepreneur selling this type of merchandise in the market. Yevgeniya is a strong and focused person. She never gives up. Presently, she’s facing a challenging situation in her family as one of her sons is abusing drugs. However, Yevgeniya doesn’t want to get depressed or discouraged but wants to fight for her son’s well-being and healing. We believe her perfect credit history with 15 promptly repaid loans is good proof of Yevgeniya’s trustworthiness and her capability to repay this current loan.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of inventory

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Mrs. Patience B. hails from Bini. She is a 30 year old married mother of one child, and she operates a business centre where she sells DVD plates and all kinds of home movies. She is a client of LAPO and she is asking for a loan of $800 to enable her to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: To buy more DVD plates

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is married with one grown son. She lives in Kamenka-Dneprovskaya, Ukraine. Galina is a small entrepreneur who sells clothing, footwear and household items in one of the local markets in her town. Her venture has provided a good source of income for the whole family. Galina has been in this business for 13 years. Her business growth has been characterized by persevering work and consistent improvement and currently, her gross income is about $4,000.

Galina would like to get a loan of $1000 to increase the range of inventory for sale in her kiosk and boost her sales. She believes that new inventory will attract more potential customers which would automatically increase her profit. Galina is planning to use generated profits to help her son who is facing some economic problems at the moment. We think Galina’s enterprising mindset and natural determination will help her repay this loan on time just as she has repaid each of her 12 previous loans with Nadiya Ukraine.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more household goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Seyran

texts.en:
Mr. Seyran B. lives on a small income that is vulnerable. He is 42, married with three children, and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Mr. B. and his son (he is pictured) run the family business together. Mr. B. sells beef in the Saatli town, while his son grazes cattle. The income they have from cows is too low to support the family. That is why Mr. B. applied to Norwegian Microcredit Saatli branch for a loan of $500 to buy four calves to make his monthly income higher. The price of four calves: $400 The price of breeding: $100 The income from selling four breeded cows in half a year: $2,000

loans.use: To buy four calves.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Mrs. Stella O., who lives in a semi-urban area in Benin, is seeking a loan in the amount of $250 to help her improve her business. She is 39 years old and is a married mother of four children. She is a dedicated LAPO client who has 11 years of experience in her business.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, bread and drinks

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en:
Mr. I. earns a low income, which is vulnerable to the local economy. He is 32, married with three children, and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region

. He rents a barber's shop and at the end of each month pays the owner for the rent. But he sees that some of his customers are cutting their hair at another, nearby barber's shop because of its inventory.

Mr. I. is not so modern to keep competition at a high level. On the other hand, there is a school season coming up and as a rule all schoolchildren must cut their hair before going to school.

He believes that it is time to look for investment to buy new inventory immediately. He has applied for a loan of $500 to Normicro Saatli branch. After getting the loan, he plans to attract more customers and increase his daily income.

loans.use: To buy new inventory for barber shop.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Mrs. Regina O. travels from Benin to other states in Nigeria to buy traveling bags and boxes for sale. She is 48 years old and is married to Mr. O., and they have seven (7) children. She has been with LAPO for the past 5 years. She hails from Benin City and has been in this business since 1998.

loans.use: To buy more bags and boxes

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: "I have been in LAPO for the past 4 years, and my business needs a large sum of money, so I am asking for a loan of $800 to enable me to buy more baby wear to sell," says Mrs. Rose M.. She is a trustworthy LAPO client with a difference. She is married with seven (7) children, and hails from Benin City. She has been in this business since 1984 and hopes to expand her business if $800 is loaned to her. She is 43 years old.

loans.use: To buy more baby wear for sale

loans.name: Oduware

texts.en: Mrs. Oduware A. is a native of Benin, and is married to Mr. A.. They have 2 children. She started her business in 1990. She sells wrappers, jewelling & lace material to people living in her community. She is seeking a loan in the amount of $475 to enable her to improve her business. She is a trustworthy LAPO client. She is 38 years old.

loans.use: To buy more wrappers, lace & jewelling   for sale

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en: Mr. A. earns a low income. He is 30 and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. He has leased a butcher shop and pays for the rent. Each day he goes to Saatli villages to buy animals. Then he sells meat in his shop. He works long hours.  "If I had more capital, I would increase my turnover and income. Than I could afford to provide necessities of my life and life of my parents," he said. For this purpose, Mr. A. has applied for a $500 loan from Normicro Saatli branch.

loans.use: To expand volume of butcher shop business.

loans.name: Patience N.

texts.en: Mrs. Patience N. O. is 44 years old, and is married with 3 children. She runs a restaurant. She has been in business since 1987. She currently faces a lot of competition and as such has decided to attract more customers by increasing the variety of stock for her shop. She needs the loan of $1175 to buy more goods. She has been with LAPO for 3 years.

loans.use: To buy more drinks & food items

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Mrs. Rosemary I. is 36 years old, and is a happily married mother of 4 children. She hails from the urban sector of Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been with LAPO for 2 years as a secretary of her union. She has a boutique where she sells all kinds of women's clothes and she needs the loan amount of $1175 to buy more clothes for sale. She has been in this business since 1999.

loans.use: To buy more women's clothes

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mrs. Mercy A. is a 42 year old married woman with 7 children. She hails from the urban sector of Benin City, Nigeria. She has been a member of LAPO for a year. She buys timber, saws it into wood and sells to customers. She needs the loan of $1175 to enable her buy more timber for sales. She has been in this business since 2002.

loans.use: To buy more timber

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Mrs. Margret O., a 53-year-old woman, is married with six children. She lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She sells provisions, drinks and food. She is soliciting the loan amount of $400 to enable her to buy more drinks, food, and provisions. She has been in this business since 1996 and has been with LAPO for the past 3 years.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, drinks & food

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
Treasurer from the association Flor Naciente of Pro Mujer in Villa Adela, Mrs. Viviana Francisca I. collaborates with her concubine in the business of stone sculpting. This activity requires a lot of time and material. To help her partner, Viviana also works as a housekeeper. She invests all the money she makes in buying more sculpting tool, more stone and others where she makes baseboards, fountains and other handicrafts. She also buys machinery and replacements, but in this activity they have high costs. Because of this reason Viviana asks for a loan so she can buy the necessary tools and materials so she can keep working and meet the end of the year demands.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva Volunteer.

Tesorera de la asociación Flor Naciente de Pro Mujer en Villa Adela, Viviana Francisca I. colabora a su concubino en el negocio del tallado en piedra, actividad que requiere de tiempo y material adecuado. Para poder ayudar a su pareja Viviana trabaja como empleada doméstica. Todo el dinero que logra reunir invierte en la compra de material de tallado y corte de piedra laja, piedra comanche y otras en las que logra distintos trabajos, como ser zócalos, fuentes y principalmente artesanías. La compra de maquinaria y principalmente la compra de repuestos para esta actividad, tiene un costo elevado. Por tal motivo, Viviana precisa de dinero para poder comprar lo necesario para seguir trabajando y preparar su taller para la demanda de las fiestas de fin de año.

loans.use: Viviana  precisa de dinero para poder comprar lo necesario para seguir trabajando y preparar su taller para la demanda de las fiestas de fin de año.

loans.name: Reynalda

texts.es:
Reynalda G. Poma, is married and has four children all in school, she is the president of the Asociacion Alemania Pro Mujer (Women's group) in Villa Adela and she makes baby clothes. She also sells different baby products such as feeding bottles, little cars and others. She has been doing this activity since fifteen years ago and her main market is with fair merchants in El Alto. She is a wholeseller and sells her products by the dozen. Currently, Reynalda asks for capital to get merchandise, especially since the end of the year is approaching. She needs to travel for business purposes to the town of Desaguadero, which is where merchandise is concentrated and where most of her income is generated.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva Volunteer.

Reynalda Gutiérrez Poma, casada con cuatro hijos todos en edad escolar es presidenta de la Asociación Alemania de Pro Mujer en Villa Adela se dedica a la confección y venta de prendas de bebe, como también a la venta de artículos de bebe como ser cochecitos, biberones y otros. Ya son mas de quince años que Reynalda se dedica a esta actividad y su principal mercado se encuentra entre los comerciantes de las principales ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Ella es mayorista y vende sus productos por docena. Actualmente Reynalda precisa de capital para proveerse de mercadería principalmente para la venta de fin de año. Para este propósito ella necesita realizar viajes a la localidad de Desaguadero, lugar de concentración de la mercadería que ella vende y que genera su subsistencia.

loans.use: Reynalda precisa de capital para proveerse de mercadería principalmente para  la venta de fin de año. Para este propósito ella necesita realizar viajes a la localidad de Desaguadero, lugar de concentración de la mercadería que ella vende y que genera su subsistencia.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Mrs. Felicia I., a 52-year-old woman, is married with five children. She lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She sells foodstuff and fruits. She is soliciting the loan amount of $400 to enable her to expand her business and buy more foodstuff and fruits. She has been in this business since 1998 and has been with LAPO for past 3 years as a member.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuff and fruits

loans.name: Rosa Elia

texts.en:
The condition of my bathroom is unhygienic for my family. As such, I need to fix it and put in a floor. I am asking for $1200.00 dollars to work on my bathroom and put in a floor.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva Volunteer.

Las condiciones en las que esta el baño de mi casa ya son antihigiénicas para mi familia así es que necesito repararlo y poner el piso”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para preparar el baño y poner piso.

loans.use: Repair bathroom and install a floor in it.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes C. is married, she is the mother of five and she has been designing and making textiles from wool of alpaca, vicuña and thread. She sells these clothes in an ambulatory way in the fairs of her city El Alto. Her main market is in the city of Opuro, where she travels twice a week, mainly the days that there are fairs. Mrs. Mercedes needs the loan so she can continue traveling to Oruro. Since she gives her clothes on credit she cannot overlook her clients because she and her family depend from her business activity.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva Volunteer.

Mercedes C., casada y madre de cinco hijos, se dedica hace mas de veinte años a la confección de textiles de vicuña, alpaca e hilo, mismas que vende de forma ambulante en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Pero su principal mercado se encuentra en la ciudad de Oruro, donde ella viaja en un promedio de dos veces a la semana, principalmente en los días de feria de esa ciudad. Por esta razón Mercedes necesita de dinero para continuar realizando sus viajes a la ciudad de Oruro, puesto que la mercadería que ella produce, la vende a crédito y no puede descuidar a sus clientes, ya que de esta actividad depende ella y toda su familia.

loans.use: Mercedes necesita de dinero para continuar realizando sus viajes a la ciudad de Oruro, puesto que la mercadería que ella produce, la vende a crédito y no puede descuidar a sus clientes, ya que de esta actividad depende ella y toda su familia.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Mrs. Vivian O. is 41 years old and hails from Benin City. She is a married mother of seven children who sells provisions, drinks and recharge cards for all networks in Nigeria. She is asking for the loan amount of $400 to boost her business and buy more drinks and recharge cards. She is a dedicated LAPO woman. She has been with LAPO for 2 years.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, drinks and recharge cards

loans.name: Perpetual

texts.en: Mrs. Perpetual B. is a trader who sells provisions and drinks in her shop. She has been in business for the past 5 years. She is 57 years old and a married mother of eight children. She is also a member in the LAPO union and hopes to increase her business and buy more provisions and drinks with the loan amount of $400.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sale

loans.name: Cristian  Sergio

texts.es:
" I have a small business selling new & used clothes out of my home. My sells are good, but I would like to purchase more merchandise to offer my clients more of a variety since most of the things my clients want are very expensive. I'm requesting a loan in the amount of $600 to reinvest it in my business."

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

“Tengo una venta de ropa nueva y usada en mi casa y mis ventas son muy buenas, pero me gustaría invertir un poco más ya que mis clientes me piden cosas que no he podido comprar debido a que me cuestan más caras”. Solicito 600.00 dlls para invertirle a mi negocio.

loans.use: To reinvest in his business

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es:
"I have a big construction project that I need to do. I need to install a concrete roof over our bathroom. It has been very difficult due to the lack of money, but I'm currently working very hard to make sure my family lives in better conditions." I'm requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000 USD to install a concrete roof over my bathroom.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

"Tengo una construcción sin terminar y necesito poner techo de concreto en el baño de mi casa, me ha sido un poco difícil por falta de dinero pero estoy trabajando mucho para lograrlo y lograr que mi familia viva en mejores condiciones” Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para poner techo de concreto en el baño de mi vivienda.

loans.use: to build a new roof for the bathroom

loans.name: Erasmo

texts.es:
I have been selling home products over the past 2 years. I sell these items through the streets of Nuevo Laredo. My wife and I go out in the streets every morning to sell these items. We would like to purchase more inventory since this is our main source of income. We are requesting a loan in the amount of $1,200 usd to purchase more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo ya más de 2 años en la venta de artículos para la casa. Estos artículos los vendo por las calles de Nuevo Laredo. En el trabajamos mi esposa y yo salimos a vender todas las mañanas, queremos invertir en el negocio ya que este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de mi familia. Solicitamos un préstamo de $1,200.00 dlls para la compra de mercancía.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
"Due to the lack of money, I have not been able to install proper drainage in my bathroom. The conditions are becoming unbearable for me and my family. I would also like to install some flooring to stop the humidity. I'm requesting $900 USD to install proper drainage and flooring."

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

“Debido a la falta de dinero no he podido meter el drenaje en el baño de mi casa pero las condiciones de higienes ya no son favorables para mi familia así también me gustaría poner el piso para evitar humedad” $ 900.00 dlls para la instalación del drenaje en el baño y poner el piso”.

loans.use: To install drainage and flooring in the bathroom

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia has a stand in the Ocosingo Market where she sells sweets and candies. Her main clients are children from the town. She is 28 years old and has three children. She belongs to a group called Compañerismo 6 together with Ms. Maria del Carmen Hernández (who sells traditional foods) and Ms. Carmen López Cruz (who sells clothes). With your loans Patricia will invest in sweets and also buy a case in which she can exhibit her merchandise; Ms. Maria will invest in renting a store and purchase a better way of keeping it air conditioned; and Ms. Carmen will travel to Mesilla where she will buy a supply of clothes for a less expensive price. They all hope to increase their income.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva Volunteer.

Patricia, en el mercado de Ocosingo ella tiene un puesto donde vende dulces y golosinas y sus principales clientes son los niños del pueblo. Ella tiene 28 años, tres hijos y pertenece al grupo Compañerismo 6 junto con doña Maria del Carmen Hernández (vende comida tradicional) y doña Carmen López Cruz (vende ropa). Con sus préstamos Patricia invertirá en dulces y además se comprará una vitrina para exhibir su mercadería, doña María invertirá en rentar un local y la mejor forma de acondicionarlo y doña Carmen viajará a la Mesilla donde comprará un surtido de ropa más económica. Todas esperan con esto aumentar sus ingresos.

loans.use: Candy Sales

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe is 28 years old, married with two children. Her spouse works as a driver. Three years ago she decided to start a business selling shoes through a catalog and this allows her to help with the family budget. She joined a solidarity network called Solidario 12 together with Ms. Luz Esperanza Ruiz Gómez (who makes cheese, creams, and a local food called quesillos) and Ms. Consuelo Morales Cruz ( who also sells shoes via catalog). With this loan, Guadalupe and Consuelo will invest in the purchase of different sized shoes with a variety of designs and will divide the money among the women to sell credit to their clients. Ms. Luz will buy cooking utensils to better prepare her food.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva Volunteer.

GUADALUPE, tiene 28 años, casada, dos hijos y su esposo trabaja como chofer. Ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catalogo , desde hace tres años que se inició con este negocio y le permite ayudar al presupuesto familiar forma parte del grupo Solidario 12 junto con doña Luz Esperanza Ruiz Gómez ( hace queso , cremas, quesillos) y doña Consuelo Morales Cruz ( venta de zapatos por catalogo) .Con el préstamo Guadalupe y Consuelo invertirán comprando mas calzados de diferentes números y diseños y se repartirán entre ellas y venderán a sus clientes al crédito y doña Luz comprará implementos para mejor preparar sus alimentos .

.

loans.use: Shoe Sales via Catalog

loans.name: Judith Silvia

texts.es:
Judith dedicates her time to making memorabilia for different events such as baptisms, weddings, birthdays, etc. The designs are made up of plaster, wood, and stoneware. She has been making them for over 20 years. She is 38 years old and has three children. She belongs to the group Barrio Nuevo 4 together with Ms. Nereida Decelis Bautista (who sells fruits and vegetables) and Ms. Candelaria Guillen Martínez (who sells clothes). With this loan they will invest in supplies for their respective businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva Volunteer.

JUDITH, se dedica a hacer en forma manual recuerdos que se entregan en diferentes eventos tales como bautizos , casamientos, cumpleaños , etc. Los diseños son confeccionados en yeso, madera, loza y los crea desde hace 20 años. Ella tiene 38 años, tres hijos, forma parte del grupo Barrio Nuevo 4 junto con doña Nereida Decelis Bautista (vende frutas y verduras) y doña Candelaria Guillen Martínez (venta de ropa) Con el préstamo invertirán surtiendo sus negocios respectivos.

loans.use: Decorative Sales

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel is 53 years old and has two children. From her home she sells stuffed animals, platters and other articles associated with food and the home. She is part of a group called Barrio Nuevo 4 together with Amalia Penagos Domínguez (who sells food typical of the region). With this loan each of them will invest in the purchase of more products and be able to air condition the places where they sell their wares.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva Volunteer.

ISABEL, tiene 53 años dos hijos, ella vende en su casa peluches, trastes y en general muchos artículos para el consumo y el hogar .Forma parte del grupo Barrio Nuevo 4 junto con doña Amalia Penagos Domínguez (vende comida típica) Por lo tanto con el préstamo cada una de ellas invertirá en comprar mas productos y en acondicionar el lugar de ventas.

loans.use: Sales of articles for the home

loans.name: Emigdio

texts.en:
Emigdio is 36 years old, married and has two children. His auto repair shop is centrally located in the Cabanas area of the city of Caacupe. He got started in his trade by attending trade school in the city of San Lorenzo and later working as an apprentice with an uncle who owns an auto repair shop in Caacupe. He worked there for 10 years and gained the experience necessary to feel confident about his professional knowledge and ability.

Currently Emigdio runs his own auto repair shop from his home and has the most up to date equipment, thanks to other loans he received through the Paraguayan Foundation. In the beginning it was difficult, because customers didn't know him well, but thanks to the referrals and recommendations of customers, friends and family, he now has a well established clientele.

His biggest achievement has been taking risks and succeeding at being gainfully self-employed. Today he owns all the necessary tools and equipment to complete the most complex repair jobs. He also plans to expand his shop by adding a shed where he will be able to store engines and parts. He's requesting this loan to purchase a portable welding machine.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Emigdio 36 años, está casado y tiene 2 hijos, su taller está ubicado en una zona de mucha concurrencia en la compañía Cabañas de la ciudad de Caacupé, se inició en el oficio estudiando en un instituto en la ciudad de San Lorenzo y posteriormente en forma práctica con su tío quién es propietario de un taller de vehículo en la ciudad de Caacupé allí trabajó durante 10 años dónde adquirió la experiencia necesaria como para sentirse seguro dentro de lo que es su oficio. Actualmente Emigdio ya cuenta con su propio taller en su domicilio, con los equipos más modernos, que lo fue adquiriendo gracias a los préstamos que le otorgó la Fundación Paraguaya, al comienzo fue difícil porque los clientes tenían que conocer su trabajo, pero gracias a las recomendaciones de sus propios clientes, vecinos y amigos, hoy día ya cuenta con una clientela formada. Su principal logro dice ser el hecho de haber asumido riesgos y lograr la independencia laboral, hoy día ya cuenta con todos los equipos necesarios para realizar los trabajos más exigentes, además está pensando ampliar su taller con la construcción de un pequeño tinglado esto le permitirá tener más espacio para almacenar los motores de los vehículos. Solicita el crédito para comprar un soldador autógeno.

loans.use: To purchase a portable welding machine

loans.name: Carmen

texts.fr:
Carmen is 49 years old, married and has two children who help her tend her business. She has owned a small grocery and diner for 12 years.

She indicates that it was very difficult in the beginning, because she started out with a small kiosk selling only beverages and ice cream. Thanks to her family's help she was able to move ahead; her husband always helped her and other relatives even loaned her money to stock her small store. Today Carmen runs a well-stocked store and a diner where she serves all kinds of fast foods.

Carmen feels very fulfilled, because her business is growing and her main helpers are her children, who wait on customers and deal with vendors. One of her short term goals is to put the finishing touches on her house, such as flooring and paint; she also wants to help her chidren finish their studies so that they'll have access to better job opportunities.

Carmen tells us that this business allowed her to buy her own home, support her family and keep her children in school. She also credits the loans she received through the Paraguayan Foundation with helping her expand her business. She's requesting this loan to buy merchandise such as meats, milk, beverages, wine, sugar, yerba, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Carmen tiene 49, está casada y tiene 2 hijos, ellos ayudan a su madre a atender el negocio. Carmen posee una despensa y comedor, desde hace más de 12 años. Comenta, que su inicio fue bastante duro ya que empezó con un pequeño kiosco, con venta de bebidas de todo tipo y helados, pero gracias a la ayuda de su familia pudo salir adelante ya que su marido en todo momento la ayudaba e inclusive algunos familiares le prestaron dinero para comprar mercaderías para proveerse de capital. Hoy día Carmen posee una despensa bien surtida y un comedor donde vende distintos tipos de comidas rápidas. Ella se siente realizada ya que su negocio está creciendo y sus principales colaboradores son sus hijos, quiénes se encargan de la atención y de las compras de sus proveedores. Uno de sus objetivos a corto plazo es terminar su casa ya que actualmente aun le faltan pequeños detalles como piso, pintura, y por supuesto es seguir ayudando a sus hijos a que culminen sus estudios superiores, esto les permitirá tener oportunidades de acceder a un buen trabajo. Comenta que gracias a su negocio pudo comprar su casa propia, mantener a su familia y ayudar a sus hijos a capacitarse, también dice que los préstamos que le otorgó la Fundación Paraguaya le ayudo bastante a hacer crecer su negocio. Ella desea hoy un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de mercaderías como carne, leche, bebidas, vino, azúcar, yerba, etc.

loans.use: to purchase meats, milk, beverages, wine, sugar and yerba mate

loans.name: Carmelo

texts.en:
Carmelo is 50 years old, married and has 3 children. He owns a small grocery store, which he first opened 20 years ago. His store is well known in the neighborhood due to the fact that he has been able to keep it well stocked with loans received through the Paraguayan Foundation.

He has plans to expand the store this summer, as he isn't currently able to display all his stock because of limited space. Don Carmelo tells us he's a fighter and that this line of work requires much sacrifice, as he must work everyday, including weekends, starting at 5 am and going well into the evening. In spite of this, he feels very fortunate to have his own business, to be able to support his family and to provide his children with a good education.

His principal customers are the area office workers as well as factory workers from a nearby ceramics factory. Besides running the grocery store, he also serves breakfast and lunch. He is requesting this loan to purchase meats, sugar, milk, flour, beer, wine, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Carmelo, tiene 50 años, está casado y tiene 3 hijos, posee una despensa en su domicilio, el negocio lo habilitó hace más de 20 años y es muy conocida su despensa en el barrio, ya que gracias a los préstamos que le otorgó la Fundación Paraguaya pudo surtir bien su negocio. Tiene pensado para este verano ampliar su despensa ya que no está pudiendo exhibir todas las mercaderías que tiene en stock, por el espacio muy reducido con que cuenta actualmente dentro de la despensa. Don Carmelo dice que es un luchador por lo sacrificado que es éste rubro, ya que uno debe trabajar todos los días, inclusive sin descansar los fines de semana. A parte la atención se inicia desde las 05:00 am hasta la noche. A pesar de esto él se siente muy contento porque maneja su propio negocio y con esto mantiene los gastos de su familia y también le permite dar una buena educación a sus hijos. Sus principales clientes son los oficinistas de la zona, como así también los obreros de la fábrica de cerámicas del barrio a quiénes también él da el servicio de desayunos y almuerzos. Desea un crédito para comprar carne, azúcar, leche, harina, cerveza, vino, etc.

loans.use: To purchase meats, sugar, milk, beer, wine, etc.

loans.name: Jamaladdin

texts.en: Mr. Jamaladdin F. is an internally displaced person ( IDP) from the Azerbaijan-Armenian conflict in the territory of Fizuly. He fled to Baku in 1993. He is 29 years old. He is married and has a child. He began his business with $300 in 2003.  He borrowed that loan of $300 from Normicro to rent a place for a bakery. The second time he borrowed $500, which he used to increase pastry production. Now Mr. F. would like to receive a $1,000 loan to buy a new kneading machine. The new machine would increase the store's inventory. He believes that by expanding his inventory, he will improve the living conditions of  his family. He will repay the loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To buy kneading machine

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Just because she left school at an early age doesn't stop Rosa from trying her best to start a business. She is newly married and has plans for her family. She joined Kiva last month when her vegetable garden needed help.  She will use her loan to buy weedkiller, fertilizer, and other materials to keep her garden healthy.  She get on average $150.00-200.00 a week from selling vegetables.

loans.use: To buy weedkiller, fertilizers, foschek fungicide.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is 32 years old, married, and in spite of being so young already has 4 children between the ages of 3 and 14. Her two eldest children attend high school, another is in 5th grade of elementary school, and the youngest has yet to begin school.

Edith recounted with much sadness how she had to work very hard for 10 years in the neighboring country of Argentina, where she managed to start a small dressmaking business after a lot of sacrifices.

With a strong desire to return to Paraguay, Edith sold all of her sewing machines to make enough money to move back. With what she could earn from the sale of her machines, she managed to return to Paraguay, build a house, and start a small convenience store business out of her house.

She started out buying a few goods to sell in her store. With time the business improved, and she began expanding her inventory. Today she is building an additional room to start a small hamburger restaurant. To do this, Edith needs a loan of $800US in order to buy the building materials she needs to finish the room.

Her dream for the future is that her children will be professionals; and, above all, that they will be able to work in their own country without having to immigrate to find work.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Hana

texts.en: Some people think that only men can be farmers.  Hana proves this belief wrong. She is only 31 years old and joined SPBD when she heard about it from other ladies. Initially she bought vegetable seeds from the agriculture shop and started growing a garden. After three months, she started taking her vegetables to the market to sell and that is how she gets money to support her family.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and fertilizers
